sanskrit: प्रथमोपदेश:
transliteration: prathamopadeśaḥ
translation_danish: Første belæring
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: श्रीआदिनाथाय नमोऽस्तु तस्मै येनोपदिष्टा हठयोगविद्या । विभ्राजते प्रोन्नतराजयोगमारोढुमिच्छोरधिरोहिणीव  ॥१॥
transliteration: śrīādināthāya namo'stu tasmai yenopadiṣṭā haṭhayogavidyā | vibhrājate pronnatarājayogam āroḍhum icchor adhirohiṇīva || 1.1 ||
translation_danish: [1.1] En ærbødig hilsen til den glorværdige oprindelige Herre Śiva, som introducerede visdommen om haṭhayoga. Haṭhayoga fremtræder som en stige for den, der stræber efter den ophøjede rājayoga.[NOTE1]
notes_translation_danish: [NOTE1] Rājayoga refererer i Haṭhapradīpikā til den højeste bevidsthedstilstand samādhi og ikke til Patañjalis yoga. Rājayoga behandles indgående i fjerde kapitel som samādhi.
translation_english: [1.1] Salutation to ādinātha (Śiva) who expounded the knowledge of Haṭha Yoga, which like a staircase leads the aspirant to the high pinnacled Rāja Yoga.

sanskrit: प्रणम्य श्रीगुरुं नाथं स्वात्मारामेण योगिना । केवलं राजयोगाय हठविद्योपदिष्यते  ॥२॥
transliteration: praṇamya śrīguruṃ nāthaṃ svātmārāmeṇa yoginā | kevalaṃ rājayogāya haṭhavidyopadiśyate || 1.2 ||
translation_danish: [1.2] Med en ærbødig hilsen til den glorværdige guru, Herren Śiva, udlægger yogien Svātmārāma læren om haṭhayoga med rājayoga for øje.
translation_english: [1.2] Yogin Swātmārāma, after saluting first his Gurū Srinātha explains Haṭha Yoga for the attainment of Raja Yoga.

sanskrit: भ्रान्त्या बहुमतध्वान्ते राजयोगमजानताम् । हठप्रदीपिकां धत्ते स्वात्मारामः कृपाकरः  ॥३॥
transliteration: bhrāntyā bahumatadhvānte rājayogam ajānatām | haṭhapradīpikāṃ dhatte svātmārāmaḥ kr̥pākaraḥ || 1.3 ||
translation_danish: [1.3] Den medfølende Svātmārāma sætter haṭhayogaens lys frem for dem, som er uden indsigt i rājayoga, eftersom de vandrer forvildet rundt i de mange doktriners nat.
translation_english: [1.3] Owing to the darkness arising from the multiplicity of opinions people are unable to know the Rāja Yoga. Compassionate Swātmārāma composes the Haṭha Yoga Pradipikā like a torch to dispel it.

sanskrit: हठविद्यां हि मत्स्येन्द्रगोरक्षाद्या विजानते । स्वात्मारामोऽथवा योगी जानीते तत्प्रसादतः  ॥४॥
transliteration: haṭhavidyāṃ hi matsyendragorakṣādyā vijānate | svātmārāmo'thavā yogī jānīte tatprasādataḥ || 1.4 ||
translation_danish: [1.4] Han har sand indsigt i visdommen om haṭhayoga i kraft af Matsyendra, Gorakṣa med flere, eller rettere: yogien Svātmārāma har sand indsigt ved deres gunst.
translation_english: [1.4] Matsyendra, Gorakṣa, etc., knew Haṭha Vidyā, and by their favour Yogī Swātmārāma also learnt it from them. [1.4] The following Siddhas (masters) are said to have existed in former times:—

sanskrit: श्रीआदिनाथमत्स्येन्द्रशावरानन्दभैरवाः । चौरगीमीनगोरक्षविरूपाक्षबिलेशयाः ॥५॥ मन्थानो भैरवो योगी सिद्धिर्बुद्धश्च कन्थडिः। कोरण्टकःसुरानन्दः सिद्धपादश्च चर्पटिः  ॥६॥ कानेरी पूज्यपादश्च नित्यनाथो निरञ्जनः । कपाली बिन्दुनाथश्च काकचण्डीश्वराह्वयः ॥७॥ अल्लामः प्रभुदेवश्च घोडा चोली च टिण्टिणिः । भानुकी नारदेवश्च खण्डः कापालिकस्तथा ॥८॥ इत्यादयो महासिद्धा हठयोगप्रभावतः । खण्डयित्वा कालदण्डं ब्रह्माण्डे विचरन्ति ते ॥९॥
transliteration: śrīādināthamatsyendraśāvarānandabhairavāḥ | cauraṅgīmīnagorakṣavirūpākṣabileśayāḥ || 1.5 || manthāno bhairavo yogī siddhir buddhaś ca kanthaḍiḥ | koraṇṭakaḥ surānandaḥ siddhapādaś ca carpaṭiḥ || 1.6 || kānerī pūjyapādaś ca nityanātho nirañjanaḥ | kapālī bindunāthaś ca kākacaṇḍīśvarāhvayaḥ || 1.7 || allāmaḥ prabhudevaś ca ghoḍā colī ca ṭiṇṭiṇiḥ | bhānukī nāradevaś ca khaṇḍaḥ kāpālikas tathā || 1.8 || ity ādayo mahāsiddhā haṭhayogaprabhāvataḥ | khaṇḍayitvā kāladaṇḍaṃ brahmāṇḍe vicaranti te || 1.9 ||
translation_danish: [1.5-9] Den glorværdige oprindelige Herre Śiva, Matsyendra, Śābara, Ānandabhairava, Cauraṅgin, Mīna, Gorakṣa, Virūpākṣa, Bileśaya, Manthāna, Bhairava Yogī, Siddhi Buddha og Kanthaḍi, Koraṇṭaka, Surānanda, Siddhapāda og Carpaṭi, Kānerin, Pūjyapāda, Nityanātha, Nirañjana, Kapālin, Bindunātha og Kākacaṇḍīśvara, Allāma Prabhudeva, Ghoḍācolin og Ṭiṇṭiṇi, Bhānukin, Nāradeva og Khaṇḍa Kāpālika med flere. Efter disse Mahāsiddhaer [NOTE1] ved haṭhayogaens kraft har knust dødens scepter, bevæger de sig frit i Brahmās æg. [NOTE2]
notes_translation_danish:
[NOTE1] Mahāsiddhaer, “store mestre”.

[NOTE2] Brahmās æg er det hinduistiske kosmos, der omfatter 21 verdensetager: seks himle, jorden, syv underverdener og syv helveder.
translation_english: [1.5] Sri ādinātha (Śiva), Matsyendra, Nātha, Sābar, Anand, Bhairava, Chaurangi, Mīna nātha, Gorakṣanātha, Virupākṣa, Bileśaya. [1.6] Manthāna, Bhairava, Siddhi Buddha, Kanthadi, Karantaka, Surānanda, Siddhipāda, Charapati. [1.7] Kānerī, Pūjyapāda, Nityanātha, Nirañjana, Kapāli, Vindunātha, Kāka Chandīśwara. [1.8] Allāma, Prabhudeva, Ghodā, Cholī, Tintiṇi, Bhānukī Nārdeva, Khanda Kāpālika, etc. [1.9] These Mahāsiddhas (great masters), breaking the sceptre of death, are roaming in the universe.

sanskrit: अशेषतापतप्तानां समाश्रयमठो हठः । अशेषयोगयुक्तानामाधारकमठो हठः ॥१०॥
transliteration: aśeṣatāpataptānāṃ samāśrayamaṭho haṭhaḥ | aśeṣayogayuktānām ādhārakamaṭho haṭhaḥ || 1.10 ||
translation_danish: [1.10] Haṭhayoga er tilflugtsstedet for dem, der lider under alverdens plager. Haṭhayoga er grundlaget for dem, som er optaget af alverdens yoga.
translation_english: [1.10] Like a house protecting one from the heat of the sun, Haṭha Yoga protects its practiser from the burning heat of the three Tāpas; and, similarly, it is the supporting tortoise, as it were, for those who are constantly devoted to the practice of Yoga.

sanskrit: हठविद्या परं गोप्या योगिनां सिद्धिमिच्छता । भवेद्वीर्यवती गुप्ता निर्वीर्या तु प्रकाशिता ॥११॥
transliteration: haṭhavidyā paraṃ gopyā yoginām  siddhim icchatā | bhaved vīryavatī guptā nirvīryā tu prakāśitā || 1.11 ||
translation_danish: [1.11] Visdommen om haṭhayoga bør holdes yderst hemmelig af den yogi, der begærer fuldkomne siddhier. Holdes haṭhayoga hemmelig, er den kraftfuld - i modsat fald er den uden kraft.
translation_english: [1.11] A Yogī desirous of success should keep the knowledge of Haṭha Yoga secret; for it becomes potent by concealing, and impotent by exposing.

sanskrit: सुराज्ये धार्मिके देशे सुभिक्षे निरुपद्रवे । धनुः प्रमाणपर्यन्तं शिलाग्निजलवर्जिते । एकान्ते मठिकामध्ये स्थातव्यं हठयोगिना ॥१२॥
transliteration: surājye dhārmike deśe subhikṣe nirupadrave | dhanuḥ pramāṇaparyantaṃ śilāgnijalavarjite | ekānte maṭhikāmadhye sthātavyaṃ haṭhayoginā || 1.12
translation_danish: [1.12] Haṭhayogien bør opholde sig i et velregeret, retfærdigt, rigt og fredeligt land på et øde sted i en lille hytte, der måler en dhanus,  og som er fri for ild, vand og sten.
translation_english: [1.12] The Yogī should practise Haṭha Yoga in a small room, situated in a solitary place, being 4 cubits square, and free from stones, fire, water, disturbances of all kinds, and in a country where justice is properly administered, where good people live, and food can be obtained easily and plentifully.

sanskrit: अल्पद्वारमरन्ध्रगर्तविवरं नात्युच्चनीचायतं सम्यग्गोमयसान्द्रलिप्तममलं निःशेसजन्तूज्झितम् । बाह्ये मण्डपवेदिकूपरुचिरं प्राकारसंवेष्टितं प्रोक्तं योगमठस्य लक्षणमिदं सिद्धैर्हठाभ्यासिभिः ॥१३॥
transliteration: alpadvāram arandhragartavivaraṃ nātyuccanīcāyataṃ samyaggomayasāndraliptam amalaṃ niḥśesajantūjjhitam | bāhye maṇḍapavedikūparuciraṃ prākārasaṃveṣṭitaṃ proktaṃ yogamaṭhasya lakṣaṇam idaṃ siddhair haṭhābhyāsibhiḥ || 1.13 ||
translation_danish: [1.13] Dette siges at være yogahyttens kendetegn ifølge de fuldendte haṭhayogaudøvere: en lille dør, ingen åbninger, huller eller fordybninger, ikke overdreven høj, lav eller lang, velsmurt med et tykt lag komøg, ren og helt fri for insekter. Området udenfor afgrænses af en mur og prydes af en åben hal, et ildalter og en brønd.
translation_english: [1.13] The room should have a small door, be free from holes, hollows, neither too high nor too low, well plastered with cow-dung and free from dirt, filth and insects. On its outside there should be bowers, raised platform (chabootrā), a well, and a compound. These characteristics of a room for Haṭha Yogīs have been described by adepts in the practice of Haṭha.

sanskrit: एवं विधे मठे स्थित्वा सर्वचिन्ताविवर्जितः । गुरूपदिष्टमार्गेण योगमेव समभ्यसेत् ॥१४॥
transliteration: evaṃ vidhe maṭhe sthitvā sarvacintāvivarjitaḥ | gurūpadiṣṭamārgeṇa yogam eva samabhyaset || 1.14 ||
translation_danish: [1.14] Idet yogien opholder sig i en sådan hytte bør han praktisere yoga uafhængigt af alle tanker som anvist af sin guru.
translation_english: [1.14] Having seated in such a room and free from all anxieties, he should practise Yoga, as instructed by his guru.

sanskrit: अत्याहारः प्रयासश्च प्रजल्पो नियमाग्रहः । जनसङ्गश्च लौल्यं च षड्भिर्योगो विनश्यति ॥१५॥
transliteration: atyāhāraḥ prayāsaś ca prajalpo niyamāgrahaḥ | janasaṅgaś ca laulyaṃ ca ṣaḍbhir yogo vinaśyati || 1.15 ||
translation_danish: [1.15] Yogapraksis ødelægges ved disse seks: overspisning, overanstrengelse, snakkesalighed, pedanteri, social omgang og rastløshed.
translation_english: [1.15] Yoga is destroyed by the following six causes:—Over-eating, exertion, talkativeness, adhering to rules, i.e., cold bath in the morning, eating at night, or eating fruits only, company of men, and unsteadiness.

sanskrit: उत्साहात्साहसाद्धैर्यात्तत्त्वज्ञानाच्च निश्चयात् । जनसङ्गपरित्यागात्षड्भिर्योगः प्रसिद्ध्यति ॥१६॥
transliteration: utsāhāt sāhasād dhairyāt tattvajñānāś ca niścayāt | janasaṅgaparityāgāt ṣaḍbhir yogaḥ prasiddhyati || 1.16 ||
translation_danish: [1.16] Yogapraksis fuldendes ved disse seks: viljestyrke, vovemod, tålmodighed, viden, beslutsomhed og forsagelse af social omgang. Dette er āsanaer:
translation_english: [1.16] The following six bring speedy success:—Courage, daring, perseverance, discriminative knowledge, faith, aloofness. from company.

sanskrit: अथ आसनम् हठस्य प्रथमाङ्गत्वादासनं पूर्वमुच्यते । कुर्यात्तदासनं स्थैर्यमारोग्यं चाङ्गलाघवम् ॥१७॥
transliteration: atha āsanam haṭhasya prathamāṅgatvād āsanaṃ pūrvam ucyate | kuryāt tad āsanaṃ sthairyam ārogyaṃ cāṅgalāghavam || 1.17 ||
translation_danish: [1.17] Første led i haṭhayoga er āsanaer,  som derfor omtales først. Āsanaer medfører stabilitet, sundhed og smidige lemmer.
translation_english: [1.17] The ten rules of conduct are: ahiṃsā (non-injuring), truth, non-stealing, continence, forgiveness, endurance, compassion, meekness, sparing diet and cleanliness.

sanskrit: वसिष्ठाद्यैश्च मुनिभिर्मत्स्येन्द्राद्यैश्च योगिभिः । अङ्गीकृतान्यासनानि कथ्यन्ते कानिचिन्मया ॥१८॥
transliteration: vasiṣṭhādyaiś ca munibhir matsyendrādyaiś ca yogibhiḥ | aṅgīkr̥tāny āsanāni kathyante kānicin mayā || 1.18 ||
translation_danish: [1.18] Jeg vil nu forklare nogle āsanaer anerkendt af både munier som Vasiṣṭha og yogier som Matsyendra.
translation_english: [1.18] The ten niyamas mentioned by those proficient in the knowledge of yoga are: Tapa, patience, belief in God, charity, adoration of God, hearing discourses on the principles of religion, shame, intellect, Tapa and Yajña.

sanskrit: जानूर्वोरन्तरे सम्यक्कृत्वा पादतले उभे । ऋजुकायः समासीनः स्वस्तिकं तत्प्रचक्षते ॥१९॥
transliteration: jānūrvor antare samyak kr̥tvā pādatale ubhe || r̥jukāyaḥ samāsīnaḥ svastikaṃ tat pracakṣate || 1.19 ||
translation_danish: [1.19] Dette anses for Svastikāsana:  At sidde med ret ryg efter at have placeret begge fodsåler nøjagtigt på indersiden af knæ og lår.
translation_english: [1.19] Being the first accessory of Haṭha Yoga, āsana is described first. It should be practised for gaining steady posture, health and lightness of body.

sanskrit: सव्ये दक्षिणगुल्फं तु पृष्ठपार्श्वे नियोजयेत् । दक्षिणेऽपि तथा सव्यं गोमुखं गोमुखाकृति ॥२०॥
transliteration: savye dakṣiṇagulphaṃ tu pr̥ṣṭhapārśve niyojayet | dakṣiṇe'pi tathā savyaṃ gomukhaṃ gomukhākr̥ti || 1.20 ||
translation_danish: [1.20] Man placerer højre ankel på den venstre balles side; ligeledes venstre på højre. Gomukhāsana  ligner et kohoved. Svastikāsana
translation_english: [1.20] I am going to describe certain āsanas which have been adopted by Munīs like Vasiṣṭha, etc., and Yogīs like Matsyendra, etc.

sanskrit: एकं पादमथैकस्मिन्विन्यसेदुरुणि स्थिरम् । इतरस्मिंस्तथा चोरुं वीरासनमितीरितम् ॥२१॥
transliteration: ekaṃ pādam athaikasmin vinyased uruṇi sthiram | itarasmiṃs tathā coruṃ vīrāsanam itīritam || 1.21 ||
translation_danish: [1.21] Ligeså placerer man den ene fod på det ene lår og låret på den anden. Denne stilling kaldes Vīrāsana.
translation_english: [1.21] Having kept both the hands under both the thighs, with the body straight, when one sits calmly in this posture, it is called Swastika.

sanskrit: गुदं निरुध्य गुल्फाभ्यां व्युत्क्रमेण समाहितः । कूर्मासनं भवेदेतदिति योगविदो विदुः ॥२२॥
transliteration: gudaṃ nirudhya gulphābhyāṃ vyutkrameṇa samāhitaḥ | kūrmāsanaṃ bhaved etad iti yogavido viduḥ || 1.22 ||
translation_danish: [1.22] Man blokerer anus med krydsede ankler og sidder rank. Dette vil være det, de yoga-kyndige kalder Kūrmāsana.
translation_english: [1.22] Placing the right ankle on the left side and the left ankle on the right side, makes Gomukha-āsana, having the appearance of a cow.

sanskrit: पद्मासनं तु संस्थाप्य जानूर्वोरन्तरे करौ । निवेश्य भूमौ संस्थाप्य व्योमस्थं कुक्कुटासनम् ॥२३॥
transliteration: padmāsanaṃ tu saṃsthāpya jānūrvor antare karau | niveśya bhūmau saṃsthāpya vyomasthaṃ kukkuṭāsanam || 1.23 ||
translation_danish: [1.23] Siddende i Padmāsana  føres begge hænder ind mellem knæ og lår og placeres på jorden. Kukkuṭāsana  er en svævende stilling.
translation_english: [1.23] One foot is to be placed on the thigh of the opposite side; and so also the other foot on the opposite thigh. This is called Vīrāsana.

sanskrit: कुक्कुटासनबन्धस्थो दोर्भ्यां सम्बध्य कन्धराम् । शेते कूर्मवदुत्तान एतदुत्तानकूर्मकम् ॥२४॥
transliteration: kukkuṭāsanabandhastho dorbhyāṃ sambadhya kandharām | śete kūrmavad uttāna etad uttānakūrmakam || 1.24 ||
translation_danish: [1.24] Man forbinder nakken med armene mens man er fastlåst i Kukkuṭāsana og ligger som en skildpadde på ryggen. Dette er Uttānakūrmakāsana.
translation_english: [1.24] Placing the right ankle on the left side of anus, and the left ankle on the right side of it, makes what the Yogīs call Kūrma-āsana.

sanskrit: पादाङ्गुष्ठौ तु पाणिभ्यां गृहीत्वा श्रवणावधि । धनुराकर्षणं कुर्याद्धनुरासनमुच्यते ॥२५॥
transliteration: pādāṅguṣṭhau tu pāṇibhyāṃ gr̥hītvā śravaṇāvadhi | dhanur ākarṣaṇaṃ kuryād dhanurāsanam ucyate || 1.25 ||
translation_danish: [1.25] Man fører begge fødders storetæer med hænderne op til ørerne og spænder som en bue. Denne stilling kaldes Dhanurāsana.
translation_english: [1.25] Taking the posture of Padma-āsana and carrying the hands under the thighs, when the Yogī raises himself above the ground, with his palms resting on the ground, it becomes Kukkuṭa-āsana.

sanskrit: वामोरुमूलार्पितदक्षपादं जानोर्बहिर्वेष्टितवामपादम् । प्रगृह्य तिष्ठेत्परिवर्तिताङ्गः श्रीमत्य्सनाथोदितमासनं स्यात् ॥२६॥
transliteration: vāmorumūlārpitadakṣapādaṃ jānor bahir veṣṭitavāmapādam | pragr̥hya tiṣṭhet parivartitāṅgaḥ śrīmatysanāthoditam āsanaṃ syāt || 1.26 ||
translation_danish: [1.26] Man tager fat i højre fod, der er placeret ved roden af venstre lår, og fat i venstre fod, der er placeret på ydersiden af knæet og sidder med kroppen drejet. Denne āsana er anvist af den glorværdige Matsyendranātha.
translation_english: [1.26] Having assumed Kukkuṭa-āsana, when one grasps his neck by crossing his hands behind his head, and lies in this posture with his back touching the ground, it becomes Uttāna Kūrma-āsana, from its appearance like that of a tortoise.

sanskrit: मत्स्येन्द्रपीठं जठरप्रदीप्तिं प्रचण्डरुग्मण्डलखण्डनास्त्रम् । अभ्यासतः कुण्डलिनीप्रबोधं चन्द्रस्थिरत्वं च ददाति पुंसाम् ॥२७॥
transliteration: matsyendrapīṭhaṃ jaṭharapradīptiṃ pracaṇḍarug maṇḍalakhaṇḍanāstram | abhyāsataḥ kuṇḍalinīprabodhaṃ candrasthiratvaṃ ca dadāti puṃsām || 1.27 ||
translation_danish: [1.27] Matsyendranātha-stillingen er glimrende for maven  og et ødelæggende våben mod en mængde voldsomme sygdomme; ved gentagen praksis vækker den Kuṇḍalinī  og giver stabilitet i månen  for mænd.
translation_english: [1.27] Having caught the toes of the feet with both the hands and carried them to the ears by drawing the body like a bow, it becomes Dhanura āsana.

sanskrit: प्रसार्य पादौ भुवि दण्डरूपौ दोर्भ्यां पदाग्रद्वितयं गृहीत्वा । जानूपरिन्यस्तलाटदेशो वसेदिदं पश्चिमतानमाहुः ॥२८॥
transliteration: prasārya pādau bhuvi daṇḍarūpau dorbhyāṃ padāgradvitayaṃ gr̥hītvā | jānūparinyastalalāṭadeśo vased idaṃ paścimatānam āhuḥ || 1.28 ||
translation_danish: [1.28] Man strækker begge fødder frem på jorden som to stave, tager fat i spidsen af begge fødder og hviler med panden på knæene. Denne āsana kaldes Paścimatāna.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: इति पश्चिमतानमासनाग्र्यं पवनं पश्चिमवाहिनं करोति । उदयं जठरानलस्य कुर्याद् उदरे कार्श्यमरोगतां च पुंसाम् ॥२९॥
transliteration: iti paścimatānam āsanāgryaṃ pavanaṃ paścimavāhinaṃ karoti | udayaṃ jaṭharānalasya kuryād udare kārśyam arogatāṃ ca puṃsām || 1.29 ||
translation_danish: [1.29] Paścimatāna er den ypperste āsana, som får åndedrættet til at strømme bagud; den vil få mavens forbrænding til at blusse op, gøre maven slankere og holde mænd fri for sygdom.
translation_english: [1.29] Having placed the right foot at the root of the left thigh, let the toe be grasped with the right hand passing over the back, and having placed the left foot on the right thigh at its root, let it be grasped with the left hand passing behind the back. This is the āsana, as explained by Śri Matsyanātha. It increases appetite and is an instrument for destroying the group of the most deadly diseases. Its practice awakens the Kundalinī, stops the nectar shedding from the moon in people.

sanskrit: धरामवष्टभ्य करद्वयेन तत्कूर्परस्थापितनाभिपार्श्वः । उच्चासनो दण्डवदुत्थितः खे मायूरमेतत्प्रदन्ति पीठम् ॥३०॥
transliteration: dharām avaṣṭabhya karadvayena tatkūrparasthāpitanābhipārśvaḥ | uccāsano daṇḍavad utthitaḥ khe māyūram etat pravadanti pīṭham || 1.30 ||
translation_danish: [1.30] Støt med begge hænder på jorden med albuerne placeret i siderne ud for navlen. Denne ophøjede āsana er hævet i luften som en stav. De kalder den Māyūrāsana.
translation_english: [1.30] Having stretched the feet on the ground, like a stick, and having grasped the toes of both the feet with both the hands, when one sits with his forehead resting on the thighs, it is called Paśchima Tāna.

sanskrit: हरति सकलरोगानाशु गुल्मोदरादीन् अभिभवति च दोषानासनं श्रीमयूरम् । बहु कदशनभुक्तं भस्म कुर्यादशेषं जनयति जठराग्निं जारयेत्कालकूटम् ॥३१॥
transliteration: harati sakalarogān āśu gulmodarādīn abhibhavati ca doṣān āsanaṃ śrīmayūram | bahu kadaśanabhuktaṃ bhasma kuryād aśeṣaṃ janayati jaṭharāgniṃ jārayet kālakūṭam || 1.31 ||
translation_danish: [1.31] Den glorværdige Māyūrāsana udrydder hurtigt alle sygdomme og overvinder svigtende milt, dårlig mave og så videre. Den antænder mavens ild og forvandler den indtagne dårlige mad til aske og gør kālakūṭa  spiselig.
translation_english: [1.31] This Paśchima Tāna carries the air from the front to the back part of the body (i.e., to the suṣumna). It kindles gastric fire, reduces obesity and cures all diseases of men.

sanskrit: उत्तानं शववद्भूमौ शयनं तच्छवासनम् । शवासनं श्रान्तिहरं चित्तविश्रान्तिकारकम् ॥३२॥
transliteration: uttānaṃ śavavad bhūmau śayanaṃ tac chavāsanam | śavāsanaṃ śrāntiharaṃ cittaviśrāntikārakam || 1.32 ||
translation_danish: [1.32] Liggende udstrakt på jorden som et lig - dette er Śavāsana.  Śavāsana fordriver sløvhed og skærper sindet.
translation_english: [1.32] Place the palms of both the hands on the ground, and place the navel on both the elbows and balancing thus, the body should be stretched backward like a stick. This is called Mayūra-āsana.

sanskrit: चतुरशीत्यासनानि शिवेन कथितानि च । तेभ्यश्चतुष्कमादाय सारभूतं ब्रवीम्यहम् ॥३३॥
transliteration: caturaśīty āsanāni śivena kathitāni ca | tebhyaś catuṣkam ādāya sārabhūtaṃ bravīmy aham || 1.33 ||
translation_danish: [1.33] Śiva fremlagde 84 āsanaer, hvoraf jeg nu vil beskrive de fire mest essentielle:
translation_english: [1.33] This āsana soon destroys all diseases, and removes abdominal disorders, and also those arising from irregularities of phlegm, bile and wind, digests unwholesome food taken in excess, increases appetite and destroys the most deadly poison.

sanskrit: सिद्धं पद्मं तथा सिंहं भद्रं वेति चतुष्टयम् । श्रेष्ठं तत्रापि च सुखे तिष्ठेत्सिद्धासने सदा ॥३४॥
transliteration: siddhaṃ padmaṃ tathā siṃhaṃ bhadraṃ veti catuṣṭayam | śreṣṭhaṃ tatrāpi ca sukhe tiṣṭhet siddhāsane sadā || 1.34 ||
translation_danish: [1.34] De fire essentielle āsanaer kaldes Siddha-, Padma-, Siṃha- og Bhadrāsana.  Af disse bør man altid inkludere den lykkebringende Siddhāsana. Dette er Siddhāsana:
translation_english: [1.34] Lying down on the ground, like a corpse, is called Śava-āsana. It removes fatigue and gives rest to the mind.

sanskrit: तत्र सिद्धासनम् योनिस्थानकमङ्घ्रिमूलघटितं कृत्वा दृढं विन्यसेत् मेण्ढ्रे पादमथैकमेव हृदये कृत्वा हनुं सुस्थिरम् । स्थाणुः संयमितेन्द्रियोऽचलदृशा पश्येद्भ्रुवोरन्तरं ह्येतन्मोक्षकपाटभेदजनकं सिद्धासनं प्रोच्यते ॥३५॥
transliteration: tatra siddhāsanam yonisthānakam aṅghrimūlaghaṭitaṃ kr̥tvā dr̥ḍhaṃ vinyaset meṇḍhre pādam athaikam eva hr̥daye kr̥tvā hanuṃ susthiram | sthāṇuḥ saṃyamitendriyo'caladr̥śā paśyed bhruvor antaraṃ hy etan mokṣakapāṭabhedajanakaṃ siddhāsanaṃ procyate || 1.35 ||
translation_danish: [1.35] Anbring hælen, hvor skeden har plads,  og læg den anden fod, så den presser mod stedet, hvor penis er placeret. Pres hagen mod hjertet. Forbliv ubevægelig med tøjlede sanser. Se med fast blik direkte mellem øjenbrynene. Denne āsana sprænger døren åben til mokṣa  og benævnes Siddhāsana. Men en anden skole siger:
translation_english: [1.35] Śiva taught 84 āsanas. Of these the first four being essential ones, I am going to explain them here.

sanskrit: मतान्तरे तु मेढ्रादुपरि विन्यस्य सव्यं गुल्फं तथोपरि । गुल्फान्तरं च निक्षिप्य सिद्धासनमिदं भवेत् ॥३६॥ मतान्तरे तु
transliteration: matāntare tu meḍhrād upari vinyasya savyaṃ gulphaṃ tathopari | gulphāntaraṃ ca nikṣipya siddhāsanam idaṃ bhavet || 1.36 ||
translation_danish: [1.36] Venstre ankel bør placeres over penis. Efter at have anbragt den dér, bør højre ankel placeres oven på venstre ankel. Sådan bør Siddhāsana være. Hertil siger en anden fuldkommen skole, nemlig Matsyendras gamle skole:
translation_english: [1.36] These four are:—The Siddha, Padma, Sinha and Bhadra. Even of these, the Siddha-āsana, being very comfortable, one should always practise it.

sanskrit: पश्चादुक्तमन्यसिद्धं मतम्पूर्वमेवमत्स्येन्द्रमतम् । एतत्सिद्धासनं प्राहुरन्ये वज्रासनं विदुः । मुक्तासनं वदन्त्येके प्राहुर्गुप्तासनं परे ॥३७॥
transliteration: paścād uktam anyasiddhaṃ matam pūrvam eva matsyendramatam | etat siddhāsanaṃ prāhur anye vajrāsanaṃ viduḥ | muktāsanaṃ vadanty eke prāhur guptāsanaṃ pare || 1.37 ||
translation_danish: [1.37] Nogle kalder denne Siddhāsana, andre Vajrāsana. Nogle omtaler den som Muktāsana, andre som Guptāsana.
translation_english: [1.37] Press firmly the heel of the left foot against the perineum, and the right heel above the male organ. With the chin pressing on the chest, one should sit calmly, having restrained the senses, and gaze steadily the space between the eyebrows. This is called the Siddha āsana, the opener of the door of salvation.

sanskrit: यमेष्विव मिताहार अहिंसा नियमेष्विव । मुख्यं सर्वासनेष्वेकं सिद्धाः सिद्धासनं विदुः ॥३८॥
transliteration: yameṣv iva mitāhāra  ahiṃsā niyameṣv iva | mukhyaṃ sarvāsaneṣv ekaṃ siddhāḥ siddhāsanaṃ viduḥ || 1.38 ||
translation_danish: [1.38] Siddhaerne  véd, at Siddhāsana er den ypperste af alle āsanaer, ligesom sparsom diæt er den ypperste blandt yamaer og ikke-vold er den ypperste blandt niyamaerne.
translation_english: [1.38] This Siddhāsana is performed also by placing the left heel on Meḍhra (above the male organ), and then placing the right one on it.

sanskrit: चतुरशीतिपीठेषु सिद्धमेव सदाभ्यसेत् । द्वासप्ततिसहस्राणां नाडीनां मलशोधनम् ॥३९ ॥
transliteration: caturaśītipīṭheṣu siddham eva sadābhyaset | dvāsaptatisahasrāṇāṃ nāḍīnāṃ malaśodhanam || 1.39 ||
translation_danish: [1.39] Af de 84 āsanaer bør man altid praktisere Siddhāsana, som renser de 72.000 nāḍīer  for urenheder.
translation_english: [1.39] Some call this Siddhāsana, some Vajrāsana. Others call it Mukta āsana or Gupta āsana.

sanskrit: आत्मध्यायी मिताहारी यावद्द्वादशवत्सरम् । सदा सिद्धासनाभ्यासाद्योगी निष्पत्तिमाप्नुयात् । किमन्यैर्बहुभिः पीठैः सिद्धे सिद्धासने सति ।॥४०॥
transliteration: ātmadhyāyī mitāhārī yāvad dvādaśavatsaram | sadā siddhāsanābhyāsād yogī niṣpattim āpnuyāt | kim anyair bahubhiḥ pīṭhaiḥ siddhe siddhāsane sati || 1.40 ||
translation_danish: [1.40] Ved regelmæssig udøvelse af Siddhāsana, sparsom diæt og meditation på ātman  vil yogien opnå fuldendelse i løbet af tolv år. Når Siddhāsana er perfektioneret, hvorfor så praktisere andre āsanaer?
translation_english: [1.40] Just as sparing food is among Yamas, and Ahiṃsā among the Niyamas, so is Siddhāsana called by adepts the chief of all the āsanas.

sanskrit: प्राणानिले सावधाने बद्धे केवलकुम्भके । उत्पद्यते निरायासात्स्वयमेवोन्मनी कला ॥४१॥
transliteration: prāṇānile sāvadhāne baddhe kevalakumbhake | utpadyate nirāyāsāt svayam evonmanī kalā || 1.41 ||
translation_danish: [1.41] Når prāṇa  bindes opmærksomt i Kevalakumbhaka,  vil Unmanī-stadiet  uden videre opstå af sig selv.
translation_english: [1.41] Out of the 84 āsanas Siddhāsana should always be practised, because it cleanses the impurities of 72,000 nāḍīs.

sanskrit: तथैकास्मिन्नेव दृढे बद्धे सिद्धासने सदा । बन्धत्रयमनायासात्स्वयमेवोपजायते ॥४२॥
transliteration: tathaikāsminn eva dr̥ḍhe baddhe siddhāsane sadā | bandhatrayam anāyāsāt svayam evopajāyate || 1.42 ||
translation_danish: [1.42] Altid når denne enestående Siddhāsana er perfekt og stabil, opstår de tre bandhaer  uden videre af sig selv.
translation_english: [1.42] By contemplating on oneself, by eating sparingly, and by practising Siddhāsana for 12 years, the Yogī obtains success.

sanskrit: नासनं सिद्धसदृशं न कुम्भः केवलोपमः । न खेचरीसमा मुद्रा न नादसदृशो लयः ॥४३॥
transliteration: nāsanaṃ siddhasadr̥śaṃ na kumbhaḥ kevalopamaḥ | na khecarīsamā mudrā na nādasadr̥śo layaḥ || 1.43 ||
translation_danish: [1.43] Der er ingen āsana som Siddhāsana; ingen kumbhaka som Kevalakumbhaka; ingen mudrā som Khecarīmudrā; ingen laya som nādayoga. Dette er Padmāsana:
translation_english: [1.43] Other postures are of no use, when success has been achieved in Siddhāsana, and Prāṇa Vāyū becomes calm and restrained by Kevala Kumbhaka.

sanskrit: अथ पद्मासनम् वामोरूपरि दक्षिणं च चरणं संस्थाप्य वामं तथा दक्षोरूपरि पश्चिमेन विधिना धृत्वा कराभ्यां दृढम् । अङ्गुष्ठौ हृदये निधाय चिबुकं नासाग्रमालोकयेत् एतद्व्याधिविनाशकारि यमिनां पद्मासनं प्रोच्यते ॥४४॥
transliteration: atha padmāsanam vāmorūpari dakṣiṇaṃ ca caraṇaṃ saṃsthāpya vāmaṃ tathā dakṣorūpari paścimena vidhinā dhr̥tvā karābhyāṃ dr̥ḍham | aṅguṣṭhau hr̥daye nidhāya cibukaṃ nāsāgram ālokayet etad vyādhivināśakāri yamināṃ padmāsanaṃ procyate || 1.44 ||
translation_danish: [1.44] Placér højre fod på venstre lår og ligeledes venstre fod på højre lår; hold derefter begge storetæer fast med hænderne bagfra på korrekt vis;  læg hagen mod hjertet og kig på næsetippen. Denne āsana fjerner sygdomme hos udøverne og kaldes Padmāsana. Men en anden skole siger:
translation_english: [1.44] Success in one Siddhāsana alone becoming firmly established, one gets Unmanī at once, and the three bonds (Bandhas) are accomplished of themselves.

sanskrit: उत्तानौ चरणौ कृत्वा ऊरुसंस्थौ प्रयत्नतः । ऊरुमध्ये तथोत्तानौ पाणी कृत्वा ततो दृशौ ॥४५॥
transliteration: matāntare tu uttānau caraṇau kr̥tvā ūrusaṃsthau prayatnataḥ | ūrumadhye tathottānau pāṇī kr̥tvā tato dr̥śau || 1.45 ||
translation_danish: [1.45] Efter således at have placeret de opadvendte fødder på lårene og de udstrakte hænder midt på lårene, bør man rette blikket;
translation_english: [1.45] There is no āsana like the Siddhāsana and no Kumbhaka like the Kevala. There is no mudrā like the Khechari and no laya like the Nāda (Anāhata Nāda.)

sanskrit: नासाग्रे विन्यसेद्राजदन्तमूले तु जिह्वया । उत्तम्भ्य चिबुकं वक्षस्युत्थाप्य पवनं शनैः ॥४६॥
transliteration: nāsāgre vinyased rājadantamūle tu jihvayā | uttambhya cibukaṃ vakṣasy utthāpya pavanaṃ śanaiḥ || 1.46 ||
translation_danish: [1.46] mod næsetippen med tungen ved fortændernes rod; når hagen er flyttet hen mod brystet, skal åndedrættet hæves gradvist.
translation_english: [1.46] Place the right foot on the left thigh and the left foot on the right thigh, and grasp the toes with the hands crossed over the back. Press the chin against the chest and gaze on the tip of the nose. This is called the Padmāsana, the destroyer of the diseases of the Yamīs.

sanskrit: इदं पद्मासनं प्रोक्तं सर्वव्याधिविनाशनम् । दुर्लभं येन केनापि धीमता लभ्यते भुवि ॥४७॥
transliteration: idaṃ padmāsanaṃ proktaṃ sarvavyādhivināśanam | durlabhaṃ yena kenāpi dhīmatā labhyate bhuvi || 1.47 ||
translation_danish: [1.47] Denne āsana, der fjerner al sygdom, kaldes Padmāsana. Den er svær at tilegne sig for de fleste, men tilegnes af den vise på jorden. Herpå siges det af Matsyendras skole:
translation_english: [1.47] Place the feet on the thighs, with the soles upwards, and place the hands on the thighs, with the palms upwards.

sanskrit: पश्चादुक्तं मत्स्येन्द्रमतम् । कृत्वा सम्पुटितौ करौ दृढतरं बद्ध्वा तु पद्मासनं गाढं वक्षसि सन्निधाय चिबुकं ध्यायंश्च तच्चेतसि । वारं वारमपानमूर्ध्वमनिलं प्रोत्सारयन्पूरितं मुञ्चन्प्राणमपैति बोधमतुलं शक्तिप्रभावान्नरः ॥४८॥
transliteration: paścād uktaṃ matsyendramatam | kr̥tvā sampuṭitau karau dr̥ḍhataraṃ baddhvā tu padmāsanaṃ gāḍhaṃ vakṣasi sannidhāya cibukaṃ dhyāyaṃś ca tac cetasi | vāraṃ vāram apānam ūrdhvam anilaṃ protsārayan pūritaṃ muñcan  prāṇam upaiti bodham atulaṃ śaktiprabhāvān naraḥ || 1.48 ||
translation_danish: [1.48] Fold hænderne og fasthold en stabil Padmāsana. Med hagen presset fast mod brystet mediteres på dét  i sindet. En mand, der gentagne gange spreder apānaen  opad og prāṇaen nedad, han opnår uforlignelig visdom ved śaktis kraft. [BWO]
translation_english: [1.48] Gaze on the tip of the nose, keeping the tongue pressed against the root of the teeth of the upper jaw, and the chin against the chest, and raise the air up slowly, i.e., pull the apāna-vāyū gently upwards.

sanskrit: पद्मासने स्थितो योगी नाडीद्वारेण पूरितम् । मारुतं धारयेद्यस्तु स मुक्तो नात्र संशयः ॥४९॥
transliteration: padmāsane sthito yogī nāḍīdvāreṇa pūritam | mārutaṃ dhārayed yas tu sa mukto nātra saṃśayaḥ || 1.49 ||
translation_danish: [1.49] Yogien, som er i Padmāsana, bør holde vejret, der går gennem nāḍīerne. Han bliver udfriet. Derom hersker ingen tvivl. Dette er Siṃhāsana:
translation_english: [1.49] This is called the Padmāsana, the destroyer of all diseases. It is difficult of attainment by everybody, but can be learnt by intelligent people in this world.

sanskrit: अथ सिंहासनम् गुल्फौ च वृषणस्याधः सीवन्याः पार्श्वयोः क्षिपेत् । दक्षिणे सव्यगुल्फं तु दक्षगुल्फं तु सव्यके ॥५०॥
transliteration: atha siṃhāsanam gulphau ca vr̥ṣaṇasyādhaḥ sīvanyāḥ pārśvayoḥ kṣipet | dakṣiṇe savyagulphaṃ tu dakṣagulphaṃ tu savyake || 1.50 ||
translation_danish: [1.50] Man placérer begge ankler under skrotum på begge sider af mellemkødet: venstre ankel i højre side og højre ankel i venstre side.
translation_english: [1.50] Having kept both the hands together in the lap, performing the Padmāsana firmly, keeping the chin Fixed to the chest and contemplating on Him in the mind, by drawing the apāna-vāyū up (performing Mūla Bandha) and pushing down the air after inhaling it, joining thus the prāṇa [1.50] and apāna in the navel, one gets the highest intelligence by awakening the śakti (kundalinī) thus. [NOTE1]

sanskrit: हस्तौ तु जान्वोः संस्थाप्य स्वाङ्गुलीः संप्रसार्य च । व्यात्तवक्त्रो निरीक्षेत नासाग्रं तु समाहितः ॥५१॥
transliteration: hastau tu jānvoḥ saṃsthāpya svāṅgulīḥ saṃprasārya ca | vyāttavaktro nirīkṣeta nāsāgraṃ tu samāhitaḥ || 1.51 ||
translation_danish: [1.51] Man placérer hænderne på knæene og spreder fingrene: åbn munden på vid gab og kig på næsetippen med koncentration.
translation_english: [1.51] The Yogī who, sitting with Padmāsana, can control breathing, there is no doubt, is free from bondage.

sanskrit: सिंहासनं भवेदेतत्पूजितं योगिपुङ्गवैः । बन्धत्रितयसंधानं कुरुते चासनोत्तमम् ॥५२॥
transliteration: siṃhāsanaṃ bhaved etat pūjitaṃ yogipuṅgavaiḥ | bandhatritayasaṃdhānaṃ kurute cāsanottamam || 1.52 ||
translation_danish: [1.52] Dette er Siṃhāsana, som æres af de største yogier, og som er den ypperste āsana, der forener de tre bandhaer. Dette er Bhadrāsana:
translation_english: [1.52] Press the heels on both sides of the seam of Perineum, in such a way that the left heel touches the right side and the right heel touches the left side of it.

sanskrit: अथ भद्रासनम् गुल्फौ च वृषणस्याधः सीवन्याः पार्श्वयोः क्षिपेत् । सव्यगुल्फं तथा सव्ये दक्षगुल्फं तु दक्षिणे ॥५३॥
transliteration: atha bhadrāsanam gulphau ca vr̥ṣaṇasyādhaḥ sīvanyāḥ pārśvayoḥ kṣipet | savyagulphaṃ tathā savye dakṣagulphaṃ tu dakṣiṇe || 1.53 ||
translation_danish: [1.53] Man placérer anklerne under skrotum på begge sider af mellemkødet: venstre ankel i venstre side og højre ankel i højre side;
translation_english: [1.53] Place the hands on the thighs, with stretched fingers, and keeping the mouth open and the mind collected, gaze on the tip of the nose.

sanskrit: पार्श्वपादौ च पाणिभ्यां दृढं बद्ध्वा सुनिश्चलम् । भद्रासनं भवेदेतत्सर्वव्याधिविनाशनम् । गोरक्षासनमित्याहुरिदं वै सिद्धयोगिनः ॥५४॥
transliteration: pārśvapādau ca pāṇibhyāṃ dr̥ḍhaṃ baddhvā suniścalam | bhadrāsanaṃ bhaved etat sarvavyādhivināśanam | gorakṣāsanam ity āhur idaṃ vai siddhayoginaḥ || 1.54 ||
translation_danish: [1.54] hold begge fødder fast med hænderne og sid ubevægeligt. Dette er Bhadrāsana, ødelæggeren af al sygdom. Siddha-yogierne kalder denne for Gorakṣāsana.
translation_english: [1.54] This is Siṃhāsana, held sacred by the best of Yogīs. This excellent āsana effects the completion of the three Bandhas (The Mūlabandha, Kanṭha or Jālandhar Bandha and Uḍḍiyāna Bandha).

sanskrit: एवमासनबन्धेषु योगीन्द्रो विगतश्रमः । अभ्यसेन्नाडिकाशुद्धिं मुद्रादिपवनक्रियाम् ॥५५॥
transliteration: evam āsanabandheṣu yogīndro vigataśramaḥ | abhyasen nāḍikāśuddhiṃ mudrādipavanakriyām || 1.55 ||
translation_danish: [1.55] På denne måde vil en fremragende yogi, som uden anspændthed praktiserer āsanaer og bandhaer, rense nāḍīerne med prāṇāyāma,  mudrāer og så videre.
translation_english: [1.55] pārśva-pādau cha pāṇibhyāṃ dṝḍhaṃ baddhvā suniśchalam |

sanskrit: आसनं कुम्भकं चित्रं मुद्राख्यं करणं तथा । अथ नादानुसंधानमभ्यासानुक्रमो हठे ॥५६॥
transliteration: āsanaṃ kumbhakaṃ citraṃ mudrākhyaṃ karaṇaṃ tathā | atha nādānusaṃdhānam abhyāsānukramo haṭhe || 1.56 ||
translation_danish: [1.56] Stadierne i haṭhayoga er: āsanaer, kumbhakaer, derefter forskellige øvelser kaldet mudrāer og sidst udforskning af nādānusandhāna.
translation_english: [1.56] Place the heels on either side of the seam of the Perineum, keeping the left heel on the left side and the right one on the right side, hold the [1.56] feet firmly joined to one another with both the hands. This Bhadrāsana is the destroyer of all the diseases.

sanskrit: ब्रह्मचारी मिताहारी त्यागी योगपरायणः । अब्दादूर्ध्वं भवेत्सिद्धो नात्र कार्या विचारणा ॥५७॥
transliteration: brahmacārī mitāhārī tyāgī yogaparāyaṇaḥ | abdād ūrdhvaṃ bhavet siddho nātra kāryā vicāraṇā || 1.57 ||
translation_danish: [1.57] En, der lever i kyskhed, spiser sparsomt, giver afkald på verden og er dedikeret til yoga, bliver en siddha efter et år. Derom hersker ingen tvivl.
translation_english: [1.57] The expert Yogīs call this Gorakśa āsana. By sitting with this āsana, the Yogī gets rid of fatigue

sanskrit: सुस्निग्धमधुराहारश्चतुर्थांशविवर्जितः । भुज्यते शिवसंप्रीत्यै मिताहारः स उच्यते ॥५८॥
transliteration: susnigdhamadhurāhāraś caturthāṃśavivarjitaḥ | bhujyate śivasaṃprītyai mitāhāraḥ sa ucyate || 1.58 ||
translation_danish: [1.58] At nyde behagelig og sød mad, som tilfredsstiller Śiva, hvor man undlader at spise en fjerdedel, siges at være en sparsom diæt.
translation_english: [1.58] The Nādis should be cleansed of their impurities by performing the mudrās, etc., (which are the practices relating to the air) āsanas, Kumbhakas and various curious mūdrās.

sanskrit: कट्वम्लतीक्ष्णलवणोष्णहरीतशाक- सौवीरतैलतिलसर्षपमद्यमत्स्यान् । आजादिमांसदधितक्रकुलत्थकोल- पिण्याकहिङ्गुलशुनाद्यमपथ्यमाहुः ॥५९॥
transliteration: kaṭvamlatīkṣṇalavaṇoṣṇaharītaśāka- sauvīratailatilasarṣapamadyamatsyān | ājādimāṃsadadhitakrakulatthakola- piṇyākahiṅgulaśunādyam apathyam āhuḥ || 1.59 ||
translation_danish: [1.59] Følgende siges at være usundt: bittert, surt, stærkt, salt, varmt, umodne grøntsager, jujube- dadler, sesamolie, sesamfrø, sennep, alkohol, fisk, gedekød og så videre, yoghurt, sødmælk, kolabær, oliekager, dyvelsdræk, løg med videre.
translation_english: [1.59] By regular and close attention to Nāda (anāhata nāda) in Haṭha Yoga, a Brahmachari, sparing in diet, unattached to objects of enjoyment, and devoted to Yoga, gains success, no doubt, within a year.

sanskrit: भोजनमहितं विद्यात्पुनरप्युष्णीकृतं रूक्षम् । अतिलवणमम्लयुक्तं कदशनशाकोत्कटं वर्ज्यम् ॥६०॥
transliteration: bhojanam ahitaṃ vidyāt punar apy uṣṇīkr̥taṃ rūkṣam | atilavaṇam amlayuktaṃ kadaśanaśākotkaṭaṃ varjyam || 1.60 ||
translation_danish: [1.60] Man bør vide, at mad, der er genopvarmet, rustikt, meget salt eller surt og indeholder mange uspiselige grøntsager, er usundt og bør undgås.
translation_english: [1.60] Abstemious feeding is that in which ¾ of hunger is satisfied with food, well cooked with ghee and sweets, and eaten with the offering of it to Śiva.

sanskrit: वह्नि स्त्रीपथिसेवानामादौ वर्जनमाचरेत् ॥६१। तथाहि गोरक्षवचनम् वर्जयेद्दुर्जनप्रान्तं वह्निस्त्रीपथिसेवनम् । प्रातःस्नानोपवासादि कायक्लेशविधिं तथा
transliteration: vahni strīpathisevānām ādau varjanam ācaret || 1.61 ||
translation_danish: [1.61] I begyndelsen bør en yogi ikke beskæftige sig med ild, kvinder og det vejfarende liv. Som Gorakṣa har sagt: ”Undgå dårligt selskab, ild, kvinder og det vejfarende liv, morgenbad, faste og så videre, samt instruktioner, der skader kroppen”.
translation_english: [1.61] Bitter, sour, saltish, hot, green vegetables, fermented, oily, mixed with til seed, rape seed, intoxicating liquors, fish, meat, curds, chhaasa pulses, plums, oil-cake, asafœtida (hīnga), garlic, onion, etc., should not be eaten.

sanskrit: गोधूमशालियवषष्टिकशोभनान्नं क्षीराज्यखण्डनवनीतसितामधूनि । शुण्ठीपटोलकफलादिकपञ्चशाकं मुद्गादिदिव्यमुदकं च यमीन्द्रपथ्यम् ॥६२॥
transliteration: tathāhi gorakṣavacanam varjayed durjanaprāntaṃ vahnistrīpathisevanam | prātaḥsnānopavāsādi kāyakleśavidhiṃ tathā godhūmaśāliyavaṣaṣṭikaśobhanānnaṃ kṣīrājyakhaṇḍanavanītasitāmadhūni | śuṇṭhīpaṭolakaphalādikapañcaśākaṃ mudgādidivyam udakaṃ ca yamīndrapathyam || 1.62 ||
translation_danish: [1.62] Hvede, ris, byg, ṣaṣṭika-ris, lykkebringende mad, mælk, ghee, kandissukker, frisk smør, hvidt sukker, honning, tørret ingefær, paṭolaka-frugten og så videre, de fem krydderurter, mung-bønner og så videre, samt rent vand er passende for en yogi.
translation_english: [1.62] Food heated again, dry, having too much salt, sour, minor grains, and vegetables that cause burning sensation, should not be eaten, Fire, women, travelling, etc., should be avoided.

sanskrit: पुष्टं सुमधुरं स्निग्धं गव्यं धातुप्रपोषणम् । मनोभिलषितं योग्यं योगी भोजनमाचरेत् ॥६३॥
transliteration: puṣṭaṃ sumadhuraṃ snigdhaṃ gavyaṃ dhātuprapoṣaṇam | manobhilaṣitaṃ yogyaṃ yogī bhojanam ācaret || 1.63 ||
translation_danish: [1.63] Yogien bør spise passende mad, som er sund, behagelig, mild, indeholder mælkeprodukter og meget næringsrige ingredienser, og som nærer sindet.
translation_english: [1.63] As said by Gorakṣa, one should keep aloof from the society of the evil-minded, fire, women, travelling, early morning bath, fasting, and all kinds of bodily exertion.

sanskrit: युवा वृद्धोऽतिवृद्धो वा व्यधितो  दुर्बलोऽपि वा । अभ्यासात्सिद्धिमाप्नोति सर्वयोगेष्वतन्द्रितः ॥६४॥
transliteration: yuvā vr̥ddho'tivr̥ddho vā vyadhito durbalo'pi vā | abhyāsāt siddhim āpnoti sarvayogeṣv atandritaḥ || 1.64 ||
translation_danish: [1.64] Ung, voksen, gammel, tilmed syg eller svag, vil ubesværet opnå siddhier ved energisk praksis af al yoga.
translation_english: [1.64] Wheat, rice, barley, shāstik (a kind of rice), good corns, milk, ghee, sugar, butter, sugarcandy, honey, dried ginger, Parwal (a vegetable) the five vegetables, moong, pure water, these are very beneficial to those who practise Yoga.

sanskrit: क्रियायुक्तस्य सिद्धिः स्यादक्रियस्य कथं भवेत् । न शास्त्रपाठमात्रेण योगसिद्धिः प्रजायते ॥६५॥
transliteration: kriyāyuktasya siddhiḥ syād akriyasya kathaṃ bhavet | na śāstrapāṭhamātreṇa yogasiddhiḥ prajāyate || 1.65 ||
translation_danish: [1.65] Den, som praktiserer, vil opnå siddhier; hvordan skulle den, som ikke praktiserer, kunne opnå dem? Siddhier opstår ikke af boglærdom.
translation_english: [1.65] A Yogī should eat tonics (things giving strength), well sweetened, greasy (made with ghee), milk, butter, etc., which may increase humors of the body, according to his desire.

sanskrit: न वेषधारणं सिद्धेः कारणं न च तत्कथा । क्रियैव कारणं सिद्धेः सत्यमेतन्न संशयः ॥६६॥
transliteration: na veṣadhāraṇaṃ siddheḥ kāraṇaṃ na ca tatkathā | kriyaiva kāraṇaṃ siddheḥ satyam etan na saṃśayaḥ || 1.66 ||
translation_danish: [1.66] Siddhier forårsages ikke af fine klæder eller praleri. Kun praksis forårsager siddhier. Der er ingen tvivl om sandheden i dette.
translation_english: [1.66] Whether young, old or too old, sick or lean, one who discards laziness, gets success if he practises Yoga.

sanskrit: पीठानि कुम्भकाश्चित्रा दिव्यानि करणानि च । सर्वाण्यपि ह्ठाभ्यासे राजयोगफलावधि ॥६७॥
transliteration: pīṭhāni kumbhakāś citrā divyāni karaṇāni ca | sarvāṇy api haṭhābhyāse rājayogaphalāvadhi || 1.67 ||
translation_danish: [1.67] Når man praktiserer haṭhayoga, bør man praktisere āsanaer, prāṇāyāmaer og guddommelige mudrāer indtil man opnår frugten af rājayoga. Således slutter første belæring i Haṭhapradīpikā ved navn ‘Instruktion i āsanaer’  udarbejdet af Svātmarāma Yogendra fra Sahajānanda Cintāmani-successionen. Anden belæring
translation_english: [1.67] Success comes to him who is engaged in the practice. How can one get success without practice; for by merely reading books on Yoga, one can never get success.

sanskrit: इति सहजानन्दसंतानचिन्तामनि स्वात्मारामयोगीन्द्रविरचितायां हठप्रदीपिकायामासनविधिकथनं नाम प्रथमोपदेशः ॥ द्वितीयोपदेशः अथासने दृढे योगी वशी हितमिताशनः । गुरूपदिष्टमार्गेण प्राणायामान्समभ्यसेत् ॥१॥
transliteration: iti sahajānandasaṃtānacintāmani svātmārāmayogīndraviracitāyāṃ haṭhapradīpikāyām āsanavidhikathanaṃ nāma prathamopadeśaḥ || dvitīyopadeśaḥ athāsane dr̥ḍhe yogī vaśī hitamitāśanaḥ | gurūpadiṣṭamārgeṇa prāṇāyāmān samabhyaset || 2.1 ||
translation_danish: [2.1] Når āsanerne er på plads, bør yogien med selvbeherskelse og moderat diæt praktisere prāṇāyāmaer som anvist af guruen.
translation_english: [2.1] Posture becoming established, a Yogī, master of himself, eating salutary and moderate food, should practise Prāṇāyāma, as instructed by his guru.

sanskrit: चले वाते चलं चित्तं निश्चले निश्चलं भवेत् । योगी स्थाणुत्वमाप्नोति ततो वायुं निरोधयेत् ॥२॥
transliteration: cale vāte calaṃ cittaṃ niścale niścalaṃ bhavet | yogī sthāṇutvam āpnoti tato vāyuṃ nirodhayet || 2.2 ||
translation_danish: [2.2] Når åndedrættet er ustabilt, er sindet ustabilt; når åndedrættet er stabilt, vil sindet stabiliseres. Da opnår yogien sindsro. Derfor bør man kontrollere åndedrættet.
translation_english: [2.2] athāsane dṝdhe yoghī vaśī hita-mitāśanaḥ | [2.2] Respiration being disturbed, the mind becomes disturbed. By restraining respiration, the Yogī gets steadiness of mind

sanskrit: यावद्वायुः स्थितो देहे तावज्जीवनमुच्यते । मरणं तस्य निष्क्रान्तिस्ततो वायुं निरोधयेत् ॥३॥
transliteration: yāvad vāyuḥ sthito dehe tāvaj jīvanam ucyate | maraṇaṃ tasya niṣkrāntis tato vāyuṃ nirodhayet || 2.3 ||
translation_danish: [2.3] Så længe der er åndedræt i kroppen, så længe siges der at være liv. Døden er åndedrættets bortgang; derfor bør man kontrollere åndedrættet.
translation_english: [2.3] So long as the (breathing) air stays in the body, it is called life. Death consists in the passing out of the (breathing) air. It is, therefore, necessary to restrain the breath.

sanskrit: मलाकुलासु नाडीषु मारुतो नैव मध्यगः । कथं स्यादुन्मनीभावः कार्यसिद्धिः कथं भवेत् ॥४॥
transliteration: malākulāsu nāḍīṣu māruto naiva madhyagaḥ | kathaṃ syād unmanībhāvaḥ kāryasiddhiḥ kathaṃ bhavet || 2.4 ||
translation_danish: [2.4] Når kroppens nāḍīer er fyldt med urenheder, bevæger åndedraget sig ikke ind i den centrale kanal.  Hvorledes skal Unmanī-tilstanden da være mulig? Hvorledes skal fuldkommenhed opnås?
translation_english: [2.4] The breath does not pass through the middle channel (suṣumnā), owing to the impurities of the nādīs. How can then success be attained, and how can there be the unmanī avasthā.

sanskrit: शुद्धिमेति यदा सर्वं नाडीचक्रं मलाकुलम् । तदैव जायते योगी प्राणसंग्रहणे क्षमः ॥५॥
transliteration: śuddhim eti yadā sarvaṃ nāḍīcakraṃ malākulam | tadaiva jāyate yogī prāṇasaṃgrahaṇe kṣamaḥ || 2.5 ||
translation_danish: [2.5] Når alle nāḍīer og cakraer med deres urenheder er rensede, da bliver yogien i stand til at kontrollere sin prāṇa.
translation_english: [2.5] When the whole system of nādīs which is full of impurities, is cleaned, then the Yogī becomes able to control the Prāṇa.

sanskrit: प्राणायामं ततः कुर्यान्नित्यं सात्त्विकया धिया । यथा सुषुम्नानाडीस्था मलाः शुद्धिं प्रयान्ति च ॥६॥
transliteration: prāṇāyāmaṃ tataḥ kuryān nityaṃ sāttvikayā dhiyā | yathā suṣumṇānāḍīsthā malāḥ śuddhiṃ prayānti ca || 2.6 ||
translation_danish: [2.6] Derfor skal man altid praktisere prāṇāyāmaer med et rent sind, således at urenhederne i Suṣumnā-nāḍīen forsvinder.
translation_english: [2.6] Therefore, Prāṇāyāma should be performed daily with sātwika buddhi (intellect free from raja and tama or activity and sloth), in order to drive out the impurities of the suṣumnā.

sanskrit: बद्धपद्मासनो योगी प्राणं चन्द्रेण पूरयेत् । धारयित्वा यथाशक्ति भूयः सूर्येण रेचयेत् ॥७॥
transliteration: baddhapadmāsano yogī prāṇaṃ candreṇa pūrayet | dhārayitvā yathāśakti bhūyaḥ sūryeṇa recayet || 2.7 ||
translation_danish: [2.7] Yogien, som har indtaget en fastlåst Padmāsana, bør ånde ind gennem månekanalen og holde prāṇa så længe kræfterne rækker; derpå bør han ånde ud gennem solkanalen.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: प्राणं सूर्येण चाकृष्य पूरयेदुदरं शनैः । विधिवत्कुम्भकं कृत्वा पुनश्चन्द्रेण रेचयेत् ॥८॥
transliteration: prāṇaṃ sūryeṇa cākr̥ṣya pūrayed udaraṃ śanaiḥ | vidhivat kumbhakaṃ kr̥tvā punaś candreṇa recayet || 2.8 ||
translation_danish: [2.8] Dernæst bør yogien fylde hulrummet i maven meget forsigtigt, idet han indånder prāṇa gennem solkanalen. Efter at have holdt vejret på yogisk vis  i overensstemmelse med instruktionerne, bør yogien atter tømme hulrummet ved hjælp af månekanalen.
translation_english: [2.8] Sitting in the Padmāsana posture the Yogī should fill in the air through the left nostril (closing the right one); and, keeping it confined according to one's ability, it should be expelled slowly through the sūrya (right nostril). Then, drawing in the air through the sūrya (right nostril) slowly, the belly should be filled, and after performing Kumbhaka as before, it should be expelled slowly through the chandra (left nostril).

sanskrit: येन त्यजेत्तेन पीत्वा धारयेदतिरोधतः । रेचयेच्च ततोऽन्येन शनैरेव न वेगतः ॥९॥
transliteration: yena tyajet tena pītvā dhārayed atirodhataḥ | recayec ca tato 'nyena śanair eva na vegataḥ || 2.9 ||
translation_danish: [2.9] Efter at have trukket vejret ind gennem den ene kanal, som han åndede ud igennem, skal den beherskede yogi fastholde prāṇaen. Derefter skal han ånde ud gennem den anden kanal. Forsigtigt, ikke pludseligt.
translation_english: [2.9] Inhaling thus through the one, through which it was expelled, and having restrained it there, till possible, it should be exhaled through the other, slowly and not forcibly.

sanskrit: प्राणं चेदिडया पिबेन्नियमितं भूयोऽन्यया रेचयेत् पीत्वा पिङ्गलया समीरणमथो बद्ध्वा त्यजेद्वामया । सूर्याचन्द्रमसोरनेन विधिनाभ्यासं सदा तन्वतां शुद्धा नाडिगणा भवन्ति यमिनां मासत्रयादूर्ध्वतः ॥१०॥
transliteration: prāṇaṃ ced iḍayā piben niyamitaṃ bhūyo'nyayā recayet pītvā piṅgalayā samīraṇam atho baddhvā tyajed vāmayā | sūryacandramasor anena vidhinābhyāsaṃ sadā tanvatāṃ śuddhā nāḍigaṇā bhavanti yamināṃ māsatrayād ūrdhvataḥ || 2.10 ||
translation_danish: [2.10] Hvis yogien ånder ind gennem Iḍā, og prāṇa er fastholdt der, skal han ånde ud gennem den anden. Efter at have åndet ind gennem Piṅgalā, og efter at have fastholdt åndedrættet der, skal han ånde ud gennem den venstre kanal. De yogier, som kontinuerligt udfører sol- og månepraksis på denne måde, vil have rensede nāḍīer efter tre måneder eller mere.
translation_english: [2.10] If the air be inhaled through the left nostril, it should be expelled again through the other, and filling it through the right nostril, confining it there, it should be expelled through the left nostril. By practising in this way, through the right and the left nostrils alternately, the whole of the collection of the nādīs of the yamīs (practisers) becomes clean, i.e., free from impurities, after 3 months and over.

sanskrit: प्रातर्मध्यन्दिने सायमर्धरात्रे च कुम्भकान् । शनौरशीतिपर्यन्तं चतुर्वारं समभ्यसेत् ॥११॥
transliteration: prātar madhyandine sāyam ardharātre ca kumbhakān | śanair aśītiparyantaṃ catur vāraṃ samabhyaset || 2.11 ||
translation_danish: [2.11] Yogien skal praktisere gradvist op til 80 kumbhakaer på fire tidspunkter: solopgang, middag, aften og midnat.
translation_english: [2.11] Kumbhakas should be performed gradually 4 times during day and night, i.e., (morning, noon, evening and midnight), till the number of Kumbhakas for one time is 80 and for day and night together it is 320.

sanskrit: कनीयसि भवेत्स्वेदः कम्पो भवति मध्यमे । उत्तमे स्थानमाप्नोति ततो वायुं निबन्धयेत् ॥१२॥
transliteration: kanīyasi bhavet svedaḥ kampo bhavati madhyame | uttame sthānam āpnoti tato vāyuṃ nibandhayet || 2.12 ||
translation_danish: [2.12] Først vil der være sved. Midtvejs er der rysten. Til sidst opnås stabilitet. Derfor bør man fastholde åndedrættet.
translation_english: [2.12] In the beginning there is perspiration, in the middle stage there is quivering, and in the last or the 3rd stage one obtains steadiness; and then the breath should be made steady or motionless.

sanskrit: जलेन श्रमजातेन गात्रमर्दनमाचरेत् । दृढता लघुता चैव तेन गात्रस्य जायते ॥१३॥
transliteration: jalena śramajātena gātramardanam ācaret | dr̥ḍhatā laghutā caiva tena gātrasya jāyate || 2.13 ||
translation_danish: [2.13] Yogien bør indsmøre kroppen i udmattelsens sved. Derved opstår kroppens stabilitet og lethed.
translation_english: [2.13] The perspiration exuding from exertion of practice should be rubbed into the body (and not wiped), as by so doing the body becomes strong.

sanskrit: अभ्यासकाले प्रथमं शस्तं क्षीराज्यभोजनम् । ततोऽभ्यासे दृढीभूते न तादृङ्नियमग्रहः ॥१४॥
transliteration: abhyāsakāle prathamaṃ śastaṃ kṣīrājyabhojanam | tato'bhyāse dr̥ḍhībhūte na tādr̥ṅniyamagrahaḥ || 2.14 ||
translation_danish: [2.14] At nyde mælk og ghee er anbefalet i den første tid af praksis. At følge denne anbefaling er ikke påkrævet, når praksis er blevet stabil.
translation_english: [2.14] During the first stage of practice the food consisting of milk and ghee is wholesome. When the practice becomes established, no such restriction is necessary.

sanskrit: यथा सिंहो गजो व्याघ्रो भवेद्वश्यः शनैः शनैः । तथैव सेवितो वायुरन्यथा हन्ति साधकम् ॥१५॥
transliteration: yathā siṃho gajo vyāghro bhaved vaśyaḥ śanaiḥ śanaiḥ | tathaiva sevito vāyur anyathā hanti sādhakam || 2.15 ||
translation_danish: [2.15] Ligesom en løve, elefant eller tiger skal tæmmes gradvist, ligeså skal åndedrættet tæmmes gradvist - ellers slår det yogien ihjel.
translation_english: [2.15] Just as lions, elephants and tigers are controlled by and by, so the breath is controlled by slow degrees, otherwise (i.e., by being hasty or using too much force) it kills the practiser himself.

sanskrit: प्राणायामेन युक्तेन सर्वरोगक्षयो भवेत् । अयुक्ताभ्यासयोगेन सर्वरोगसमुद्भवः ॥१६॥
transliteration: prāṇāyāmena yuktena sarvarogakṣayo bhavet | ayuktābhyāsayogena sarvarogasamudbhavaḥ || 2.16 ||
translation_danish: [2.16] Ved korrekt udførelse af prāṇāyāma fordrives alle sygdomme. Ukorrekt praksis af yoga forårsager alle sygdomme.
translation_english: [2.16] When Prāṇayama, etc., are performed properly, they eradicate all diseases; but an improper practice generates diseases.

sanskrit: हिक्का श्वासश्च कासश्च शिरःकर्णाक्षिवेदनाः । भवन्ति विविधा रोगाः पवनस्य प्रकोपतः ॥१७॥
transliteration: hikkā śvāsaś ca kāsaś ca śiraḥkarṇākṣivedanāḥ | bhavanti vividhā rogāḥ pavanasya prakopataḥ || 2.17 ||
translation_danish: [2.17] Forstyrrelse i åndedrættet fører til diverse sygdomme, såsom hikke, astma, hoste og smerte i hoved, øre og øje.
translation_english: [2.17] Hiccough, asthma, cough, pain in the head, the ears, and the eyes; these and other various kinds of diseases are generated by the disturbance of the breath.

sanskrit: युक्तं युक्तं त्यजेद्वायुं युक्तं युक्तं च पूरयेत् । युक्तं युक्तं च बध्नीयादेवं सिद्धिमवाप्नुयात् ॥१८॥
transliteration: yuktaṃ yuktaṃ tyajed vāyuṃ yuktaṃ yuktaṃ ca pūrayet | yuktaṃ yuktaṃ ca badhnīyād evaṃ siddhim avāpnuyāt || 2.18 ||
translation_danish: [2.18] Yogien bør ånde ud med fuld kontrol, ånde ind med fuld kontrol og fastholde åndedraget med fuld kontrol. Således vil han opnå succes.
translation_english: [2.18] The air should be expelled with proper tact and should be filled in skilfully; and when it has been kept confined properly it brings success. [NOTE1]

sanskrit: यदा तु नाडीशुद्धिः स्यात्तदा चिह्नानि बाह्यतः । कायस्य कृशता कान्तिस्तथा जायेत निश्चितम् ॥१९॥
transliteration: yadā tu nāḍīśuddhiḥ syāt tadā cihnāni bāhyataḥ | kāyasya kr̥śatā kāntis tathā jāyeta niścitam || 2.19 ||
translation_danish: [2.19] Når nāḍīerne er rensede, vil der være ydre tegn. Kroppen vil med sikkerhed blive slank og strålende.
translation_english: [2.19] When the nādīs become free from impurities, and there appear the outward signs of success, such as lean body and glowing colour, then one should feel certain of success.

sanskrit: यथेष्टधारणं वायोरनलस्य प्रदीपनम् । नादाभिव्यक्तिरारोग्यं जायते नाडिशोधनात् ॥२०॥
transliteration: yatheṣṭadhāraṇaṃ vāyor analasya pradīpanam | nādābhivyaktir ārogyaṃ jāyate nāḍiśodhanāt || 2.20 ||
translation_danish: [2.20] Den ønskede fastholdelse af åndedraget, antændelsen af fordøjelsens ild, manifestationen af indre lyd og fravær af sygdom – alt dette opnås ved nāḍīernes renselse.
translation_english: [2.20] By removing the impurities, the air can be restrained, according to one's wish and the appetite is increased, the divine sound is awakened, and the body becomes healthy.

sanskrit: मेदःश्लेष्माधिकः पूर्वं षट्कर्माणि समाचरेत् । अन्यस्तु नाचरेत्तानि दोषाणां समभावतः ॥२१॥
transliteration: medaḥśleṣmādhikaḥ pūrvaṃ ṣaṭkarmāṇi samācaret | anyas tu nācaret tāni doṣāṇāṃ samabhāvataḥ || 2.21 ||
translation_danish: [2.21] En, som har overskydende fedt og slim, bør først udføre de seks karmaner.  Dog behøver en, der har balance i doṣaerne  ikke at udføre dem.
translation_english: [2.21] If there be excess of fat or phlegm in the body, the six kinds of kriyās (duties) should be performed first. But others, not suffering from the excess of these, should not perform them.

sanskrit: धौतिर्बस्तिस्तथा नेतिस्त्राटकं नौलिकं तथा । कपालभातिश्चैतानि षट्कर्माणि प्रचक्षते ॥२२॥
transliteration: dhautir bastis tathā netis trāṭakaṃ naulikaṃ tathā | kapālabhātiś caitāni ṣaṭkarmāṇi pracakṣate || 2.22 ||
translation_danish: [2.22] De seks karmaner kaldes Dhauti, Vasti, Neti, Trāṭaka, Nauli og Kapālabhāti.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: कर्मषट्कमिदं गोप्यं घटशोधनकारकम् । विचित्रगुणसन्धायि पूज्यते योगिपुङ्गवैः ॥२३॥
transliteration: karmaṣaṭkam idaṃ gopyaṃ ghaṭaśodhanakārakam | vicitraguṇasandhāyi pūjyate yogipuṅgavaiḥ || 2.23 ||
translation_danish: [2.23] Enheden af seks karmaner, som renser og forsyner kroppen med mange egenskaber, bør hemmeligholdes. Denne enhed hyldes af de bedste yogier. Dette er Dhautikarman:
translation_english: [2.23] These six kinds of actions which cleanse the body should be kept secret. They produce extraordinary attributes and are performed with earnestness by the best of Yogīs.

sanskrit: तत्र धौतिः चतुरङ्गुलविस्तारं हस्तपञ्चदशायतम् । गुरूपदिष्टमार्गेण सिक्तं वस्त्रं शनैर्ग्रसेत् । पुनः प्रत्याहरेच्चैतदुदितं धौतिकर्म तत् ॥२४॥
transliteration: tatra dhautiḥ caturaṅgulavistāraṃ hastapañcadaśāyatam | gurūpadiṣṭamārgeṇa siktaṃ vastraṃ śanair graset | punaḥ pratyāharec caitad uditaṃ dhautikarma tat || 2.24 ||
translation_danish: [2.24] Yogien bør forsigtigt sluge et vådt klæde, der er fire tommelfingre bredt og femten hænder langt, som anvist af guruen. Derefter skal klædet trækkes op igen. Dette kaldes Dhautikarman.
translation_english: [2.24] A strip of cloth, about 3 inches wide and 15 cubits long, is pushed in (swallowed), when moist with warm water, through the passage shown by the guru, and is taken out again. This is called Dhauti Karma. [2]

sanskrit: कासश्वासप्लीहकुष्ठं कफरोगाश्च विंशतिः । धौतिकर्मप्रभावेण प्रयान्त्येव न संशयः ॥२५॥
transliteration: kāsaśvāsaplīhakuṣṭhaṃ kapharogāś ca viṃśatiḥ | dhautikarmaprabhāveṇa prayānty eva na saṃśayaḥ || 2.25 ||
translation_danish: [2.25] Hoste, astma, sygdom i milten, spedalskhed samt tyve slimsygdomme forsvinder ved udførelsen af Dhautikarman. Derom hersker ingen tvivl. Dette er Gajakaraṇī:
translation_english: [2.25] There is no doubt, that cough, asthma, enlargement of the spleen, leprosy, and 20 kinds of diseases born of phlegm, disappear by the practice of Dhauti Karma.

sanskrit: अथ गजकरणी उदरगतपदार्थमुद्वमन्ति पवनमपानमुदीर्य कण्ठनाले । क्रमपरिचयवश्यनाडिचक्रा गजकरणीति निगद्यते हठज्ञैः ॥२६॥
transliteration: atha gajakaraṇī udaragatapadārtham udvamanti pavanam apānam udīrya kaṇṭhanāle | kramaparicayavaśyanāḍicakrā gajakaraṇīti nigadyate haṭhajñaiḥ || 2.26 ||
translation_danish: [2.26] De, som har opøvet kontrol over nāḍīerne og cakraerne,  er i stand til at rejse apāna  op gennem spiserøret og kaste mavens indhold op. Dette kaldes Gajakaraṇī  af de kyndige i haṭhayoga. Dette er Vastikarman: [2.26] Stående i Utkaṭāsana  i vand til navlen, bør yogien indsætte en hul stilk i anus og trække sammen. Denne renselse kaldes Vastikarman.
translation_english: [2.26] Squatting in navel-deep water, and introducing a six inches long, smooth piece of ½ an inch diameter pipe, open at both ends, half inside the anus; it (anus) should he drawn up (contracted) and then expelled. This washing is called the Basti Karma.

sanskrit: गुल्मप्लीहोदरं चापि वातपित्तकफोद्भवाः । बस्तिकर्मप्रभावेण क्षीयन्ते सकलामयाः ॥२८॥
transliteration: gulmaplīhodaraṃ cāpi vātapittakaphodbhavāḥ | bastikarmaprabhāveṇa kṣīyante sakalāmayāḥ || 2.28 ||
translation_danish: [2.28] Forstørrelse af milt, mave og lever skyldes vind, galde og slim. Alle disse sygdomme fordrives af Vastikarmans kraft.
translation_english: [2.28] By practising Basti with water, the Dhātās, the Indriyas and the mind become calm. It gives glow and tone to the body and increases the appetite. All the disorders disappear.

sanskrit: धात्विन्द्रियान्तःकरणप्रसादं दद्याच्च कान्तिं दहनप्रदीप्तम् । अशेषदोषोपचयं निहन्यादभ्यस्यमानं जलबस्तिकर्म ॥२९॥
transliteration: dhātvindriyāntaḥkaraṇaprasādaṃ dadyāc ca kāntiṃ dahanapradīptam | aśeṣadoṣopacayaṃ nihanyād abhyasyamānaṃ jalabastikarma || 2.29 ||
translation_danish: [2.29] Ved regelmæssig praksis af Vastikarman i vand, får man et klart sind, skarpe sanser og balance i doṣaerne, skønhed, god fordøjelse og fravær af alle sygdomme. Dette er Netikarman:
translation_english: [2.29] A cord made of threads and about six inches long, should be passed through the passage of the nose and the end taken out in the mouth. This is called by adepts the Neti Karma.

sanskrit: अथ नेतिः सूत्रं वितस्ति सुस्निग्धं नासानाले प्रवेशयेत् । मुखान्निर्गमयेच्चैषा नेतिः सिद्धैर्निगद्यते ॥३०॥
transliteration: atha netiḥ sūtraṃ vitasti susnigdhaṃ nāsānāle praveśayet | mukhān nirgamayec caiṣā netiḥ siddhair nigadyate || 2.30 ||
translation_danish: [2.30] Man fører en blød tråd, som måler tolv tommelfingre, ind i næsehulrummet og videre ud gennem munden. Denne karman kaldes Neti af Siddhayogierne.
translation_english: [2.30] The Neti is the cleaner of the brain and giver of divine sight. It soon destroys all the diseases of the cervical and scapular regions.

sanskrit: कपालशोधनी चैव दिव्यदृष्टिप्रदायिनी । जत्रूर्ध्वजातरोगौघं नेतिराशु निहन्ति च ॥३१॥
transliteration: kapālaśodhanī caiva divyadr̥ṣṭipradāyinī | jatrūrdhvajātarogaughaṃ netir āśu nihanti ca || 2.31 ||
translation_danish: [2.31] Netikarman renser kraniet og giver guddommeligt syn. Den renser hurtigt strømmen af sygdomme, som opstår over kravebenet. Dette er Trāṭakakarman:
translation_english: [2.31] Being calm, one should gaze steadily at a small mark, till eyes are filled with tears. This is called Trataka by āchāryas.

sanskrit: अथ त्राटकम् निरीक्षेन्निश्चलदृशा सूक्ष्मलक्ष्यं समाहितः । अश्रुसम्पातपर्यन्तमाचार्यैस्त्राटकं स्मृतम् ॥३२॥
transliteration: atha trāṭakam nirīkṣen niścaladr̥śā sūkṣmalakṣyaṃ samāhitaḥ | aśrusampātaparyantam ācāryais trāṭakaṃ smr̥tam || 2.32 ||
translation_danish: [2.32] Den opmærksomme yogi bør stirre med et ubevægeligt blik på et lille mærke indtil tårer falder. Denne karman blev overleveret som Trāṭaka af læremestrene.
translation_english: [2.32] Trātaka destroys the eye diseases and removes sloth, etc. It should be kept secret very carefully, like a box of jewellery.

sanskrit: मोचनं नेत्ररोगाणां तन्द्रादीनां कपाटकम् । यत्नतस्त्राटकं गोप्यं यथा हाटकपेटकम् ॥३३॥
transliteration: mocanaṃ netrarogāṇāṃ tandrādīṇāṃ kapāṭakam | yatnatas trāṭakaṃ gopyaṃ yathā hāṭakapeṭakam || 2.33 ||
translation_danish: [2.33] Trāṭakakarman fordriver øjensygdomme og lukker døren til dovenskab med mere. Yogien bør anstrenge sig for at hemmeligholde denne karman, som var det en æske fyldt med guld. Dette er Naulikarman:
translation_english: [2.33] Sitting on the toes with heels raised above the ground, and the palms resting on the ground, and in this bent posture the belly is moved forcibly from left to right just, as in vomiting. This is called by adepts the Nauli Karma.

sanskrit: अथ नौलिः अमन्दावर्तवेगेन तुन्दं सव्यापसव्यतः । नतांसो भ्रामयेदेषा नौलिः सिद्धैः प्रचक्ष्यते ॥३४॥
transliteration: atha nauliḥ amandāvartavegena tundaṃ savyāpasavyataḥ | natāṃso bhrāmayed eṣā nauliḥ siddhaiḥ pracakṣyate || 2.34 ||
translation_danish: [2.34] Yogien bør få den bøjede mave til at vandre fra side til side, som en kraftig strømhvirvel. Dette kaldes Naulikarman af siddhaerne.
translation_english: [2.34] It removes dyspepsia, increases appetite and digestion, and is like the goddess of creation, and causes happiness. It dries up all the disorders. This Nauli is an excellent exercise in Haṭha Yoga.

sanskrit: मन्दाग्निसन्दीपनपाचनादि- सन्धापिकानन्दकरी सदैव । अशेषदोषामयशोषणी च हठक्रियामौलिरियं च नौलिः ॥३५॥
transliteration: mandāgnisandīpanapācanādisandhāpikānandakarī sadaiva | aśeṣadoṣāmayaśoṣaṇī ca haṭhakriyā maulir iyaṃ ca nauliḥ || 2.35 ||
translation_danish: [2.35] Naulikarman er haṭha-praksissens kronjuvel. Den udrydder alle dårligdomme, skaber fryd og sikrer antændelsen af fordøjelsens ild med videre. Dette er Kapālabhātikarman:
translation_english: [2.35] When inhalation and exhalation are performed very quickly, like a pair of bellows of a blacksmith, it dries up all the disorders from the excess of phlegm, and is known as Kapāla Bhāti.

sanskrit: अथ कपालभातिः भस्त्रावल्लोहकारस्य रेचपूरौ ससंभ्रमौ । कपालभातिर्विख्याता कफदोषविशोषणी ॥३६॥
transliteration: atha kapālabhātiḥ bhastrāval lohakārasya recapūrau sasambhramau | kapālabhātir vikhyātā kaphadoṣaviśoṣaṇī || 2.36 ||
translation_danish: [2.36] Træk vejret hurtigt ud og ind, som en smeds blæsebælg. Dette hjælper mod slim i halsen og kendes som Kapālabhātikarman.
translation_english: [2.36] When Prāṇāyāma is performed after getting rid of obesity born of the defects phlegm, by the performance of the six duties, it easily brings success

sanskrit: षट्कर्मनिर्गतस्थौल्यकफदोषमलादिकः । प्राणायामं ततः कुर्यादनायासेन सिद्ध्यति ॥३७॥
transliteration: ṣaṭkarmanirgatasthaulyakaphadoṣamalādikaḥ | prāṇāyāmaṃ tataḥ kuryād anāyāsena siddhyati || 2.37 ||
translation_danish: [2.37] Når yogien ved hjælp af de seks karmaner har udryddet overvægt, slim i halsen, sygdomme, urenheder med mere, bør han praktisere prāṇāyāma. Han vil uden anstrengelse lykkes.
translation_english: [2.37] Some āchāryās (teachers) do not advocate any other practice, being of opinion that all the impurities are dried up by the practice of Prāṇāyāma.

sanskrit: प्राणायामैरेव सर्वे प्रशुष्यन्ति मला इति । आचार्याणां तु केषाञ्चिदन्यत्कर्म न संमतम् ॥३८॥
transliteration: prāṇāyāmair eva sarve praśuṣyanti malā iti | ācāryāṇāṃ tu keṣāñcid anyat karma na saṃmatam || 2.38 ||
translation_danish: [2.38] Dog siger nogle lærde: ”Ved hjælp af prāṇāyāma alene fjernes alle defekter”. De anerkender ikke de andre karmaner.
translation_english: [2.38] By carrying the Apāna Vāyū up to the throat, the food, etc., in the stomach are vomited. By degrees, the system of Nādīs (Śankhinī) becomes known. This is called in Haṭha as Gaja Karaṇi.

sanskrit: ब्रह्मादयोऽपि त्रिदशाः पवनाभ्यासतत्पराः । अभूवन्नन्तकभयात्तस्मात्पवनमभ्यसेत् ॥३९॥
transliteration: brahmādayo 'pi tridaśāḥ pavanābhyāsatatparāḥ | abhūvann antakabhayāt tasmāt pavanam abhyaset || 2.39 ||
translation_danish: [2.39] Selv de 33 guder, begyndende med Brahmā, satte deres lid til åndedrætsøvelser af frygt for døden.  Derfor bør man praktisere åndedrætsøvelser.
translation_english: [2.39] Brahmā, and other Devas were always engaged in the exercise of Prāṇāyāma, and, by means of it, got rid of the fear of death. Therefore, one should practise prāṇāyāma regularly.

sanskrit: यावद्बद्धो मरुद्देहे यावच्चित्तं निराकुलम् । यावद्दृष्टिर्भ्रुवोर्मध्ये तावत्कालभयं कुतः ॥४०॥
transliteration: yāvad baddho marud dehe yāvac cittaṃ nirākulam | yāvad dr̥ṣṭir bhruvor madhye tāvat kālabhayaṃ kutaḥ || 2.40 ||
translation_danish: [2.40] Så længe åndedrættet fastholdes i kroppen, så længe sindet er roligt og så længe blikket er fæstnet mellem øjenbrynene - hvorfor så frygte døden?
translation_english: [2.40] So long as the breath is restrained in the body, so long as the mind is undisturbed, and so long as the gaze is fixed between the eyebrows, there is no fear from Death.

sanskrit: विधिवत्प्राणसंयामैर्नाडीचक्रे विशोधिते । सुषुम्नावदनं भित्त्वा सुखाद्विशति मारुतः ॥४१॥
transliteration: vidhivat prāṇasaṃyāmair nāḍīcakre viśodhite | suṣumṇāvadanaṃ bhittvā sukhād viśati mārutaḥ || 2.41 ||
translation_danish: [2.41] Når alle kroppens nāḍīer er rensede strømmer luften med lethed ind i Suṣumnāens mund, som er brudt åben ved den foreskrevne beherskelse af prāṇa. Dette er Manonmanī-stadiet:
translation_english: [2.41] When the system of Nādis becomes clear of the impurities by properly controlling the prāṇa, then the air, piercing the entrance of the Suśumṇā, enters it easily.

sanskrit: अथ मनोन्मनी मारुते मध्यसंचारे मनःस्थैर्यं प्रजायते । यो मनःसुस्थिरीभावः सैवावस्था मनोन्मनी ॥४२॥
transliteration: atha manonmanī mārute madhyasaṃcāre manaḥsthairyaṃ prajāyate | yo manaḥsusthirībhāvaḥ saivāvasthā manonmanī || 2.42 ||
translation_danish: [2.42] Når åndedrættet bevæger sig i midten, stilnes sindet. Denne behagelige tilstand af sindsro er Manonmani-stadiet.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: तत्सिद्धये विधानज्ञाश्चित्रान्कुर्वन्ति कुम्भकान् । विचित्रकुम्भकाभ्यासाद्विचित्रां सिद्धिमाप्नुयात् ॥४३॥
transliteration: tatsiddhaye vidhānajñāś citrān kurvanti kumbhakān | vicitra kumbhakābhyāsād vicitrāṃ siddhim āpnuyāt || 2.43 ||
translation_danish: [2.43] De, som er vidende om fremgangsmåden, vil udføre alverdens kumbhakaer for at opnå dette. Ved at udføre alverdens kumbhakaer opnås talrige siddhier. Dette er kumbhakaerne:
translation_english: [2.43] To accomplish it, various Kumbhakas are performed by those who are expert in the methods; for, by the practice of different Kumbhakas, wonderful success is attained.

sanskrit: अथ कुम्भकभेदाः सूर्यभेदनमुज्जायी सीत्कारी शीतली तथा । भस्त्रिका भ्रामरी मूर्च्छा प्लाविनीत्यष्टकुम्भकाः ॥४४॥
transliteration: atha kumbhakabhedāḥ sūryabhedanam ujjāyī sītkārī śītalī tathā | bhastrikā bhrāmarī mūrcchā plāvinīty aṣṭakumbhakāḥ || 2.44 ||
translation_danish: [2.44] Følgende er de otte kumbhakaer: Sūryabhedana, Ujjāyī, Sītkārī, Śītalī  Bhastrikā, Bhrāmarī, Mūrcchā og Plāvinī.
translation_english: [2.44] Kumbhakas are of eight kinds, viz., Sūrya Bhedan, Ujjāyī, Sītkarī, Sītalī, Bhastrikā, Bhrāmarī, Mūrchhā, and Plāvinī.

sanskrit: पूरकान्ते तु कर्तव्यो बन्धो जालन्धराभिधः । कुम्भकान्ते रेचकादौ कर्तव्यस्तूड्डियानकः ॥४५॥
transliteration: pūrakānte tu kartavyo bandho jālandharābhidhaḥ | kumbhakānte recakādau kartavyas tūḍḍiyānakaḥ || 2.45 ||
translation_danish: [2.45] Ved indåndingens afslutning udføres bandhaen ved navn Jālandhara. Ved kumbhakaens afslutning og påbegyndelsen af udåndingen udføres Uḍḍiyānabandha.
translation_english: [2.45] At the end of Pūraka, Jālandhara Bandha should be performed, and at the end of Kumbhaka, and at the beginning of Rechaka, Uddiyāna Bandha should be performed. [2.45] Kumbhaka is the keeping the air confined inside. Rechaka is expelling the confined air. The instructions for Puraka, Kumbhaka and Rechaka will be found at their proper place and should he carefully followed.

sanskrit: अधस्तात्कुञ्चनेनाशु कण्ठसंकोचने कृते  । मध्ये पश्चिमतानेन स्यात्प्राणो ब्रह्मनाडिगः ॥४६॥
transliteration: adhastāt kuñcanenāśu kaṇṭhasaṅkocane kr̥te | madhye paścimatānena syāt prāṇo brahmanāḍigaḥ || 2.46 ||
translation_danish: [2.46] Når man hurtigt sammentrækker struben, spænder forneden og trækker sammen i midten med Paścimatānāsana,  vil prāṇa gennemstrømme Brahmā-kanalen.
translation_english: [2.46] By drawing up from below (Mūla Bandha) and contracting the throat (Jālandhara Bandha) and by pulling back the middle of the front portion of the body (i.e., belly), the Prāṇa goes to the Brahma Nādī (Suṣumnā). [NOTE3]

sanskrit: अपानमूर्ध्वमुत्थाप्य प्रणं कण्ठादधो नयेत् । योगी जराविमुक्तः सन्षोडशाब्दवया भवेत् ॥४७॥
transliteration: āpānam ūrdhvam utthāpya prāṇaṃ kaṇṭhād adho nayet | yogī jarāvimuktaḥ san ṣoḍaśābdavayā bhavet || 2.47 ||
translation_danish: [2.47] Man fører apānaen opad og praṇaen fra struben og nedad. Yogien, som har overvundet døden, bliver som en spændstig 16-årig. Dette er Sūryabhedanakumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.47] By pulling up the Apāna Vāyu and by forcing the Prāṇa Vāyu down the throat, the Yogī, liberated from old age, becomes young, as it were 16 years old. [4]

sanskrit: अध सूर्यभेदनम् आसने सुखदे योगी बद्ध्वा चैवासनं ततः । दक्षनाड्या समाकृष्य बहिस्थं पवनं शनैः ॥४८॥ आकेशादानखाग्राच्च निरोधावधि कुम्भयेत् । ततः शनैः सव्यनाड्या रेचयेत्पवनं शनैः ॥४९॥
transliteration: atha sūryabhedanam āsane sukhade yogī baddhvā caivāsanaṃ tataḥ | dakṣanāḍyā samākr̥ṣya bahisthaṃ pavanaṃ śanaiḥ || 2.48 || ākeśād ānakhāgrāc ca nirodhāvadhi kumbhayet | tataḥ śanaiḥ savyanāḍyā recayet pavanaṃ śanaiḥ || 2.49 ||
translation_danish: [2.48-49] Når yogien har holdt kumbhakaen så længe som muligt mellem hårtoppen og tåspidsen, bør han indtage en behagelig āsana. Han skal fastholde denne og trække luft udefra forsigtigt ind gennem højre kanal  og ånde forsigtigt ud gennem venstre kanal.
translation_english: [2.48] Taking any comfortable posture and performing the āsana, the Yogī should draw in the air slowly, through the right nostril. [2.49] Then it should be confined within, so that it fills from the nails to the tips of the hair, and then let out through the left nostril slowly. [5]

sanskrit: कपालशोधनं वातदोषघ्नं कृमिदोषहृत् । पुनः पुनरिदं कार्यं सूर्यभेदनमुत्तमम् ॥५०॥
transliteration: kapālaśodhanaṃ vātadoṣaghnaṃ kr̥midoṣahr̥t | punaḥ punar idaṃ kāryaṃ sūryabhedanam uttamam || 2.50 ||
translation_danish: [2.50] Yogien bør gentage denne Sūryabhedana, den ypperste åndedrætsøvelse, som renser kraniet, helbreder luftvejssygdomme og bekæmper indvoldsorm. Dette er Ujjayīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.50] This excellent Sūrya Bhedana cleanses the forehead (frontal sinuses), destroys the disorders of Vāta, and removes the worms, and, therefore, it should be performed again and again. [6]

sanskrit: अथोज्जायी मुखं संयम्य नाडीभ्यामाकृष्य पवनं शनैः । यथा लगति कण्ठात्तु हृदयावधि सस्वनम् ॥५१॥
transliteration: athojjāyī mukhaṃ saṃyamya nāḍībhyām ākr̥ṣya pavanaṃ śanaiḥ | yathā lagati kaṇṭhāt tu hr̥dayāvadhi sasvanam || 2.51 ||
translation_danish: [2.51] Man lukker munden og trækker vejret roligt via de to nādīer,  således at der opstår lyd fra halsen til hjertet.
translation_english: [2.51] Having closed the opening of the Nādī (Larynx), the air should be drawn in such a way that it goes touching from the throat to the chest, and making noise while passing.

sanskrit: पूर्ववत्कुम्भयेत्प्राणं रेचयेदिडया ततः । श्लेष्मदोषहरं कण्ठे दहानलविवर्धनम् ॥५२॥
transliteration: pūrvavat kumbhayet prāṇaṃ recayed iḍayā tathā | śleṣmadoṣaharaṃ kaṇṭhe dehānalavivardhanam || 2.52 ||
translation_danish: [2.52] Som tidligere beskrevet, bør yogien fastholde prāṇaen i en kumbhaka, og derefter ånde ud via Iḍā. Slim og sygdomme i halsen fjernes og kroppens forbrænding øges.
translation_english: [2.52] It should be restrained, as before, and then let out through Idā (the left nostril). This removes śleṣmā (phlegm) in the throat and increases the appetite.

sanskrit: नाडीजलोदराधातुगतदोषविनाशनम् । गच्छता तिष्ठता कार्यमुज्जाय्याख्यं तु कुम्भकम् ॥५३॥
transliteration: nāḍījalodarādhātugatadoṣavināśanam | gacchatā tiṣṭhatā kāryam ujjāyy ākhyaṃ tu kumbhakam || 2.53 ||
translation_danish: [2.53] Således forsvinder væske i nādīerne, luft i maven og sygdomme i kroppens elementer fjernes. Denne kumbhaka, som skal gøres stående eller gående, kaldes Ujjāyī. Dette er Sītkārīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.53] It destroys the defects of the nādīs, dropsy and disorders of Dhātu (humours). Ujjāyī should be performed in all conditions of life, even while walking or sitting.

sanskrit: अथ सीत्कारी सीत्कां कुर्यात्तथा वक्त्रे घ्रणेनैव विजृम्भिकाम् । एवमभ्यासयोगेन कामदेवो द्वितीयकः ॥५४॥
transliteration: atha sītkārī sītkāṃ kuryāt tathā vaktre ghrāṇenaiva vijr̥mbhikām | evam abhyāsayogena kāmadevo dvitīyakaḥ || 2.54 ||
translation_danish: [2.54] Yogien bør trække vejret voldsomt gennem næsen ind i munden og derved lave lyden ‘sīt’. Ved at praktisere yoga på denne måde bliver han en ny Kāmadeva.
translation_english: [2.54] Sītkārī is performed by drawing in the air through the mouth, keeping the tongue between the lips. The air thus drawn in should not be expelled through the mouth. By practising in this way, one becomes next to the God of Love in beauty.

sanskrit: योगिनीचक्रसम्मान्यः सृष्टिसंहारकारकः । न क्षुधा न तृषा निद्रा नैवालस्यं प्रजायते ॥५५॥
transliteration: yoginīcakrasammānyaḥ  sr̥ṣṭisaṃhārakārakaḥ | na kṣudhā na tr̥ṣā nidrā naivālasyaṃ prajāyate || 2.55 ||
translation_danish: [2.55] Han bliver æret af yoginīerne; han skaber og ødelægger verden. Ikke sult, heller ikke tørst eller søvn, ikke engang dovenskab forekommer hos ham.
translation_english: [2.55] He is regarded adorable by the Yoginīs and becomes the destroyer of the cycle of creation, He is not afflicted with hunger, thirst, sleep or lassitude.

sanskrit: भवेत्स्वच्छन्ददेहस्तु सर्वोपद्रववर्जितः । अनेन विधिना सत्यं योगीन्द्रो भूमिमण्डले ॥५६॥
transliteration: bhavet svacchandadehas tu sarvopadravavarjitaḥ | anena vidhinā satyaṃ yogīndro bhūmimaṇḍale || 2.56 ||
translation_danish: [2.56] Hans krop lystrer hans vilje og han bliver fri for alle sygdomme. Ved hjælp af denne teknik bliver han i sandhed den ypperste yogi på denne jord. Dette er Śītalīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.56] The Satwa of his body becomes free from all the disturbances. In truth, he becomes the lord of the Yogīs in this world.

sanskrit: अथ शीतली जिह्वया वायुमाकृष्य पूर्ववत्कुम्भसाधनम् । शनकैर्घ्राणरन्ध्राभ्यां रेचयेत्पवनं सुधीः ॥५७॥
transliteration: atha śītalī jihvayā vāyum ākr̥ṣya pūrvavat kumbhasādhanam | śanakair ghrāṇarandhrābhyāṃ recayet pavanaṃ sudhīḥ || 2.57 ||
translation_danish: [2.57] Efter at have trukket vejret via tungen og udført kumbhakapraksissen som før beskrevet, ånder den vise langsomt ud gennem begge næsebor.
translation_english: [2.57] As in the above (Sītkári), the tongue to be protruded a little out of the lips, when the air is drawn in. It is kept confined, as before, and then expelled slowly through the nostrils.

sanskrit: गुल्मप्लीहादिकान्रोगान्ज्वरं पित्तं क्षुधां तृषाम् । विषाणि शीतली नाम कुम्भको ऽयं निहन्ति हि ॥५८॥
transliteration: gulmaplīhādikān rogān jvaraṃ pittaṃ kṣudhāṃ tr̥ṣām | viṣāṇi śītalī nāma kumbhako ‘yaṃ nihanti hi || 2.58 ||
translation_danish: [2.58] Denne kumbhaka ved navn Śītalī nedkæmper hævede kirtler i maven og sygdom i milten, feber, galdesyge, sult, tørst, gift og andre dårligdomme. Dette Bhastrikākumbhaka
translation_english: [2.58] This Śītalī Ḳumbhikā cures colic, (enlarged) spleen, fever, disorders of bile, hunger, thirst, and counteracts poisons.

sanskrit: अथ भस्त्रिका ऊर्वोरुपरि संस्थाप्य शुभे पादतले उभे । पद्मासनं भवेदेतत्सर्वपापप्रणाशनम् ॥५९॥
transliteration: atha bhastrikā ūrvor upari saṃsthāpya śubhe pādatale ubhe | padmāsanaṃ bhaved etat sarvapāpapraṇāśanam || 2.59 ||
translation_danish: [2.59] Begge rene fodsåler placeres oven for lårene. Dette er Padmāsana. Den fordriver alle dårligdomme.
translation_english: [2.59] The Padma āsana consists in crossing the feet and placing them on both the thighs; it is the destroyer of all sins.

sanskrit: सम्यक्पद्मासनं बद्ध्वा समग्रीवोदरं सुधीः । मुखं संयम्य यत्नेन प्राणं घ्राणेन रेचयेत् ॥६०॥ यथा लगति हृत्कणठे कपालावधि सस्वनम् । वेगेन पूरयेच्चापि हृत्पद्मावधि मारुतम् ॥६१॥ पुनर्विरेचयेत्तद्वत्पूरयेच्च पुनः पुनः ।
transliteration: samyak padmāsanaṃ baddhvā samagrīvodaraṃ sudhīḥ | mukhaṃ saṃyamya yatnena prāṇaṃ ghrāṇena recayet || 2.60 || yathā lagati hr̥tkaṇṭhe kapālāvadhi sasvanam | vegena pūrayec cāpi hr̥tpadmāvadhi mārutam || 2.61 ||
translation_danish: [2.60-61] Fast forankret i Padmāsana, holder den vise maven og nakken ret, lukker munden og ånder kraftigt ud gennem næsen på en sådan måde, at prāṇaen ledsages af en lyd fra hjertet via halsen og op til kraniet. Yogien bør da fylde sig hastigt med luft helt op til hjertets lotus.  Igen bør han ånde ud og på samme måde ind, igen og igen.
translation_english: [2.60] Binding the Padma-āsana and keeping the body straight, closing the mouth carefully, let the air be expelled through the nose. [2.61] It should be filled up to the lotus of the heart, by drawing it in with force, making noise and touching the throat, the chest and the head.

sanskrit: यथैव लोहकारेण भस्त्रा वेगेन चाल्यते । तथैव स्वशरीरस्थं चालयेत्पवनं धिया ॥६२॥
transliteration: punar virecayet tadvat pūrayec ca punaḥ punaḥ | yathaiva lohakāreṇa bhastrā vegena cālyate | tathaiva svaśarīrasthaṃ cālayet pavanaṃ dhiyā || 2.62 ||
translation_danish: [2.62] Ligesom en blæsebælg bevæges kraftigt af en smed, bør man bevæge luften kraftigt i sin krop.
translation_english: [2.62] It should he expelled again and filled again and again as before, just as a pair of bellows of the blacksmith is worked.

sanskrit: यदा श्रमो भवेद्देहे तदा सूर्येण पूरयेत् ॥६३॥
transliteration: yadā śramo bhaved dehe tadā sūryeṇa pūrayet || 2.63 ||
translation_danish: [2.63] Hvis udmattelse opstår i kroppen, bør man indånde gennem solkanalen.
translation_english: [2.63] In the same way, the air of the body should be moved intelligently, filling it through Sūrya when fatigue is experienced.

sanskrit: यथोदरं भवेत्पूर्णमनिलेन तथा लघु । धारयेन्नासिकां मध्यातर्जनीभ्यां विना दृढम् । विधिवत्कुम्भकं कृत्वा रेचयेदिडयानिलम् ॥६४॥
