transliteration: yathodaraṃ bhavet pūrṇam anilena tathā laghu | dhārayen nāsikāṃ madhyātarjanībhyāṃ vinā dr̥ḍham | vidhivat kumbhakaṃ kr̥tvā recayed iḍayānilam || 2.64 ||
translation_danish: [2.64] Maven bør fyldes med luft, hvorved den bliver let. Hold fast om næsen uden at gøre brug af den midterste finger eller pegefinger. Udfør kumbhaka som foreskrevet og ånd derpå ud via Iḍā.
translation_english: [2.64] The air should be drawn in through the right nostril by pressing the thumb against the left side of the nose, so as to close the left nostril; and when filled to the full, it should be closed with the fourth finger (the one next to the little finger) and kept confined.

sanskrit: वातपित्तश्लेष्महरं शरीराग्निविवर्धनम् ॥६५॥
transliteration: vātapittaśleṣmaharaṃ śarīrāgnivivardhanam || 2.65 ||
translation_danish: [2.65] Vind, galde og slim fordrives og kroppens forbrænding forøges.
translation_english: [2.65] Having confined it properly, it should be expelled through the Idā (left nostril). This destroys Vāta, pitta (bile) and phlegm and increases the digestive power (the gastric fire).

sanskrit: कुण्डलीबोधकं क्षिप्रं पवनं सुखदं हितम् । ब्रह्मनाडीमुखे संस्थकफाद्यर्गलनाशनम् ॥६६॥
transliteration: kuṇḍalī bodhakaṃ kṣipraṃ pavanaṃ sukhadaṃ hitam | brahmanāḍīmukhe saṃsthakaphādyargalanāśanam || 2.66 ||
translation_danish: [2.66] Kuṇḍalinī  vækkes hurtigt. Den renser, giver fryd og er gavnlig. Den fjerner slim og lignende, der blokerer åbningen til Brahmānāḍīen.
translation_english: [2.66] It quickly awakens the Kuṇḍalinī, purifies the system, gives pleasure, and is beneficial. It destroys phlegm and the impurities accumulated at the entrance of the Brahma Nādī.

sanskrit: सम्यग्गात्रसमुद्भूतग्रन्थित्रयविभेदकम् । विशेषेणैव कर्तव्यं भस्त्राख्यं कुम्भकं त्विदम्॥६७॥
transliteration: samyag gātrasamudbhūtagranthitrayavibhedakam | viśeṣeṇaiva kartavyaṃ bhastrākhyaṃ kumbhakaṃ tv idam || 2.67 ||
translation_danish: [2.67] Den splitter fuldstændigt de tre knuder, der udgør kroppen. Denne kumbhaka, som kaldes Bhastrā,  bør udføres ofte. Dette er Bhrāmarīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.67] This Bhastrikā should be performed plentifully, for it breaks the three knots: Brahma granthi (in the chest), Viṣṇu granthi (in the throat), and Rudra granthi (between the eyebrows) of the body.

sanskrit: अथ भ्रामरी वेगाद्घोषं पूरकं भृङ्गनादम् भृङ्गीनादं रेचकं मन्दमन्दम् । योगीन्द्राणामेवमभ्यासयोगात् चित्ते जाता काचिदानन्दलीला ॥६८॥
transliteration: atha bhrāmarī vegād ghoṣaṃ pūrakaṃ bhr̥ṅganādam bhr̥ṅgīnādaṃ recakaṃ mandamandam | yogīndrāṇām evam abhyāsayogāt citte jātā kācid ānandalīlā || 2.68 ||
translation_danish: [2.68] Ånd kraftigt ind, larmende som lyden af en han-humlebi. Ånd ud, blidt som lyden af en hun- humlebi. En særlig lyksalighed og ynde opstår i sindet hos de ypperste yogier som følge af regelmæssig yogapraksis. Dette er Mūrcchākumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.68] By filling the air with force, making noise like Bhringi (wasp), and expelling it slowly, making noise in the same way; this practice causes a sort of ecstacy in the minds of Yogīndras.

sanskrit: अथ मूर्च्छा पूरकान्ते गाढतरं बद्ध्वा जालन्धरं शनैः । रेचयेन्मूर्च्छनाख्येयं मनोमूर्च्छा सुखप्रदा ॥६९॥
transliteration: atha mūrcchā pūrakānte gāḍhataraṃ baddhvā jālandharaṃ śanaiḥ | recayen mūrcchākhyeyaṃ manomūrcchā sukhapradā || 2.69 ||
translation_danish: [2.69] Ved afslutningen af indåndingen fastholder man Jālandharabandha og ånder forsigtigt ud. Denne kumbhaka hedder Mūrchā.  Den stilner sindet og giver glæde. Dette er Plāvinīkumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.69] Closing the passages with Jālandhar Bandha firmly at the end of Pūraka, and expelling the air slowly, is called Mūrchhā, from its causing the mind to swoon and giving comfort.

sanskrit: अथ प्लाविनी अन्तःप्रवर्तितोदारमारुतापूरितोदरः । पयस्यगाधेऽपि सुखात्प्लवते पद्मपत्रवत् ॥७०॥
transliteration: atha plāvinī antaḥ pravartitodāramārutāpūritodaraḥ | payasyagādhe 'pi sukhāt plavate padmapatravat || 2.70 ||
translation_danish: [2.70] Fyldt til bristepunktet med luft helt ned i maven, flyder han med lethed som bladet fra en lotus, selv på bundløst vand.
translation_english: [2.70] When the belly is filled with air and the inside of the body is filled to its utmost with air, the body floats on the deepest water, like the leaf of a lotus.

sanskrit: प्राणायामस्त्रिधा प्रोक्तो रेचपूरककुम्भकैः । सहितः केवलश्चेति कुम्भको द्विविधो मतः । यावत्केवलसिद्धिः स्यात्सहितं तावदभ्यसेत् ॥७१॥
transliteration: prāṇāyāmas tridhā prokto recapūrakakumbhakaiḥ | sahitaḥ kevalaś ceti kumbhako dvividho mataḥ | yāvat kevalasiddhiḥ syāt sahitaṃ tāvad abhyaset || 2.71 ||
translation_danish: [2.71] Prāṇāyāma siges at være trefoldig: udånding, indånding og kumbhaka, tilbageholdelse af åndedrættet. Ligeledes opfattes kumbhaka som tofoldig: Sahita- og Kevalakumbhaka.  Indtil Kevalakumbhaka mestres, bør man praktisere Sahitakumbhaka. Dette er Sahitakumbhaka: Udføres udånding og indånding, så er dette Sahitakumbhaka. Dette er Kevalakumbhaka:
translation_english: [2.71] Considering Pūraka (Filling), Rechaka (expelling) and Kumbhaka (confining), Prāṇāyāma is of three kinds, but considering it accompanied by Pūraka and Rechaka, and without these, it is of two kinds only, i.e., Sahita (with) and Kevala (alone).

sanskrit: अथ सहितः रेचकः पूरकः कार्यः स वै सहितकुम्भकः । अथ केवलः रेचकं पूरकं मुक्तेवा सुखं यद्वायुधारणम् । प्राणायामोऽयमित्युक्तः स वै केवलकुम्भकः ॥७२॥
transliteration: atha sahitaḥ recakaḥ pūrakaḥ kāryaḥ sa vai sahitakumbhakaḥ | atha kevalaḥ recakaṃ pūrakaṃ muktvā sukhaṃ yad vāyudhāraṇam | prāṇāyāmo 'yam ity uktaḥ sa vai kevalakumbhakaḥ || 2.72 ||
translation_danish: [2.72] Undlades udånding og indånding, så opstår glæde ved fastholdelse af åndedraget. Netop denne prāṇāyāma kaldes Kevalakumbhaka.
translation_english: [2.72] Exercise in Sahita should be continued till success in Kevala is gained. This latter is simply confining the air with ease, without Rechaka and Pūraka.

sanskrit: कुम्भके केवले सिद्धे रेचपूरकवर्जिते । न तस्य दुर्लभं किञ्चित्त्रिषु लोकेषु विद्यते ॥७३॥
transliteration: kumbhake kevale siddhe recapūrakavarjite | na tasya durlabhaṃ kiñcit triṣu lokeṣu vidyate || 2.73 ||
translation_danish: [2.73] Når Kevalakumbhakaen mestres, og ud- og indånding undlades, er intet i de tre verdener svært at opnå for yogien.
translation_english: [2.73] In the practice of Kevala Prāṇāyāma when it can be performed successfully without Rechaka and Pūraka, then it is called Kevala Kumbhaka.

sanskrit: शक्तः केवलकुम्भेन यथेष्टं वायुधारणात् । राजयोगपदं चापि लभते नात्र संशयः ॥७४॥
transliteration: śaktaḥ kevalakumbhena yatheṣṭaṃ vāyudhāraṇāt | rājayogapadaṃ cāpi labhate nātra saṃśayaḥ || 2.74 ||
translation_danish: [2.74] Ved at fastholde åndedraget som ønsket, sætter Kevalakumbhakaen ham i stand til at opnå selv rājayoga-stadiet. Derom er der ingen tvivl.
translation_english: [2.74] There is nothing in the three worlds which may be difficult to obtain for him who is able to keep the air confined according to pleasure, by means of Kevala Kumbhaka.

sanskrit: कुम्भकात्कुण्डलीबोधः कुण्डलीबोधतो भवेत् ॥७५॥ अनर्गला सुषुम्ना च हठसिद्धिश्च जायते ।
transliteration: kumbhakāt kuṇḍalībodhaḥ kuṇḍalībodhato bhavet | anargalā suṣumṇā ca haṭhasiddhiś ca jāyate || 2.75 ||
translation_danish: [2.75] Kumbhakaen vækker Kuṇḍalinī. Ved at vække Kuṇḍalinī bliver Suṣumṇā fri for blokeringer og fuldkommenhed i haṭhayoga opnås.
translation_english: [2.75] He obtains the position of Rāja Yoga undoubtedly. Kuṇḍalinī [2.75] awakens by Kumbhaka, and by its awakening, Suṣumnā becomes free from impurities.

sanskrit: हठं विना राजयोगो राजयोगं विना हठः । न सिध्यति ततो युग्ममानिष्पत्तेः समभ्यसेत् ॥७६॥
transliteration: haṭhaṃ vinā rājayogo rājayogaṃ vinā haṭhaḥ | na sidhyati tato yugmam āniṣpatteḥ samabhyaset || 2.76 ||
translation_danish: [2.76] Haṭhayoga er ikke fuldendt uden rājayoga og rājayoga ikke uden haṭhayoga. Derfor bør begge praktiseres til fuldkommenhed.
translation_english: [2.76] No success in Rāja Yoga without Haṭha Yoga, and no success in Haṭha Yoga without Rāja Yoga. One should, therefore, practise both of these well, till complete success is gained.

sanskrit: कुम्भकप्राणरोधान्ते कुर्याच्चित्तं निराश्रयम् । एवमभ्यासयोगेन राजयोगपदं व्रजेत् ॥७७॥
transliteration: kumbhakaprāṇarodhānte kuryāc cittaṃ nirāśrayam | evam abhyāsayogena rājayogapadaṃ vrajet || 2.77 ||
translation_danish: [2.77] Sindet bør tømmes, når tilbageholdelsen af prāṇa i kumbhakaen ophører. Således når man rājayoga- stadiet ved stadig øvelse i yoga.
translation_english: [2.77] On the completion of Kumbhaka, the mind should be given rest. By practising in this way one is raised to the position of (succeeds in getting) Rāja Yoga. [2.77] Indications of success in the practice of Haṭha Yoga.

sanskrit: वपुःकृशत्वं वदने प्रसन्नता नादस्फुटत्वं नयने सुनिर्मले । अरोगता बिन्दुजयोऽग्निदीपनम्  । नाडीविशुद्धिर्हठसिद्धिलक्षणम् ॥७८॥
transliteration: vapuḥ kr̥śatvaṃ vadane prasannatā nādasphuṭatvaṃ nayane sunirmale | arogatā bindujayo'gnidīpanaṃ nāḍīviśuddhir haṭhasiddhilakṣaṇam || 2.78 ||
translation_danish: [2.78] En smuk og slank figur, et fredfyldt ansigt, tydelig tale, et klart blik, godt helbred, beherskelse af sæden, øget forbrænding og fuldstændig renselse af nāḍīerne - dette er tegnene på success i haṭhayoga. Således slutter anden belæring i Haṭhapradīpikā ved navn ‘Instruktion i prāṇāyāma’  udarbejdet af Svātmarāma Yogendra fra Sahajānanda Cintāmani-successionen. Tredje belæring
translation_english: [2.78] When the body becomes lean, the face glows with delight, Anāhatanāda manifests, and eyes are clear, body is healthy, bindu under control, and appetite increases, then one should know that the Nādīs are purified and success in Haṭha Yoga is approaching.

sanskrit: इति सहजानन्दसन्तानचिन्तामणिस्वात्मारामयोगीन्द्रविरचितायां हठप्रदीपिकायां प्राणायामविधिकथनं नाम द्वितीयोपदेशः ॥ तृतीयोपदेशः सशैलवनधात्रीणां यथाधारोऽहिनायकः । सर्वेषां योगतन्त्राणां तथाधारो हि कुण्डली ॥१॥
transliteration: iti sahajānandasantānacintāmaṇisvātmārāmayogīndraviracitāyāṃ haṭhapradīpikāyāṃ [prāṇāyāmavidhikathanaṃ nāma] dvitīyopadeśaḥ || tr̥tīyopadeśaḥ saśailavanadhātrīṇāṃ yathādhāro'hināyakaḥ | sarveṣāṃ yogatantrāṇāṃ tathādhāro hi kuṇḍalī || 3.1 ||
translation_danish: [3.1] Ligesom Slangernes Herre Ahināyaka opretholder Moder Jord med hendes bjerge og skove, således opretholder slangekraften Kuṇḍalinī alle tantriske doktriner om yoga.
translation_english: [3.1] As the chief of the snakes is the support of the earth with all the mountains and forests on it, so all the Tantras (Yoga practices) rest on the Kuṇḍalinī. (The Vertebral column.)

sanskrit: सुप्ता गुरुप्रसादेन यदा जागर्ति कुण्डली । तदा सर्वाणि पद्मानि भिद्यन्ते ग्रन्थयोऽपि च ॥२॥
transliteration: suptā guruprasādena yadā jāgarti kuṇḍalī | tadā sarvāṇi padmāni bhidyante granthayo'pi ca || 3.2 ||
translation_danish: [3.2] Når den sovende Kuṇḍalinī vågner brat i kraft af guruens nåde, da splittes alle lotusser  og granthier  ligeså.
translation_english: [3.2] When the sleeping Kuṇḍalinī awakens by favour of a guru, then all the lotuses (in the six chakras or centres) and all the knots are pierced through.

sanskrit: प्राणस्य शून्यपदवी तदा राजपथायते । तदा चित्तं निरालम्बं तदा कालस्य वञ्चनम् ॥३॥
transliteration: prāṇasya śūnyapadavī tadā rājapathāyate | tadā cittaṃ nirālambaṃ tadā kālasya vañcanam || 3.3 ||
translation_danish: [3.3] Den åbne kongevej  er prāṇaens uhindrede vej. Sindet er selvberoende. Døden snydes.
translation_english: [3.3] sa-śaila-vana-dhātrīṇāṃ yathādhāro|ahi-nāyakaḥ | [3.3] Suṣumnā (Sūnya Padavī) becomes a main road for the passage of Prāṇa, and the mind then becomes free from all connections (with its objects of enjoyments) and Death is then evaded.

sanskrit: सुषुम्णा शून्यपदवी ब्रह्मरन्ध्रं महापथः । श्मशानं शाम्भवी मध्यमार्गश्चेत्येकवाचका: ॥४॥
transliteration: suṣumṇā śūnyapadavī brahmarandhraṃ mahāpathaḥ | śmaśānaṃ śāmbhavī madhyamārgaś cety ekavācakāḥ || 3.4 ||
translation_danish: [3.4] Śūnyapadavī, Brahmarandhra, Mahāpatha, Śmaśāna, Śāmbhavī og Madhyamārga er alle synonymer for Suṣumṇā.
translation_english: [3.4] Suṣumnā, Sunya Padavī, Brahma Randhra, Mahā Patha, Śmaśāna, Śambhavī, Madhya Mārga, are names of one and the same thing.

sanskrit: तस्मात्सर्वप्रयत्नेन प्रबोधयितुमीश्वरीम् । ब्रह्मद्वारमुखे सुप्तां मुद्राभ्यासं समाचरेत् ॥५॥
transliteration: tasmāt sarvaprayatnena prabodhayitum īśvarīm | brahmadvāramukhe suptāṃ mudrābhyāsaṃ samācaret || 3.5 ||
translation_danish: [3.5] Derfor bør man hengive sig til mudrā-praksis og af al kraft vække gudinden, der sover ved indgangen til Brahmās dør.
translation_english: [3.5] In order, therefore, to awaken this goddess, who is sleeping at the entrance of Brahma Dwāra (the great door), mudrās should be practised well.

sanskrit: महामुद्रा महाबन्धो महावेधश्च खेचरी । उड्डीयानं मूलबन्धस्ततो जालन्धराभिधः ॥ करणी विपरीताख्या वज्रोली शक्तिचालनम् ॥६॥
transliteration: mahāmudrā mahābandho mahāvedhaś ca khecarī | uḍḍīyānaṃ mūlabandhas tato jālandharābhidhaḥ || karaṇī viparītākhyā vajrolī śakticālanam || 3.6 ||
translation_danish: [3.6] Mahāmudrā, Mahābandha, Mahāvedha og Khecarī, Uḍḍīyana, Mūlabandha og dertil Jālandhara, Viparītakaraṇī, Vajrolī og Śakticālana;
translation_english: [3.6] Mahā Mudrā, Mahā Bandha, Mahā Vedha, Khecharī, Uḍḍiyāna Bandha, Mūla Bandha, Jālandhara Bandha.

sanskrit: इदं हि मुद्रादशकं जरामरणनाशनम् । आदिनाथोदितं दिव्यमष्टैश्वर्यप्रदायकम् । वल्लभं सर्वसिद्धानां दुर्लभं मरुतामपि ॥ ७ ॥
transliteration: idaṃ hi mudrādaśakaṃ jarāmaraṇanāśanam | ādināthoditaṃ divyam aṣṭaiśvaryapradāyakam | vallabhaṃ sarvasiddhānāṃ durlabhaṃ marutām api || 3.7 ||
translation_danish: [3.7] Dette er de ti mudrāer, som tilintetgør alderdom og død. Disse himmelske mudrāer, som blev udlagt af den oprindelige Herre Śiva, medfører de otte overnaturlige kræfter. Mudrāerne hyldes af alle fuldkomne yogier og er vanskelige at udføre selv for guderne.
translation_english: [3.7] Viparīta Karaṇī, Vajroli, and Śakti Chālana. These are the ten Mudrās which annihilate old age and death.

sanskrit: गोपनीयं प्रयत्नेन यथा रत्नकरण्डकम् । कस्यचिन्नैव वक्तव्यं कुलस्त्रीसुरतं यथा ॥८॥
transliteration: gopanīyaṃ prayatnena yathā ratnakaraṇḍakam | kasyacin naiva vaktavyaṃ kulastrīsurataṃ yathā || 3.8 ||
translation_danish: [3.8] Man burde bestræbe sig på at holde dem hemmelige, som var de en kurv med juveler. De bør ikke omtales for nogen, som hvis man forlyster sig med en kvinde af god familie. Dette er Mahāmudrā:
translation_english: [3.8] They have been explained by ādi Nātha (Śiva) and give eight kinds of divine wealth. They are loved by all the Siddhas and are hard to attain even by the Marutas. [1]

sanskrit: अथ महामुद्रा पादमूलेन वामेन योनिं सम्पीड्य दक्षिणम् । प्रसारितं पदं कृत्वा कराभ्यां धारयेद्दृढम् ॥९॥
transliteration: atha mahāmudrā pādamūlena vāmena yoniṃ sampīḍya dakṣiṇam | prasāritaṃ padaṃ kr̥tvā karābhyāṃ dhārayed dr̥ḍham || 3.9 ||
translation_danish: [3.9] Pres venstre hæl mod stedet for yonien.  Stræk højre fod frem og hold den fast med begge hænder;
translation_english: [3.9] These Mudrās should be kept secret by every means, as one keeps one's box of jewellery, and should, on no account be told to any one, just as husband and wife keep their dealings secret.

sanskrit: कण्ठे बन्धं समारोप्य धारयेद्वायुमूर्ध्वतः । यथा दण्डहतः सर्पो दण्डाकारः प्रजायते ॥ ऋज्वीभूता तथा शक्तिः कुण्डली सहसा भवेत् ॥१०॥
transliteration: kaṇṭhe bandhaṃ samāropya dhārayed vāyum ūrdhvataḥ | yathā daṇḍahataḥ sarpo daṇḍākāraḥ prajāyate || r̥jvībhūtā tathā śaktiḥ kuṇḍalī sahasā bhavet || 3.10 ||
translation_danish: [3.10] luk af for struben med en bandha  og pres luften opad.  Ligesom en slange slået med en stok antager form af en stok, således bliver den sammenrullede śakti straks udstrakt.
translation_english: [3.10] Pressing the Yoni (perineum) with the heel of the left foot, and stretching forth the right foot, its toe should be grasped by the thumb and first finger.

sanskrit: तदा सा मरणावस्था जायते द्विपुटाश्रया ॥११॥
transliteration: tadā sā maraṇāvasthā jāyate dvipuṭāśrayā || 3.11 ||
translation_danish: [3.11] Śakti, som er forbundet med de to kanaler, bliver stiv som et lig.
translation_english: [3.11] ṝjvībhūtā tathā śaktiḥ kuṇḍalī sahasā bhavet |

sanskrit: ततः शनैः शनैरेव रेचयेन्न तु वेगतः। इयं खलु महामुद्रा महासिद्धैः प्रदर्शिता॥१२॥
transliteration: tataḥ śanaiḥ śanair eva recayen na tu vegataḥ | iyaṃ khalu mahāmudrā mahāsiddhaiḥ pradarśitā || 3.12 ||
translation_danish: [3.12] Ånd derefter forsigtigt ud - aldrig pludseligt. Dette er sandelig Mahāmudrā, som blev udlagt af de store siddhaer.
translation_english: [3.12] By stopping the throat (by Jālandhara Bandha) the air is drawn in from the outside and carried down. Just as a snake struck with a stick becomes straight like a stick, in the same way, śakti (suṣumnā) becomes straight at once. Then the Kuṇḍalinī, becoming as it were dead, and, leaving both the Idā and the Pingalā, enters the suṣumnā (the middle passage).

sanskrit: महाक्लेशादयो दोषाः क्षीयन्ते मरणादयः। महामुद्रां च तेनैव वदन्ति विबुधोत्तमाः॥१३॥
transliteration: mahākleśādayo doṣāḥ kṣīyante maraṇādayaḥ | mahāmudrāṃ ca tenaiva vadanti vibudhottamāḥ || 3.13 ||
translation_danish: [3.13] Store lidelser, dårligdomme, død og så videre destrueres. Derfor kalder de ypperste vismænd denne mudrā for Mahāmudrā.
translation_english: [3.13] It should be expelled then, slowly only and not violently. For this very reason, the best of the wise men call it the Mahā Mudrā. This Mahā Mudrā has been propounded by great masters.

sanskrit: चन्द्राङ्गे तु समभ्यस्य सूर्याङ्गे पुनरभ्यसेत् । यावत्तुल्या भवेत्संख्या ततो मुद्रां विसर्जयेत् ॥१४॥
transliteration: candrāṅge tu samabhyasya sūryāṅge punar abhyaset | yāvat tulyā bhavet saṃkhyā tato mudrāṃ visarjayet || 3.14 ||
translation_danish: [3.14] Efter at have øvet med månesiden, øv da med solsiden. Slip mudrāen når antallet er lige.
translation_english: [3.14] Great evils and pains, like death, are destroyed by it, and for this reason wise men call it the Mahā Mudrā.

sanskrit: न हि पथ्यमपथ्यं वा रसाः सर्वेऽपि नीरसाः। अपि भुक्तं विषं घोरं पीयूषमिव जीर्यति॥१५॥
transliteration: na hi pathyam apathyaṃ vā rasāḥ sarve'pi nīrasāḥ | api bhuktaṃ viṣaṃ ghoraṃ pīyūṣam iva jīryati || 3.15 ||
translation_danish: [3.15] Intet er foreskrevet eller forbudt. Alt vil blive fordøjet som var det råmælk, smagfuldt eller smagløst, sågar den rene gift.
translation_english: [3.15] Having practised with the left nostril, it should be practised with the right one; and, when the number on both sides becomes equal, then the mudrā should be discontinued.

sanskrit: क्षयकुष्ठागुदावर्तगुल्माजीर्णपुरोगमाः। तस्य दोषाः क्षयं यान्ति महामुद्रां तु योऽभ्यसेत्॥१६॥
transliteration: kṣayakuṣṭhāgudāvartagulmājīrṇapurogamāḥ | tasya doṣāḥ kṣayaṃ yānti mahāmudrāṃ tu yo 'bhyaset || 3.16 ||
translation_danish: [3.16] Tuberkulose, spedalskhed, tarmslyng, forstørret milt, forstoppelse, dårlig fordøjelse og så videre - alle disse dårligdomme forsvinder for den, der praktiserer Mahāmudrā.
translation_english: [3.16] There is nothing wholesome or injurious; for the practice of this mudrā destroys the injurious effects of all the rasas (chemicals). Even the deadliest of poisons, if taken, acts like nectar.

sanskrit: कथितेयं महामुद्रा महासिद्धिकरी नृणाम्। गोपनीया प्रयत्नेन न देया यस्य कस्यचित्॥१७॥
transliteration: kathiteyaṃ mahāmudrā mahāsiddhikarī nr̥ṇām | gopanīyā prayatnena na deyā yasya kasyacit || 3.17 ||
translation_danish: [3.17] Den netop udlagte Mahāmudrā, som giver mægtige magiske kræfter til mennesker, bør hemmeligholdes med stor omhu og ikke formidles til nogen anden. Dette er Mahābandha:
translation_english: [3.17] Consumption, leprosy, prolapsus anii, colic, and the diseases due to indigestion,—all these irregularities are removed by the practice of this Mahā Mudrā.

sanskrit: अथ महाबन्धः पार्ष्णिं वामस्य पादस्य योनिस्थाने नियोजयेत् । वामोरूपरि संस्थाप्य दक्षिणं चरणं तथा ॥ पूरयित्वा ततो वायुं हृदये चिबुकं दृढम् । निष्पीड्य योनिमाकुञ्च्य मनो मध्ये नियोजयेत् ॥१८-१९॥
transliteration: atha mahābandhaḥ pārṣṇiṃ vāmasya pādasya yonisthāne niyojayet | vāmorūpari saṃsthāpya dakṣiṇaṃ caraṇaṃ tathā || 3.18 || pūrayitvā tato vāyuṃ hr̥daye cibukaṃ dr̥ḍham | niṣpīḍya yonim ākuñcya mano madhye niyojayet || 3.19 ||
translation_danish: [3.18-19] Placér venstre hæl ved stedet for yonien og højre fod på venstre lår. Træk vejret ind og pres hagen hårdt mod hjertet. Træk yonien sammen og fæstn sindet i det midterste.
translation_english: [3.18] This Mahā Mudrā has been described as the giver of great success (Siddhi) to men. It should be kept secret by every effort, and not revealed to any and everyone. [3.19] Press the left heel to the perineum and place the right foot on the left thigh.

sanskrit: धारयित्वा यथाशक्ति रेचयेदनिलं शनैः। सव्याङ्गे तु समभ्यस्य दक्षाङ्गे पुनरभ्यसेत्॥२०॥
transliteration: dhārayitvā yathāśakti recayed anilaṃ śanaiḥ | savyāṅge tu samabhyasya dakṣāṅge punar abhyaset || 3.20 ||
translation_danish: [3.20] Hold vejret så længe som muligt, ånd da forsigtigt ud. Efter at have øvet med venstre side, øv da med højre side.
translation_english: [3.20] Fill in the air, keeping the chin firm against the chest, and, having pressed the air, the mind should he fixed on the middle of the eyebrows or in the suṣumnā (the spine).

sanskrit: मतमत्र तु केषाञ्चित्कण्ठबन्धं विवर्जयेत् । राजदन्तस्थजिह्वाया बन्धः शस्तो भवेदिति ॥२१॥
transliteration: matam atra tu keṣāñcit kaṇṭhabandhaṃ vivarjayet | rājadantasthajihvāyā bandhaḥ śasto bhaved iti || 3.21 ||
translation_danish: [3.21] Nogles opfattelse i denne sag er: Yogien bør undgå kaṇṭha-bandha.  Bandhaen bør derimod bestå i en placering af tungen på drøblen.
translation_english: [3.21] Having kept it confined so long as possible, it should be expelled slowly. Having practised on the left side, it should be practised on the right side.

sanskrit: अयं तु सर्वनाडीनामूर्ध्वगतिनिरोधकः । अयं खलु महाबन्धो महासिद्धिप्रदायकः ॥२२॥
transliteration: ayaṃ tu sarvanāḍīnām ūrdhvagatinirodhakaḥ | ayaṃ khalu mahābandho mahāsiddhipradāyakaḥ || 3.22 ||
translation_danish: [3.22] Dette stopper den opadgående bevægelse i alle kanaler. Mahābandhaen giver sandeligt mægtige siddhier.
translation_english: [3.22] Some are of opinion that the closing of throat is not necessary here, for keeping the tongue pressed against the roots of the upper teeth makes a good bandha (stop).

sanskrit: कालपाशमहाबन्धविमोचनविचक्षणः । त्रिवेणीसङ्गमं धत्ते केदारं प्रापयेन्मनः ॥२३॥
transliteration: kālapāśamahābandhavimocanavicakṣaṇaḥ | triveṇīsaṅgamaṃ dhatte kedāraṃ prāpayen manaḥ || 3.23 ||
translation_danish: [3.23] Mahābandha løsner på fremragende vis dødens snare og forårsager flodernes sammenløb og sindets opnåelse af Kedāra. Dette er Mahāvedha:
translation_english: [3.23] This stops the upward motion of all the Nādīs. Verily this Mahā Bandha is the giver of great Siddhis.

sanskrit: अथ महावेधः रूपलावण्यसम्पन्ना यथा स्त्री पुरुषं विना । महामुद्रामहाबन्धौ निष्फलौ वेधवर्जितौ ॥२४॥
transliteration: atha mahāvedhaḥ rūpalāvaṇyasampannā yathā strī puruṣaṃ vinā | mahāmudrāmahābandhau niṣphalau vedhavarjitau || 3.24 ||
translation_danish: [3.24] Mahāmudrā og Mahābandha er frugtesløse uden Mahāvedha,  ligesom en smuk og attraktiv kvinde er frugtesløs uden en mand.
translation_english: [3.24] This Mahā Bandha is the most skilful means for cutting away the snares of death. It brings about the conjunction of the Trivenī (Idā, Pingalā and Suṣumnā) and carries the mind to Kedār (the space between the eyebrows, which is the seat of Śiva).

sanskrit: महाबन्धस्थितो योगी कृत्वा पूरकमेकधीः । वायूनां गतिमावृत्य निभृतं कण्ठमुद्रया ॥२५॥
transliteration: mahābandhasthito yogī kr̥tvā pūrakam ekadhīḥ | vāyūnāṃ gatim āvr̥tya nibhr̥taṃ kaṇṭhamudrayā || 3.25 ||
translation_danish: [3.25] Siddende i Mahābandha med fyldte lunger, opnår yogien et fokuseret sind. Der forsegles med kaṇṭha-mudrā efter at have stoppet luftens bevægelse.
translation_english: [3.25] As beauty and loveliness, do not avail a woman without husband, so the Mahā Mudrā and the Mahā-Bandha are useless without the Mahā Vedha.

sanskrit: समहस्तयुगो भूमौ स्फिचौ संताडयेच्छनैः । पुटद्वयमतिक्रम्य वायुः स्फुरति मध्यगः ॥२६॥
transliteration: samahastayugo bhūmau sphicau saṃtāḍayec chanaiḥ | puṭadvayam atikramya vāyuḥ sphurati madhyagaḥ || 3.26 ||
translation_danish: [3.26] Yogien bør placere begge hænder på jorden ved ballerne og forsigtigt løfte sig. Luften forlader begge kanaler og går sitrende i den midterste.
translation_english: [3.26] Sitting with Mahā Bandha, the Yogī should fill in the air and keep his mind collected. The movements of the Vāyus (Prāṇa and Apāna) should be stopped by closing the throat.)

sanskrit: सोमसूर्याग्निसंबन्धो जायते चामृताय वै । मृतावस्था समुत्पन्ना ततो वायुं विरेचयेत् ॥२७॥
transliteration: somasūryāgnisambandho jāyate cāmr̥tāya vai | mr̥tāvasthā samutpannā tato vāyuṃ virecayet || 3.27 ||
translation_danish: [3.27] Måne, sol og ild forenes og fører direkte til udødelighed. En dødslignende tilstand opstår, hvorpå man bør ånde ud.
translation_english: [3.27] Resting both the hands equally on the ground, he should raise himself a little and strike his buttocks against the ground gently. The air, leaving both the passages (Idā and Pingalā), starts into the middle one.

sanskrit: महावेधोऽयमभ्यासान्महासिद्धिप्रदायकः । वलीपलितवेपघ्नः सेव्यते साधकोत्तमैः ॥२८॥
transliteration: mahāvedho'yam abhyāsān mahāsiddhipradāyakaḥ | valīpalitavepaghnaḥ sevyate sādhakottamaiḥ || 3.28 ||
translation_danish: [3.28] Ved regelmæssig praksis giver denne Mahāvedha mægtige siddhier. Den tilintetgør rynker, gråt hår og rysten. Den udøves af de ypperste yogier.
translation_english: [3.28] The union of the Idā and the Pingalā is effected, in order to bring about immortality. When the air becomes as it were dead (by leaving its course through the Idā and the Pingalā) (i.e., when it has been kept confined), then it should be expelled.

sanskrit: एतत्त्रयं महागुह्यं जरामृत्युविनाशनम् । वह्रिवृद्धिकारं चैव ह्यणिमादिगुणप्रदम् ॥२९॥
transliteration: etat trayaṃ mahāguhyaṃ jarāmr̥tyuvināśanam | vahnivr̥ddhikaraṃ caiva hy aṇimādiguṇapradam || 3.29 ||
translation_danish: [3.29] Trefoldigheden er en stor hemmelighed, som tilintetgør alderdom og død. Den øger fordøjelsens ild og giver kvaliteter, såsom aṇiman .
translation_english: [3.29] The practice of this Mahā Vedha, the giver of great Siddhis, destroys old age, grey hair, and shaking of the body, and therefore it is practised by the best masters.

sanskrit: अष्टधा क्रियते चैव यामे यामे दिने दिने । पुण्यसंभारसंधायि पापौघभिदुरं सदा । सम्यक्शिक्षावतामेवं स्वल्पं प्रथमसाधनम् ॥३०॥
transliteration: aṣṭadhā kriyate caiva yāme yāme dine dine | puṇyasaṃbhārasandhāya pāpaughabhiduraṃ sadā | samyakśikṣāvatām evaṃ svalpaṃ prathamasādhanam || 3.30 ||
translation_danish: [3.30] Den bør udføres hver tredje time otte gange om dagen, dag efter dag. Det er god praksis at starte i det små. Trefoldigheden giver stor religiøs merit og destruerer altid et væld af onder. Dette er Khecarīmudrā:
translation_english: [3.30] These THREE are the great secrets. They are the destroyers of old age and death, increase the appetite, confer the accomplishments of Anima, etc.

sanskrit: अथ खेचरी कपालकुहरे जिह्वा प्रविष्टा विपरीतगा । भ्रुवोरन्तर्गता दृष्टिर्मुद्रा भवति खेचरी ॥३१॥ अथ खेचरी
transliteration: atha khecarī kapālakuhare jihvā praviṣṭā viparītagā | bhruvor antargatā dr̥ṣṭir mudrā bhavati khecarī || 3.31 ||
translation_danish: [3.31] Blikket mellem øjenbrynene og tungen bøjet helt tilbage ind i kraniets hulrum; dette er Khecarī-mudrā.
translation_english: [3.31] They should, be practised in 8 ways, daily and hourly. They increase collection of good actions and lessen the evil ones. People, instructed well, should begin their practice, little by little, first.

sanskrit: छेदनचालनदोहैः कलां क्रमेण वर्धयेत्तावत् । सा यावद्भ्रूमध्यं स्पृशति तदा खेचरी सिद्धिः ॥३२॥
transliteration: chedanacālanadohaiḥ kalāṃ krameṇa vardhayet tāvat | sā yāvad bhrūmadhyaṃ spr̥śati tadā khecarī siddhiḥ || 3.32 ||
translation_danish: [3.32] Ved at skære, bevæge og hive, bør yogien gradvist forlænge tungen indtil den berører midten af øjenbrynene. Herved er Khecarī-mūdra fuldkommen.
translation_english: [3.32] The Khechari Mudrā is accomplished by thrusting the tongue into the gullet, by turning it over itself, and keeping the eyesight in the middle of the eyebrows.

sanskrit: स्नुहीपत्रनिभं शस्त्रं सुतीक्ष्णं स्निग्धनिर्मलम् । समादाय ततस्तेन रोममात्रं समुच्छिनेत् ॥३३॥
transliteration: snuhīpatranibhaṃ śastraṃ sutīkṣṇaṃ snigdhanirmalam | samādāya tatas tena romamātraṃ samucchinet || 3.33 ||
translation_danish: [3.33] Han bør finde en ren, glat og meget skarp kniv i lighed med et blad fra en vortemælksplante  og lave et hårsbredt snit [i tungebåndet].
translation_english: [3.33] To accomplish this, the tongue is lengthened by cutting the frænum linguæ, moving, and pulling it. When it can touch the space between the eyebrows, then Khechari can be accomplished.

sanskrit: ततः सैन्धवपथ्याभ्यां चूर्णिताभ्यां प्रघर्षयेत् । पुनः सप्तदिने प्राप्ते रोममात्रं समुच्छिनेत् ॥३४॥
transliteration: tataḥ saindhavapathyābhyāṃ cūrṇitābhyāṃ pragharṣayet | punaḥ saptadine prāpte romamātraṃ samucchinet || 3.34 ||
translation_danish: [3.34] Han bør da indsmøre tungebåndet i knust bjergsalt og kvast myrobalan  og lave et hårsbredt snit mere efter syv dage.
translation_english: [3.34] Taking a sharp, smooth, and clean instrument, of the shape of a cactus leaf, the frænum of the tongue should be cut a little (as much as a hair's thickness), at a time.

sanskrit: एवं क्रमेण षण्मासं नित्ययुक्तः समाचरेत् । षण्मासाद्रसनामूलशिराबन्धः प्रणश्यति ॥३५॥
transliteration: evaṃ krameṇa ṣaṇmāsaṃ nityayuktaḥ samācaret | ṣaṇmāsād rasanāmūlaśirābandhaḥ praṇaśyati || 3.35 ||
translation_danish: [3.35] Den dedikerede yogi bør gøre sådan gradvist og regelmæssigt i et halvt år. Efter et halvt år er tungebåndet ved tungens rod forsvundet.
translation_english: [3.35] Then rock salt and yellow myrobalan (both powdered) should be rubbed in. On the 7th day, it should again be cut a hair's breadth.

sanskrit: कलां पराङ्मुखीं कृत्वा त्रिपथे परियोजयेत् । सा भबेत्खेचरी मुद्रा व्योमचक्रं तदुच्यते ॥३६॥
transliteration: kalāṃ parāṅmukhīṃ kr̥tvā tripathe pariyojayet | sā bhavet khecarī mudrā vyomacakraṃ tad ucyate || 3.36 ||
translation_danish: [3.36] Yogien bør bøje tungen bagover og placere den derinde, hvor de tre veje  mødes, hvilket benævnes Vyoma-cakraet.  Dette er Khecarī-mudrā.
translation_english: [3.36] One should go on doing thus, regularly for six months. At the end of six months, the frænum of the tongue will be completely cut.

sanskrit: रसनामूर्ध्वगां कृत्वा क्षणार्धमपि तिष्ठति । विषैर्विमुच्यते योगी व्याधिमृत्युजरादिभिः ॥३७॥
transliteration: rasanām ūrdhvagāṃ kr̥tvā kṣaṇārdham api tiṣṭhati | viṣair vimucyate yogī vyādhimr̥tyujarādibhiḥ || 3.37 ||
translation_danish: [3.37] En yogi, som fører tungen opad og holder den dér - selv et kort øjeblik - undslipper gift, sygdom, død, alderdom og så videre.
translation_english: [3.37] Turning the tongue upwards, it is fixed on the three ways (œsophagus, windpipe and palate.) Thus it makes the Khechari Mudrā, and is called the Vyoma Chakra.

sanskrit: न रोगो मरणं तन्द्रा न निद्रा न क्षुधा तृषा । न च मूर्छा भवेत्तस्य यो मुद्रां वेत्ति खेचरीम् ॥३८॥
transliteration: na rogo maraṇaṃ tandrā na nidrā na kṣudhā tr̥ṣā | na ca mūrchā bhavet tasya yo mudrāṃ vetti khecarīm || 3.38 ||
translation_danish: [3.38] Han, som kender Khecarī-mudrā, rammes hverken af sygdom, død, udmattelse, træthed, sult eller tørst, ej heller af sløvsind.
translation_english: [3.38] The Yogī who sits for a minute turning his tongue upwards, is saved from poisons, diseases, death, old age, etc.

sanskrit: पीड्यते न स रोगेण लिप्यते न च कर्मणा । बाध्यते न स कालेन यो मुद्रां वेत्ति खेचरीम् ॥३९॥
transliteration: pīḍyate na sa rogeṇa lipyate na ca karmaṇā | bādhyate na sa kālena yo mudrāṃ vetti khecarīm || 3.39 ||
translation_danish: [3.39] Yogien, som kender Khecarī-mudrā, er ikke plaget af sygdomme, ej heller besmittet med karma. Han er ikke plaget af tiden og døden.
translation_english: [3.39] He who knows the Khechari Mudrā is not afflicted with disease, death, sloth, sleep, hunger, thirst, and swooning.

sanskrit: चित्तं चरति खे यस्माज्जिह्वा चरति खे गता । तेनैषा खेचरी नाम मुद्रा सिद्धैर्निरुपिता ॥४०॥
transliteration: cittaṃ carati khe yasmāj jihvā carati khe gatā | tenaiṣā khecarī nāma mudrā siddhair nirūpitā || 3.40 ||
translation_danish: [3.40] Idet tungen går ind i hulrummet, vandrer sindet i rummet. Derfor ynder de fuldkomne yogier at kalde denne mudrā for Khecarī.
translation_english: [3.40] He who knows the Khechari Mudrā, is not troubled by diseases, is not stained with karmas, and is not snared by time.

sanskrit: खेचर्या मुद्रितं येन विवरं लम्बिकोर्ध्वतः । न तस्य क्षरते बिन्दुः कामिन्या श्लेषितस्य च ॥४१॥
transliteration: khecaryā mudritaṃ yena vivaraṃ lambikordhvataḥ | na tasya kṣarate binduḥ kāminyā śleṣitasya ca || 3.41 ||
translation_danish: [3.41] Yogiens bindu  flyder ikke fra drøbelen - selv i en lidenskabelig kvindes omfavnelse - når rummet er forseglet med Khecarī-mudrā.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: चलितोऽपि यदा बिन्दुः सम्प्राप्तो योनिमण्डलम् । व्रजत्यूर्ध्वं हृतः शक्त्या निबद्धो योनिमुद्रया ॥४२॥
transliteration: calito 'pi yadā binduḥ samprāpto yonimaṇḍalam | vrajaty ūrdhvaṃ hr̥taḥ śaktyā nibaddho yonimudrayā || 3.42 ||
translation_danish: [3.42] Når en vildfaren bindu når frem til en vagina, opfanges det tabte af Yonimudrāen  og føres kraftfuldt opad.
translation_english: [3.42] The Siddhas have devised this Khechari Mudrā from the fact that the mind and the tongue reach ākāśa by its practice.

sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वजिह्वः स्थिरो भूत्वा सोमपानं करोति यः । मासार्धेन न सन्देहो मृत्युं जयति योगवित् ॥४३॥
transliteration: ūrdhvajihvaḥ sthiro bhūtvā somapānaṃ karoti yaḥ | māsārdhena na sandeho mr̥tyuṃ jayati yogavit || 3.43 ||
translation_danish: [3.43] Den yogakender, som placerer tungen solidt foroven og drikker månenektar,  overvinder uden tvivl døden på en halv måned.
translation_english: [3.43] If the hole behind the palate be stopped with Khechari by turning the tongue upwards, then bindu cannot leave its place even if a woman were embraced.

sanskrit: नित्यं सोमकलापूर्णं शरीरं यस्य योगिनः । तक्षकेणापि दष्टस्य विषं तस्य न सर्पति ॥४४॥
transliteration: nityaṃ somakalāpūrṇaṃ śarīraṃ yasya yoginaḥ | takṣakeṇāpi daṣṭasya viṣaṃ tasya na sarpati || 3.44 ||
translation_danish: [3.44] Gift fra bid, selv fra Takṣaka-slangen,   spreder sig ikke i den yogis krop, som vedvarende fyldes med månedråber.
translation_english: [3.44] If the Yogī drinks Somarasa (juice) by sitting with the tongue turned backwards and mind concentrated, there is no doubt he conquers death within 15 days.

sanskrit: इन्धनानि यथा वह्निस्तैलवर्ति च दीपकः । तथा सोमकलापूर्णं देही देहं न मुञ्चति ॥४५॥
transliteration: indhanāni yathā vahnis tailavarti ca dīpikaḥ | tathā somakalāpūrṇaṃ dehī dehaṃ na muñcati || 3.45 ||
translation_danish: [3.45] Som ilden og brændslet, flammen og olievægen, således udslukkes selvet ikke i den krop, som fyldes med månedråber.
translation_english: [3.45] If the Yogī, whose body is full of Somarasa (juice), were bitten by Takshaka (snake), its poison cannot permeate his body. [3.45] As fire is inseparably connected with the wood and light is connected with the wick and oil, so does the soul not leave the body full of nectar exuding from the Soma. [3.45] Note.—Soma (Chandra) is described later on located in the thousand-petalled lotus in the human brain, and is the same as is seen on Śivas’ head in pictures, and from which a sort of juice exudes. It is the retaining of this exudation which makes one immortal.

sanskrit: गोमांसं भक्षयेन्नित्यं पिबेदमरवारुणीम् । कुलीनं तमहं मन्ये इतरे कुलघातकाः ॥४६॥
transliteration: gomāṃsaṃ bhakṣayen nityaṃ pibed amaravāruṇīm | kulīnaṃ tam ahaṃ manye itare kulaghātakāḥ || 3.46 ||
translation_danish: [3.46] Yogien bør hver dag spise kokød og drikke guddommelig vin. Jeg anser ham for at være af god familie; de andre ødelægger familien.
translation_english: [3.46] Those who eat the flesh of the cow and drink the immortal liquor daily, are regarded by me men of noble family. Others are but a disgrace to their families. [2]

sanskrit: गोशब्देनोदिता जिह्वा तत्प्रवेशो हि तालुनि । गोमांसभक्षणं तत्तु महापातकनाशनम् ॥४७॥
transliteration: gośabdenoditā jihvā tat praveśo hi tāluni | gomāṃsabhakṣaṇaṃ tat tu mahāpātakanāśanam || 3.47 ||
translation_danish: [3.47] Med ordet “ko” menes der tunge. Dens indtrængen i ganen er at spise kokød. Dette eliminerer de største synder.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: जिह्वाप्रवेशसम्भूतवह्निनोत्पादितः खलु । चन्द्रात्स्रवति यः सारः सा स्यादमरवारुणी ॥४८॥
transliteration: jihvāpraveśasambhūtavahninotpāditaḥ khalu | candrāt sravati yaḥ sāraḥ sā syād amaravāruṇī || 3.48 ||
translation_danish: [3.48] Den nektar, som flyder fra månen er foranlediget af ilden. Den frembringes ved tungens indtrængen i ganen. Dette er den guddommelige vin.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: चुम्बन्ती यदि लम्बिकाग्रमनिशं जिह्वारसस्यन्दिनी सक्षारा कटुकाम्लदुग्धसदृशी मध्वाज्यतुल्या तथा । व्याधीनां हरणं जरान्तकरणं शस्त्रागमोदीरणम् तस्य स्यादमरत्वमष्टगुणितं सिद्धाङ्गनाकर्षणम् ॥४९॥
transliteration: cumbantī yadi lambikāgram aniśaṃ jihvārasasyandinī sakṣārā kaṭukāmladugdhasadr̥śī madhvājyatulyā tathā | vyādhīnāṃ haraṇaṃ jarāntakaraṇaṃ śastrāgamodīraṇam tasya syād amaratvam aṣṭaguṇitaṃ siddhāṅganākarṣaṇam || 3.49 ||
translation_danish: [3.49] Hvis tungen vedvarende berører det inderste ganen og overstrømmes af nektar, som er salt, bitter og sur og ligner mælk og har samme substans som honning og ghee, vil yogien tilegne sig følgende: sundhed, ungdommelighed, usårlighed, udødelighed, de otte siddhier  og tiltrækning af fuldkomne kvinder.
translation_english: [3.49] Immortal liquor is the nectar exuding from the moon (Chandra situated on the left side of the space between the eyebrows). It is produced by the fire which is generated by thrusting the tongue.

sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वः षोडशपत्रमध्यगलितं प्राणादवाप्तं हठात् ऊर्ध्वास्यो रसनां नियम्य विवरे शक्तिं परां चिन्तयन् । उत्कल्लोलकलाजलं च विमलं धारामयं यः पिबेत् निर्व्याधिः स मृणालकोमलवपुर्योगी चिरं जीवति ॥५०॥
transliteration: ūrdhvaḥ ṣoḍaśapatramadhyagalitaṃ prāṇād avāptaṃ haṭhāt ūrdvhāsyo rasanāṃ niyamya vivare śaktiṃ parāṃ cintayan | utkallolakalājalaṃ ca vimalaṃ dhārāmayaṃ yaḥ pibet nirvyādhiḥ sa mr̥ṇālakomalavapur yogī ciraṃ jīvati || 3.50 ||
translation_danish: [3.50] Den udstrakte yogi,  som mediterer på śakti, mens han placerer den opadrettede tunge i hulrummet  og drikker den klare strøm af sædlignende væske frembragt ved prāṇa og haṭhayoga, som flyder mod midten af den sekstenbladede lotus,  han lever længe og uden sygdom med en krop så delikat som stilken på en lotus.
translation_english: [3.50] If the tongue can touch with its end the hole from which falls the rasa (juice) which is saltish, bitter, sour, milky and similar to ghee and [3.50] honey, one can drive away disease, destroy old age, can evade an attack of arms, become immortal in eight ways and can attract fairies.

sanskrit: यत्प्रालेयं प्रहितसुषिरं मेरुमूर्धान्तरस्थम् तस्मिंस्तत्त्वं प्रवदति सुधीस्तन्मुखं निम्नगानाम् । चन्द्रात्सारः स्रवति वपुषस्तेन मृत्युर्नराणाम् तद्बध्नीयात्सुकरणमथो नान्यथा कार्यसिद्धिः॥५१॥
transliteration: yat prāleyaṃ prahitasuṣiraṃ merumūrdhāntarastham tasmiṃs tattvaṃ pravadati sudhīs tanmukhaṃ nimnagānām | candrāt sāraḥ sravati vapuṣas tena mr̥tyur narāṇām tad badhnīyāt sukaraṇam atho nānyathā kāryasiddhiḥ || 3.51 ||
translation_danish: [3.51] Den vise stadfæster, at duggen, som strømmer fra hulrummet i Merubjergets top, er den højeste virkelighed og den ypperste blandt floder. Mennesket dør ved at kroppens essens strømmer fra månen. Hold derfor fast i den gunstige teknik. Kroppen kan ikke perfektioneres på anden vis.
translation_english: [3.51] He who drinks the clear stream of liquor of the moon (soma) falling from the brain to the sixteen-petalled lotus (in the heart), obtained by means of Prāṇa, by applying the tongue to the hole of the pendant in the palate, and by meditating on the great power (Kuṇḍalinī), becomes free from disease and tender in body, like the stalk of a lotus, and the Yogī lives a very long life.

sanskrit: सुषिरं ज्ञानजनकं पञ्चस्रोतःसमन्वितम् । तिष्ठते खेचरी मुद्रा तस्मिञ्शून्ये निरञ्जने ॥५२॥
transliteration: suṣiraṃ jñānajanakaṃ pañcasrotaḥsamanvitam | tiṣṭhate khecarī mudrā tasmiñ śūnye nirañjane || 3.52 ||
translation_danish: [3.52] Hulrummet afføder visdom og er forbundet med de fem floder. I den rene tomhed befinder Khecarīmudrā sig.
translation_english: [3.52] On the top of the Merū (vertebral column), concealed in a hole, is the Somarasa (nectar of Chandra); the wise, whose intellect is not overpowered by Raja and Tama guṇas, but in whom Satwa guṇa is predominant, say there is the (universal spirit) ātma in it. It is the source of the down-going Idā, Pingalā and Suṣumnā Nādis, which are the Ganges, the Yamuna and the Sarasvati. From that Chandra is shed the essence of the body which causes death of men. It should, therefore, be stopped from shedding. This (Khechari Mudrā) is a very good instrument for this purpose. There is no other means of achieving this end.

sanskrit: एकं सृष्टिमयं बीजमेका मुद्रा च खेचरी । एको देवो निरालम्ब एकावस्था मनोन्मनी ॥५३॥
transliteration: ekaṃ sr̥ṣṭimayaṃ bījam ekā mudrā ca khecarī | eko devo nirālamba ekāvasthā manonmanī || 3.53 ||
translation_danish: [3.53] Sædekornet fuld af skabelse er én; mudrāen khecarī er én; den uafhængige gud er én; tilstanden Manonmanī er én. Dette er Uḍḍīyanabandha:
translation_english: [3.53] This hole is the generator of knowledge and is the source of the five streams (Idā, Pingalā, &c.). In that colorless vacuum, Khecharī Mudrā should be established.

sanskrit: अथोड्डीयानबन्धः बद्धो येन सुषुम्नायां प्रणस्तूड्डीयते यतः । तस्मादुड्डीयानाख्योऽयं योगिभिः समुदाहृतः ॥५४॥
transliteration: athoḍḍīyānabandhaḥ baddho yena suṣumṇāyāṃ prāṇas tūḍḍīyate yataḥ | tasmād uḍḍīyānākhyo'yaṃ yogibhiḥ samudāhr̥taḥ || 3.54 ||
translation_danish: [3.54] Prāṇa er bundet og flyver op i Suṣumnā i kraft af bandhaen kendt som Uḍḍīyana-bandha. Derfor kaldes den dette af yogierne.
translation_english: [3.54] There is only one seed germinating the whole universe from it; and there is only one Mudrā, called Khecharī. There is only one deva (god) without any one's support, and there is one condition called Manonmaṇi.

sanskrit: उड्डीनं कुरुते यस्मादविश्रान्तं महाखगः । उड्डीयानं तदेव स्यात्तत्र बन्धोऽभिधीयते ॥५५॥
transliteration: uḍḍīnaṃ kurute yasmād aviśrāntaṃ mahākhagaḥ | uḍḍīyānaṃ tad eva syāt tatra bandho'bhidhīyate || 3.55 ||
translation_danish: [3.55] Den, som uafbrudt får den store fugl  til at flyve opad, det er Uḍḍīyana. Nu er bandhaen forklaret.
translation_english: [3.55] Uḍḍiyāna is so called, because the great bird, Prāṇa, tied to it, flies without being fatigued. It is explained below.

sanskrit: उदरे पश्चिमं तानं नाभेरूर्ध्वं च कारयेत् । उड्डीयानो ह्यसौ बम्धो मृत्युमातङ्गकेसरी ॥५६॥
transliteration: udare paścimaṃ tānaṃ nābher ūrdhvaṃ ca kārayet | uḍḍīyāno hy asau bandho mr̥tyumātaṅgakesarī || 3.56 ||
translation_danish: [3.56] Træk maven bagud og navlen opad. Denne Uḍḍīyana-bandha er i sandhed løven, der dræber dødens elefant.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: उड्डीयानं तु सहजं गुरुणा कथितं यथा । अभ्यसेत्सततं यस्तु वृद्धोऽपि तरुणायते ॥५७॥
transliteration: uḍḍīyānaṃ tu sahajaṃ guruṇā kathitaṃ yathā | abhyaset satataṃ yas tu vr̥ddho'pi taruṇāyate || 3.57 ||
translation_danish: [3.57] Den yogi, som vedvarende og naturligt praktiserer Uḍḍīyana som foreskrevet af en guru, bliver ung, om end han er gammel.
translation_english: [3.57] The belly above the navel is pressed backwards towards the spine. This Uḍḍiyāna Bandha is like a lion for the elephant of death.

sanskrit: नाभेरूर्ध्वमधश्चापि तानं कुर्यात्प्रयत्नतः । षण्मासमभ्यसेन्मृत्युं जयत्येव न संशयः ॥५८॥
transliteration: nābher ūrdhvam adhaś cāpi tānaṃ kuryāt prayatnataḥ | ṣaṇmāsam abhyasen mr̥tyuṃ jayaty eva na saṃśayaḥ || 3.58 ||
translation_danish: [3.58] Yogien bør trække ind over og under navlen. Han bør praktisere ihærdigt i seks måneder. Derved overvinder han døden. Herom er der ingen tvivl.
translation_english: [3.58] Uḍḍiyāna is always very easy, when learnt from a guru. The practiser of this, if old, becomes young again. [3.58] The portions above and below the navel, should be drawn backwards towards the spine. By practising this for six months one can undoubtedly conquer death.

sanskrit: सर्वेषामेव बन्धानामुत्तमो ह्युड्डियानकः । उड्डियाने दृढे बन्धे मुक्तिः स्वाभाविकी भवेत् ॥५९॥
transliteration: sarveṣām eva bandhānā uttamo hy uḍḍīyānakaḥ | uḍḍiyāne dr̥ḍhe bandhe muktiḥ svābhāvikī bhavet || 3.59 ||
translation_danish: [3.59] Uḍḍīyana er i sandhed den bedste bandha. Når Uḍḍīyanabandhaen mestres, følger mukti naturligt. Dette er Mūlabandha:
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: अथ मूलबन्धः पार्ष्णिभागेन सम्पीड्य योनिमाकुञ्चयेद्गुदम् । अपानमूर्ध्वमाकृष्य मूलबन्धोऽभिधीयते ॥६०॥
transliteration: atha mūlabandhaḥ pārṣṇibhāgena sampīḍya yonim ākuñcayed gudam | apānam ūrdhvam ākr̥ṣya mūlabandho'bhidhīyate || 3.60 ||
translation_danish: [3.60] Pres stedet for skeden med hælen.  Træk anus sammen. Træk apāna opad. Dette kaldes Mūlabandha.
translation_english: [3.60] Of all the Bandhas, Uḍḍiyāna is the best; for by binding it firmly liberation comes spontaneously. [3.60] Pressing Yoni (perineum) with the heel, contract up the anus. By drawing the Apāna thus, Mūla Bandha is made.

sanskrit: अधोगतिमपानं वै ऊर्ध्वगं कुरुते बलात् । आकुञ्चनेन तं प्राहुर्मूलबन्धं हि योगिनः ॥६१॥
transliteration: adhogatim apānaṃ vai ūrdhvagaṃ kurute balāt | ākuñcanena taṃ prāhur mūlabandhaṃ hi yoginaḥ || 3.61 ||
translation_danish: [3.61] Ved en kraftfuld sammentrækning får yogien apāna, der går nedad, til at gå opad. Yogierne kalder den for Mūlabandha.
translation_english: [3.61] The Apāna, naturally inclining downward, is made to go up by force. This Mūla Bandha is spoken of by Yogīs as done by contracting the anus.

sanskrit: गुदं पार्ष्ण्य तु सम्पीड्य योनिमाकुञ्चयेद्बलात् । वारं वारं यथा चोर्ध्वं समायाति समीरणः ॥६२॥
transliteration: gudaṃ pārṣṇyā tu sampīḍya yonim ākuñcayed balāt | vāraṃ vāraṃ yathā cordhvaṃ samāyāti samīraṇaḥ || 3.62 ||
translation_danish: [3.62] Pres anus med hælen og træk stedet for skeden kraftfuldt sammen gentagne gange, så vinden går opad.
translation_english: [3.62] Pressing the heel well against the anus, draw up the air by force, again and again till it (air) goes up.

sanskrit: प्राणापानौ नादबिन्दू मूलबन्धेन चैकताम् । गत्वा योगस्य संसिद्धिं यच्छतो नात्र संशयः ॥६३॥
transliteration: prāṇāpānau nādabindū mūlabandhena caikatām | gatvā yogasya saṃsiddhiṃ yacchato nātra saṃśayaḥ || 3.63 ||
translation_danish: [3.63] Når prāṇa og apāna, nāda og bindu forenes ved hjælp af Mūlabandha leder de til fuldkommen succes i yoga. Herom er der ingen tvivl.
translation_english: [3.63] Prāṇa, Apāna, Nāda and Bindu uniting into one in this way, give success in Yoga, undoubtedly.

sanskrit: अपानप्राणयोरैक्यं क्षयो मूत्रपुरीषयोः । युवा भवति वृद्धोऽपि सततं मूलबन्धनात् ॥६४॥
transliteration: apānaprāṇayor aikyaṃ kṣayo mūtrapurīṣayoḥ | yuvā bhavati vr̥ddho'pi satataṃ mūlabandhanāt || 3.64 ||
translation_danish: [3.64] Ved at praktisere Mūlabandha regelmæssigt bliver apāna og prāṇa én; urin og afføring aftager - selv den gamle bliver ung.
translation_english: [3.64] By the purification of Prāṇa, and Apāna, urine and excrements decrease. Even an old man becomes young by constantly practising Mūla Bandha.

sanskrit: अपाने ऊर्ध्वगे जाते प्रयाते वह्निमण्डलम् । तदानलशिखा दीर्घा जायते वायुनाहता ॥६५॥
transliteration: apāne ūrdhvage jāte prayāte vahnimaṇḍalam | tadānalaśikhā dīrghā jāyate vāyunāhatā || 3.65 ||
translation_danish: [3.65] Når udåndingen bevæger sig opad, sættes fordøjelsens ild i gang. Den blusser op og rammer Vāyuna.
translation_english: [3.65] Going up, the Apāna enters the zone of fire, i.e., the stomach. The flame of fire struck by the air is thereby lengthened. [3]

sanskrit: ततो यातो वह्न्यपानौ प्राणमुष्णस्वरूपकम् । तेनात्यन्तप्रदीप्तस्तु ज्वलनो देहजस्तथा ॥६६॥
transliteration: tato yāto vahnyapānau prāṇam uṣṇasvarūpakam | tenātyantapradīptas tu jvalano dehajas tathā || 3.66 ||
translation_danish: [3.66] Kroppens varme forøges drastisk, når fordøjelsens ild og apāna mødes med prāṇa, som er varm af natur.
translation_english: [3.66] These, fire and Apāna, go to the naturally hot Prāṇa, which, becoming inflamed thereby, causes burning sensation in the body.

sanskrit: तेन कुण्डलिनी सुप्ता सन्तप्ता सम्प्रबुध्यते । दण्डाहता भुजङ्गीव निःश्वस्य ऋजुतां व्रजेत् ॥६७॥
transliteration: tena kuṇḍalinī suptā santaptā samprabudhyate | daṇḍāhatā bhujaṅgīva niḥśvasya r̥jutāṃ vrajet || 3.67 ||
translation_danish: [3.67] Som følge af denne varme vækkes den sovende Kuṇḍalinī, der hvæser og retter sig ud, som en slange ramt af en stok.
translation_english: [3.67] The Kuṇḍalinī, which has been sleeping all this time, becomes well heated by this means and awakens well. It becomes straight like a serpent, struck dead with a stick.

sanskrit: बिलं प्रविष्टेव ततो ब्रह्मनाड्यन्तरं व्रजेत् । तस्मान्नित्यं मूलबन्धः कर्तव्यो योगिभिः सदा ॥६८॥
transliteration: bilaṃ praviṣṭeva tato brahmanāḍyantaraṃ vrajet | tasmān nityaṃ mūlabandhaḥ kartavyo yogibhiḥ sadā || 3.68 ||
translation_danish: [3.68] Hun bør dermed bevæge sig ind i brahman-kanalen, som trådte hun ind i en hule. Yogierne bør derfor udføre Mūlabandha dagligt. Dette er Jālandharabandha:
translation_english: [3.68] It enters the Brahma Nādī, just as a serpent enters its hole. Therefore, the Yogī should always practise this Mūla Bandha.

sanskrit: अथ जालन्धरबन्धः कण्ठमाकुञ्च्य हृदये स्थापयेच्चिबुकं दृढम् । बन्धो जालन्धराख्योऽयं जरामृत्युविनाशकः ॥६९॥
transliteration: atha jālandharabandhaḥ kaṇṭham ākuñcya hr̥daye sthāpayec cibukaṃ dr̥ḍham | bandho jālandharākhyo'yaṃ jarāmr̥tyuvināśakaḥ || 3.69 ||
translation_danish: [3.69] Bøj nakken og placér hagen tæt ind mod hjertet. Bandhaen kaldes Jālandharabandha. Den udsletter alderdom og død.
translation_english: [3.69] The Jālandhara Bandha.

sanskrit: बध्नाति हि शिराजालमधोगामिनभोजलम् । ततो जालन्धरो बन्धः कण्ठदुःखौघनाशनः ॥७०॥
transliteration: badhnāti hi śirājālam adhogāminabhojalam | tato jālandharo bandhaḥ kaṇṭhaduḥkhaughanāśanaḥ || 3.70 ||
translation_danish: [3.70] Den lukker for netværket af floder med nedstrømmende himmelsk vand. Dermed udsletter Jālandharabandha de mange plager i halsen.
translation_english: [3.70] Contract the throat and press the chin firmly against the chest. This is called Jālandhara Bandha, which destroys old age and death.

sanskrit: जालन्धरे कृते बन्धे कण्ठसंकोचलक्षने । न पीयूषं पतत्यग्नौ न च वायुः प्रकुप्यति ॥७१॥
transliteration: jālandhare kr̥te bandhe kaṇṭhasaṃkocalakṣaṇe | na pīyūṣaṃ pataty agnau na ca vāyuḥ prakupyati || 3.71 ||
translation_danish: [3.71] Når man udfører Jālandharabandha, hvis kendetegn er en sammentrækning i halsen, forsvinder nektaren ikke ned i ilden og åndedrættet ophidses ikke.
translation_english: [3.71] It stops the opening (hole) of the group of the Nādīs, through which the juice from the sky (from the Soma or Chandra in the brain) falls down. It is, therefore, called the Jālandhara Bandha —the destroyer of a host of diseases of the throat.

sanskrit: कण्ठसंकोचनेनैव द्वे नाड्यौ स्तम्भयेद्दृढम् । मध्यचक्रमिदं ज्ञेयं षोडशाधारबन्धनम् ॥७२॥
transliteration: kaṇṭhasaṃkocanenaiva dve nāḍyau stambhayed dr̥ḍham | madhyacakram idaṃ jñeyaṃ ṣoḍaśādhārabandhanam || 3.72 ||
translation_danish: [3.72] Denne sammentrækning i halsen stopper de to nāḍīer. Dette bør erkendes som det midterste cakra,  der forbinder de seksten ādhāraer.
translation_english: [3.72] In Jālandhara Bandha, the indications of a perfect contraction of throat are, that the nectar does not fall into the fire (the Sūrya situated in the navel), and the air is not disturbed.

sanskrit: मूलस्थानं समाकुञ्च्य उड्डियानं तु कारयेत् । इडां च पिङ्गलां बद्ध्वा वाहयेत्पश्चिमे पथि ॥७३॥
transliteration: mūlasthānaṃ samākuñcya uḍḍiyānaṃ tu kārayet | iḍāṃ ca piṅgalāṃ baddhvā vāhayet paścime pathi || 3.73 ||
translation_danish: [3.73] Træk bækkenbunden sammen og udfør Uḍḍīyanabandha. Blokér Iḍā og Piṅgalā og benyt den sidste vej.
translation_english: [3.73] The two Nādīs should be stopped firmly by contracting the throat. This is called the middle circuit or centre (Madhya Chakra), and it stops the 16 ādhāras (i.e., vital parts). [4]

sanskrit: अनेनैव विधानेन प्रयाति पवनो लयम् । ततो न जायते मृत्युर्जरारोगादिकं तथा ॥७४॥
transliteration: anenaiva vidhānena prayāti pavano layam | tato na jāyate mr̥tyur jarārogādikaṃ tathā || 3.74 ||
translation_danish: [3.74] Ved hjælp af denne teknik vandrer åndedrættet derhen. Herefter opstår sygdom, alderdom og død med videre ikke længere.
translation_english: [3.74] By drawing up the mūlasthāna (anus,) Uḍḍiyāna Bandha should be performed. The flow of the air should be directed to the Suṣumnā, by closing the Idā, and the Pingalā.

sanskrit: बन्धत्रयमिदं श्रेष्ठं महासिद्धैश्च सेवितम् । सर्वेषां हठतन्त्राणां साधनं योगिनो विदुः ॥७५॥
transliteration: bandhatrayam idaṃ śreṣṭhaṃ mahāsiddhaiś ca sevitam | sarveṣāṃ haṭhatantrāṇāṃ sādhanaṃ yogino viduḥ || 3.75 ||
translation_danish: [3.75] Disse tre bandhaer er de ypperste, som de store siddhaer dvæler ved. De fuldender al haṭha-tantrisk praksis. Det ved yogierne. Dette er Viparītakaraṇī:
translation_english: [3.75] The Prāna becomes calm and latent by this means, and thus there is no death, old age, disease, etc.

sanskrit: अथ विपरीतकरणी | यत्किञ्चित्स्रवते चन्द्रादमृतं दिव्यरूपिणः । तत्सर्वं ग्रसते सूर्यस्तेन पिण्डो जरायुतः ॥७६॥
transliteration: atha viparītakaraṇī | yat kiñcit sravate candrād amr̥taṃ divyarūpiṇaḥ | tat sarvaṃ grasate sūryas tena piṇḍo jarāyutaḥ || 3.76 ||
translation_danish: [3.76] Solen sluger al nektar, som undslipper den guddommelige måne. Kroppens aldring er forbundet med dette. [3. 77] Der findes en guddommelig teknik, som snyder solens gab. Den skal læres ved en gurus instruktioner; ikke ved 10 millioner tekstlige udlægninger.
translation_english: [3.76] These three Bandhas are the best of all and have been practised by the masters. Of all the means of success in the Haṭha Yoga, they are known to the Yogīs as the chief ones.

sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वनाभेरधस्तालोरूर्ध्वं भानुरधः शशी । करणी विपरीताख्या गुरुवाक्येन लभ्यते ॥७८॥
transliteration: ūrdhvanābher adhas tālor ūrdhvaṃ bhānur adhaḥ śaśī | karaṇī viparītākhyā guruvākyena labhyate || 3.78 ||
translation_danish: [3.78] Navlen op - ganen ned; solen op - månen ned. Teknikken kaldes Viparīta  og mestres ved hjælp af guruens instruktioner.
translation_english: [3.78] Above the navel and below the palate respectively, are the Sūrya and the Chandra. The exercise, called the Viparīta Karaṇī, is learnt from the guru's instructions.

sanskrit: नित्यमभ्यासयुक्तस्य जठराग्निविवर्धिनी । आहारो बहुलस्तस्य सम्पाद्यः साधकस्य च । अल्पाहारो यदि भवेदग्निर्दहति तत्क्षणात् ॥७९॥
transliteration: nityam abhyāsayuktasya jaṭharāgnivivardhanī | āhāro bahulas tasya sampādyaḥ sādhakasya ca | alpāhāro yadi bhaved agnir dahati tatkṣaṇāt || 3.79 ||
translation_danish: [3.79] Daglig øvelse øger forbrændingen, og sādhakaen bør indtage mere mad. Hvis det er for lidt mad, vil ilden brænde det op på et øjeblik.
translation_english: [3.79] This exercise increases the appetite; and, therefore, one who practises it, should obtain a good supply of food. If the food be scanty, it will burn him at once.

sanskrit: अधः शिराश्चोर्ध्वपादः क्षणं स्यात्प्रथमे दिने । क्षणाच्च किंचिदधिकमभ्यसेच्च दिने दिने ॥८०॥
transliteration: adhaḥ śirāś cordhvapādaḥ kṣaṇaṃ syāt prathame dine | kṣaṇāc ca kiṃcid adhikam abhyasec ca dine dine || 3.80 ||
translation_danish: [3.80] Første dag bør hovedet være nede og fødderne oppe et øjeblik. Praktisér lidt længere end et øjeblik for hver dag.
translation_english: [3.80] Place the head on the ground and the feet up into the sky, for a second only the first day, and increase this time daily.

sanskrit: वलितं पलितं चैव षण्मासोर्ध्वं न दृश्यते । याममात्रं तु यो नित्यमभ्यसेत्स तु कालजित् ॥८१॥
transliteration: valitaṃ palitaṃ caiva ṣaṇmāsordhvaṃ na dr̥śyate | yāmamātraṃ tu yo nityam abhyaset sa tu kālajit || 3.81 ||
translation_danish: [3.81] Rynker og grå hår bliver usynlige efter seks måneder. Yogien, som praktiserer tre timer dagligt, overvinder døden. Dette er Vajrolīmudrā:
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: अथ वज्रोली स्वेच्छया वर्तमानोऽपि योगोक्तैर्नियमैर्विना । वज्रोलीं यो विजानाति स योगी सिद्धिभाजनम् ॥८२॥
transliteration: atha vajrolī svecchayā vartamāno'pi yogoktair niyamair vinā | vajrolīṃ yo vijānāti sa yogī siddhibhājanam || 3.82 ||
translation_danish: [3.82] Den yogī, som kender vajrolīmudrā, får andel i fuldkomne siddhier.  Han kan leve, som han ønsker, uden hensyn til yogalærens niyama.
translation_english: [3.82] After six months, the wrinkles and grey hair are not seen. He who practises it daily, even for two hours, conquers death.

sanskrit: तत्र वस्तुद्वयं वक्ष्ये दुर्लभं यस्य कस्यचित् । क्षीरं चैकं द्वितीयं तु नाडी च वशवर्तिनी ॥८३॥
transliteration: tatra vastudvayaṃ vakṣye durlabhaṃ yasya kasyacit | kṣīraṃ caikaṃ dvitīyaṃ tu nāḍī  ca vaśavartinī || 3.83 ||
translation_danish: [3.83] I denne sammenhæng vil jeg fortælle om to ting, som er vanskelige at opnå for alle og enhver: den ene er mælk og den anden er en villig kvinde.
translation_english: [3.83] Even if one who lives a wayward life, without observing any rules of Yoga, but performs Vajrolī, deserves success and is a Yogī.

sanskrit: मेहनेन शनैः सम्यगूर्ध्वाकुञ्चनमभ्यसेत् । पुरुषोप्यथवा नारी वज्रोलीसिद्धिमाप्नुयात् ॥८४॥
transliteration: mehanena śanaiḥ samyag ūrdhvākuñcanam abhyaset | puruṣopy  athavā nārī vajrolīsiddhim āpnuyāt || 3.84 ||
translation_danish: [3.84] Praktisér roligt ved at trække sammen og op via urinrøret. Både en mand og en kvinde kan opnå effekten af Vajrolīmudrā.
translation_english: [3.84] Two things are necessary for this, and these are difficult to get for the ordinary people—(1) milk and (2) a woman behaving, as desired.

sanskrit: यत्नतः शस्तनालेन फूत्कारं वज्रकन्दरे । शनैः शनैः प्रकुर्वीत वायुसञ्चारकारणात् ॥८५॥
transliteration: yatnataḥ śastanālena phūtkāraṃ vajrakandare | śanaiḥ śanaiḥ prakurvīta vāyusañcārakāraṇāt || 3.85 ||
translation_danish: [3.85] Ved hjælp af et overskåret sivrør i penis frembringer man forsigtigt en “phūt”-lyd, som opstår ved luftens gennemstrømning.
translation_english: [3.85] By practising to draw in the bindu, discharged during cohabitation, whether one be a man or a woman, one obtains success in the practice of Vajrolī.

sanskrit: नारीभगे पतद्बिन्दुमभ्यासेनोर्ध्वमाहरेत् । चलितं च निजं बिन्दुमूर्ध्वमाकृष्य रक्षयेत् ॥८६॥
transliteration: nārībhage patadbindum abhyāsenordhvam āharet | calitaṃ ca nijaṃ bindum ūrdhvam ākr̥ṣya rakṣayet || 3.86 ||
translation_danish: [3.86] Træk energisk bindu op, som er faldet ned i kvindens hulrum. Efter at have trukket sin egen bindu op, skal man holde på den.
translation_english: [3.86] By means of a pipe, one should blow air slowly into the passage in the male organ.

sanskrit: एवं संरक्षयेद्बिन्दुं मृत्युं जयति योगवित् । मरणं बिन्दुपातेन जीवनं बिन्दुधारणात् ॥८७॥
transliteration: evaṃ saṃrakṣayed binduṃ jayati yogavit | maraṇaṃ bindupātena jīvanaṃ bindudhāraṇāt || 3.87 ||
translation_danish: [3.87] Således bør den yogakyndige beskytte sin bindu og derved besejre døden. Tab af bindu er døden. Fastholdelse af bindu er livet.
translation_english: [3.87] By practice, the discharged bindu is drawn out. One can draw back and preserve one's own discharged bindu.

sanskrit: सुगन्घो योगिनो देहे जायते बिन्दुधारणात् । यावद्बिन्दुः स्थिरो देहे तावत्कालभयं कुतः ॥८८॥
transliteration: sugandho yogino dehe jāyate bindudhāraṇāt | yāvad binduḥ sthiro dehe tāvat kālabhayaṃ kutaḥ || 3.88 ||
translation_danish: [3.88] En liflig duft udgår fra yogiens krop, når binduen bevares. Hvem vil da frygte tidens tand, når binduen er ubevægelig i kroppen?
translation_english: [3.88] The Yogī who can protect his bindu thus, overcomes death; because death comes by discharging bindu, and life is prolonged by its preservation.

sanskrit: चित्तायत्तं नृणां शुक्रं शुक्रायत्तं च जीवितम् । तस्माच्छुक्रं मनश्चैव रक्षणीयं प्रयत्नत: ॥८९॥
transliteration: cittāyattaṃ nrṇāṃ śukraṃ śukrāyattaṃ ca jīvitam | tasmāc chukraṃ manaś caiva rakṣaṇīyaṃ prayatnataḥ || 3.89 ||
translation_danish: [3.89] Mandens sæd beror på sind, og liv beror på sæd. Derfor skal sæd og sind ihærdigt beskyttes. Dette er Sahajolī:
translation_english: [3.89] By preserving bindu, the body of the Yogī emits a pleasing smell. There is no fear of death, so long as the bindu is well-established in the body.

sanskrit: अथ सहजोलिः सहजोलिश्चामरोलिर्वज्रोल्या एव भेदत: । जले सुभस्म निक्शिप्य दग्धगोमयसम्भवम् ॥ वज्रोलीमैथुनादूर्ध्वं स्त्रीपुंसो: स्वाङ्गलेपनम् । आसीनयो: सुखेनैव मुक्तव्यापारयो: क्षणात् ॥९० ॥
transliteration: atha sahajoliḥ sahajoliś cāmarolir vajrolyā eva bhedataḥ | jale subhasma nikṣipya dagdhagomayasambhavam || vajrolīmaithunād ūrdhvaṃ strīpuṃsoḥ svāṅgalepanam | āsīnayoḥ sukhenaiva muktavyāpārayoḥ kṣaṇāt || 3.90 ||
translation_danish: [3.90] Sahajolī og Amarolī er begge opdelinger af selv samme Vajrolī. Læg god aske, lavet af brændte kokasser, i vand. Når manden og kvinden har siddet et kort nydelsesfuldt øjeblik efter anstrengelsen ved Vajrolī-samleje, indsmører de deres intime dele.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: सहजोलिरियं प्रोक्ता श्रद्धेया योगिभि: सदा । अयं शुभकरो योगो योगिमुक्तिविमुक्तिदः ॥९१॥
transliteration: sahajolir iyaṃ proktā śraddheyā yogibhiḥ sadā | ayaṃ śubhakaro yogo yogimuktivimuktidaḥ  || 3.91 ||
translation_danish: [3.91] Dette siges at være Sahajolī. Yogierne anser den for evigt pålidelig. Denne lykkebringende yoga skænker udfrielse, selvom den er fuld af nydelse.
translation_english: [3.91] The bindu of men is under the control of the mind, and life is dependent on the bindu. Hence, mind and bindu should be protected by all means.

sanskrit: अयं योग: पुण्यवतां धीराणां तत्त्वदर्शिनाम् । निर्मत्सराणां सिध्येन्न तु मत्सरशालिनाम् ॥९२॥
transliteration: ayaṃ yogaḥ puṇyavatāṃ dhīrāṇāṃ tattvadarśinām | nirmatsarāṇāṃ sidhyen na tu matsaraśālinām || 3.92 ||
translation_danish: [3.92] Denne yoga vil være succesfuld for de dydige og for dem, der har erfaret det virkelige og for de uselviske; men ikke for dem, der er fulde af selviskhed. Dette er Amarolī:
translation_english: [3.92] Sahajolī and Amarolī are only the different kinds of Vajrolī. Ashes from burnt up cowdung should be mixed with water.

sanskrit: अथामरोली अमरीं य: पिबेन्नित्यं नस्यं कुर्वन्दिने दिने । वज्रोलीमभ्यसेत्सम्यगमरोलीति कथ्यते ॥९३॥
transliteration: athāmarolī amarīṃ yaḥ piben nityaṃ nasyaṃ kurvan dine dine | vajrolīm abhyaset samyag amarolīti kathyate || 3.93 ||
translation_danish: [3.93] Den, som drikker amarī jævnligt, dag for dag, med næsen, vil praktisere Vajrolī korrekt. Dette kaldes Amarolī.
translation_english: [3.93] Being free from the exercise of Vajrolī, man and woman should both rub it on their bodies.

sanskrit: अभ्यासान्नि:सृतां चान्द्रीं विभुत्या सह मिश्रयेत् । धारयेदुत्तमाङ्गेषु दिव्यदृष्टि: प्रजायते ॥९४॥
transliteration: abhyāsān niḥsr̥tāṃ cāndrīṃ vibhūtyā saha miśrayet | dhārayed uttamāṅgeṣu divyadr̥ṣṭiḥ prajāyate || 3.94 ||
translation_danish: [3.94] Bland månenektar affødt af praksis med aske. Smør den på de ædlere dele, hvilket frembringer et guddommeligt syn.
translation_english: [3.94] This is called Sahajolī, and should be relied on by Yogīs. It does good and gives mokṣa.

sanskrit: पुंसो बिन्दुं समाकुञ्च्य सम्यगभ्यासपाटवात् । यदि नारी रजो रक्षेद्वज्रोल्या सापि योगिनी ॥९५॥
transliteration: puṃso binduṃ samākuñcya samyag abhyāsapāṭavāt | yadi nārī rajo rakṣed vajrolyā sāpi yoginī || 3.95 ||
translation_danish: [3.95] Hvis en kvinde fastholder sin rajas ved hjælp af Vajrolīmudrā, efter at have trukket mandens bindu op ved denne praksis, så er hun i sandhed en yoginī.
translation_english: [3.95] This Yoga is achieved by courageous wise men, who are free from sloth, and cannot he accomplished by the slothful.

sanskrit: तस्याः किञ्चिद्रजो नाशं न गच्छति न संशयः । तस्याः शरीरनादस्तु बिन्दुतामेव गच्छति ॥९६॥
transliteration: tasyāḥ kiñcid rajo nāśaṃ na gacchati na saṃśayaḥ | tasyāḥ śarīranādas tu bindutām eva gacchati || 3.96 ||
translation_danish: [3.96] En del af hendes rajas går ikke tabt i hendes krop - herom er der ingen tvivl - og hendes nāda omdannes til bindu.
translation_english: [3.96] In the doctrine of the sect of the Kapālikas, the Amarolī is the drinking of the mid stream; leaving the 1st, as it is a mixture of too much bile and the last, which is useless.

sanskrit: स बिन्दुस्तद्रजश्चैव एकीभूय स्वदेहगौ । वज्रोल्यभ्यासयोगेन सर्वसिद्धिं प्रयच्छतः ॥९७॥
transliteration: sa bindus tad rajaś caiva ekībhūya svadehagau | vajrolyabhyāsayogena sarvasiddhiṃ prayacchataḥ || 3.97 ||
translation_danish: [3.97] Ved hjælp af yogapraksissen Vajrolīmudrā bliver bindu og rajas forenet i ens egen krop. De fører til fuldkomne siddhier.
translation_english: [3.97] He who drinks Amarī, snuffs it daily, and practices Vajrolī, is called practising Amarolī.

sanskrit: रक्षेदाकुञ्चनादूर्ध्वं या रजः सा हि योगिनी । अतीतानागतं वेत्ति खेचरी च भवेद्ध्रुवम् ॥९८॥
transliteration: rakṣed ākuñcanād ūrdhvaṃ yā rajaḥ sā hi yoginī | atītānāgataṃ vetti khecarī ca bhaved dhruvam || 3.98 ||
translation_danish: [3.98] En kvinde, som fastholder rajas ved at trække den opad, hun er i sandhed en yoginī. Hun kender fortiden og fremtiden og vil for evigt være en khecarī.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: देहसिद्धिं च लभते वज्रोल्यभ्यासयोगतः । अयं पुण्यकरो योगो भोगे भुक्तेऽपि मुक्तिदः ॥९९॥
transliteration: dehasiddhiṃ ca labhate vajrolyabhyāsayogataḥ | ayaṃ puṇyakaro yogo bhoge bhukte'pi muktidaḥ || 3.99 ||
translation_danish: [3.99] Yogien opnår kropslig fuldkommenhed ved hjælp af yogapraksissen Vajrolīmudrā. Denne berigende yoga giver udfrielse, selv i forbindelse med seksuel nydelse. Dette er Śakticālana:
translation_english: [3.99] The bindu discharged in the practice of Vajrolī should be mixed with ashes, and the rubbing it on the best parts of the body gives divine sight.

sanskrit: अथ शक्तिचालनम् कुटिलाङ्गी कुण्डलिनी भुजङ्गी शक्तिरीश्वरी । कुण्डल्यरुन्धती चैते शब्दा: पयार्यवाचका: ॥१००॥
transliteration: atha śakticālanam kuṭilāṅgī kuṇḍalinī bhujaṅgī śaktir īśvarī | kuṇḍaly arundhatī caite śabdāḥ paryāyavācakāḥ || 3.100 ||
translation_danish: [3.100] Kuṭilāṅgī, Kuṇḍalinī, Bhujaṅgī, Śakti, Īśvarī, Kuṇḍalī og Arundhatī - disse ord er synonymer.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: उद्घाटयेत्कपाटं तु यथा कुञ्चिकया हठात् । कुण्डलिन्या तथा योगी मोक्षद्वारं विभेदयेत् ॥१०१॥
transliteration: udghāṭayet kapāṭaṃ tu yathā kuñcikayā haṭhāt | kuṇḍalinyā tathā yogī mokṣadvāraṃ vibhedayet || 3.101 ||
translation_danish: [3.101] Haṭhayoga er som at åbne en dør med en nøgle. Ligeså bryder yogien igennem udfrielsens port ved hjælp af Kuṇḍalinī.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: येन मार्गेण गन्तव्यं ब्रह्मस्थानं निरामयम् । मुखेनाच्छाद्य तद्द्वारं  प्रसुप्ता परमेश्वरी ॥१०२॥
transliteration: yena mārgeṇa gantavyaṃ brahmasthānaṃ nirāmayam | mukhenācchādya tad dvāraṃ prasuptā parameśvarī || 3.102 ||
translation_danish: [3.102] Den vej, der følges til Brahmans ubesmittede tilholdssted, er spærret af døren. Den højeste gudinde sover.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: कन्दोर्ध्वं कुण्डली शक्ति: सुप्ता मोक्षाय योगिनाम् । बन्धनाय च मूढानां यस्तां वेत्ति स योगवित् ॥१०३॥
transliteration: kandordhvaṃ kuṇḍalī śaktiḥ suptā mokṣāya yoginām | bandhanāya ca mūḍhānāṃ yas tāṃ vetti sa yogavit || 3.103 ||
translation_danish: [3.103] Kuṇḍalinī Śakti sover over roden.  Hun fører yogierne til udfrielse og binder de uvidende. Den, der kender hende, er yogakyndig.
translation_english: NA

sanskrit: कुण्डली कुटिलाकारा सर्पवत्परिकीर्तिता । सा शक्तिश्चालिता येन स मुक्तो नात्र संशय: ॥१०४॥
transliteration: kuṇḍalī kuṭilākārā sarpavat parikīrtitā | sā śaktiś cālitā yena sa mukto nātra saṃśayaḥ || 3.104 ||
translation_danish: [3.104] Kuṇḍalī siges at være sammenrullet som en slange. Den, som sætter denne śakti i bevægelse, udfries. Herom er der ingen tvivl.
translation_english: [3.104] Kutilāngī (crooked-bodied), Kuṇḍalinī, Bhujangī (a she-serpent) Śakti, Iśhwarī, Kundalī, Arundhatī,—all these words are synonymous.

sanskrit: गङ्गायमुनयोर्मध्ये बालरण्डां तपस्विनीम् । बलात्कारेण गृह्णीयात्तद्विष्णो: परमं पदम् ॥१०५॥
transliteration: gaṅgāyamunayor madhye bālaraṇḍāṃ tapasvinīm | balātkāreṇa gr̥hṇīyāt tad viṣṇoḥ paramaṃ padam || 3.105 ||
translation_danish: [3.105] Grib den asketiske barneenke,  som befinder sig mellem Gaṅgā og Yamunā, med tvang. Dette er Viṣṇus højeste stadie.
translation_english: [3.105] As a door is opened with a key, so the Yogī opens the door of mukti by opening Kuṇḍalinī by means of Haṭha Yoga.

sanskrit: इडा भगवती गङ्गा पिङ्गला यमुना नदी । इडापिङ्गलयोर्मध्ये बालरण्डा च कुण्डली ॥१०६॥
transliteration: iḍā bhagavatī gaṅgā piṅgalā yamunā nadī | iḍāpiṅgalayor madhye bālaraṇḍā ca kuṇḍalī || 3.106 ||
translation_danish: [3.106] Iḍā er den hellige Gaṅgā og Piṅgalā er floden Yamunā. Kuṇḍalī er barneenken mellem Iḍā og Piṅgalā.
translation_english: [3.106] The Parameśwarī (Kuṇḍalinī) sleeps, covering the hole of the passage by which one can go to the seat of Brahma which is free from pains. [3.106] Keeping the feet in Vajra-āsana (Padma-āsana), hold them firmly with the hands. The position of the bulb then will be near the ankle joint, where it should be pressed.

sanskrit: पुच्छे प्रगृह्य भुजङ्गीं सुप्तामुद्बोधयेच्च ताम् । निद्रां विहाय सा शक्तिरूर्ध्वमुत्तिष्ठते हठात् ॥१०७॥
transliteration: pucche pragr̥hya bhujaṅgīṃ suptām udbodhayec ca tām | nidrāṃ vihāya sā śaktir ūrdhvam uttiṣṭhate haṭhāt || 3.107 ||
translation_danish: [3.107] Tag den sovende slange i halen og væk hende. Śakti rejser sig opad, forladt af søvnen, i kraft af haṭhayoga.
translation_english: [3.107] Kuṇḍalī Sakti sleeps on the bulb, for the purpose of giving moksa to Yogīs and bondage to the ignorant. He who knows it, knows Yoga.

sanskrit: अवस्थिता चैव फणावती सा प्रातश्च सायं प्रहरार्धमात्रम् । प्रपूर्य सूर्यात्परिधानयुक्त्या प्रगृह्य नित्यं परिचालनीया ॥१०८॥
transliteration: avasthitā caiva phaṇāvatī sā prātaś ca sāyaṃ praharārdhamātram | prapūrya sūryāt paridhānayuktyā pragr̥hya nityaṃ paricālanīyā || 3.108 ||
translation_danish: [3.108] Ånd ind via solen.  Tag fat ved hjælp af Paridhāna. Bevæg den dvælende kobraslange vedvarende halvanden time morgen og aften. [3.108] Den måler over tolv fingre, men er fire fingre i diameter. Den siges at være blød, blændende hvid og fremstår som et stykke sammenrullet stof.
translation_english: [3.108] Kuṇḍalī is of a bent shape, and has been described to be like a serpent. He who has moved that Śakti is no doubt Mukta (released from bondage).

sanskrit: सति वज्रासने पादौ कराभ्यां धारयेद्दृढम् । गुल्फदेशसमीपे च कन्दं तत्र प्रपीडयेत् ॥११०॥
transliteration: sati vajrāsane pādau karābhyāṃ dhārayed dr̥ḍham | gulphadeśasamīpe ca kandaṃ tatra prapīḍet || 3.110 ||
translation_danish: [3.110] Indtag Vajrāsana.  Hold fødderne fast med begge hænder, nær ved anklerne, og pres mod rodknolden.
translation_english: [3.110] Idā is called goddess Ganges, Pingalā goddess Yamunā. In the middle of the Idā and the Pingalā is the infant widow, Kuṇḍalī.

sanskrit: वज्रासने स्थितो योगी चालयित्वा च कुण्डलीम् । कुर्यादनन्तरं भस्त्रां कुण्डलीमाशु बोधयेत् ॥१११॥
transliteration: vajrāsane sthito yogī cālayitvā ca kuṇḍalīm | kuryād anantaraṃ bhastrāṃ kuṇḍalīm āśu bodhayet || 3.111 ||
translation_danish: [3.111] Yogien bør forblive i Vajrāsana og sætte Kuṇḍalinī i bevægelse. Umiddelbart efter udføres Bhastrikākumbhaka. Dette vil hurtigt vække Kuṇḍalinī.
translation_english: [3.111] This sleeping she-serpent should be awakened by catching hold of her tail. By the force of Haṭha, the Śakti leaves her sleep, and starts upwards.

sanskrit: भानोराकुञ्चनं कुर्यात्कुण्डलीं चालयेत्तत: । मृत्युवक्त्रगतस्यापि तस्य मृत्युभयं कुत: ॥११२॥
transliteration: bhānor ākuñcanaṃ kuryāt kuṇḍalīṃ cālayet tataḥ | mr̥tyuvaktragatasyāpi tasya mr̥tyubhayaṃ kutaḥ || 3.112 ||
translation_danish: [3.112] Ånd ud via solen og bevæg derefter Kuṇḍalinī. Hvor er dødsangsten, selv for den, der står ansigt til ansigt med døden?
translation_english: [3.112] This she-serpent is situated in Mūlādhār. She should be caught and moved daily, morning and evening, for ½ a prahar (1½ hours), by filling with air through Pingalā by the Paridhana method.

sanskrit: मुहूर्तद्वयपर्यन्तं निर्भयं चालनादसौ । ऊर्ध्वमाकृष्यते किञ्चित्सुषुम्नायां समुद्गता ॥११३॥
transliteration: muhūrtadvayaparyantaṃ nirbhayaṃ cālanād asau | ūrdhvam ākr̥ṣyate kiñcit suṣumṇāyāṃ samudgatā || 3.113 ||
translation_danish: [3.113] Træk den udstrakte Kuṇḍalinī et stykke op i Suṣumṇā. Bevæg den frygtløst i op til to gange otteogfyrre minutter.
translation_english: [3.113] The bulb is above the anus, a vitasti (12 angulas) long, and measures 4 angulas (3 inches) in extent and is soft and white, and appears as if a folded cloth.

sanskrit: तेन कुण्डलिनी तस्या: सुषुम्नाया मुखं ध्रुवम् । जहाति तस्मात्प्राणोऽयं सुषुम्नां व्रजति स्वत: ॥११४॥
transliteration: tena kuṇḍalinī tasyāḥ suṣumṇāyā mukhaṃ dhruvam | jahāti tasmāt prāṇo'yaṃ suṣumṇāṃ vrajati svataḥ || 3.114 ||
translation_danish: [3.114] Derved bevæger Kuṇḍalinī sig med sikkerhed bort fra Suṣumṇās mund. Når hun forlader den, fortsætter prāṇaen i Suṣumṇā helt af sig selv.
translation_english: [3.114] Keeping the feet in Vajra-āsana (Padma-āsana), hold them firmly with the hands. The position of the bulb then will be near the ankle joint, where it should be pressed.

sanskrit: तस्मात्सञ्चालयेन्नित्यं सुखसुप्तामरुन्धतीम् । तस्या: सञ्चालनेनैव योगी रोगै: प्रमुच्यते ॥११५॥
transliteration: tasmāt sañcālayen nityaṃ sukhasuptām arundhatīm | tasyāḥ sañcālanenaiva yogī rogaiḥ pramucyate || 3.115 ||
translation_danish: [3.115] Efterfølgende bør den sødt sovende Arundhatī  sættes i bevægelse jævnligt. Alene ved aktiveringen af den, bliver yogien fri for alle sygdomme.
translation_english: [3.115] The Yogī, sitting with Vajra-āsana and having moved Kuṇḍalī, should perform Bhastrikā to awaken the Kuṇḍalī soon.

sanskrit: येन सञ्चालिता शक्ति: स योगी सिद्धिभाजनम् । किमत्र बहुनोक्तेन कालं जयति लीलया ॥११६॥
transliteration: yena sañcālitā śaktiḥ sa yogī siddhibhājanam | kim atra bahunoktena kālaṃ jayati līlayā || 3.116 ||
translation_danish: [3.116] Den yogi, der aktiverer śakti, får del i magiske kræfter. Hvorfor så megen snak om denne sag? Yogien besejrer jo døden som en leg!
translation_english: [3.116] Bhānu (Sūrya, near the navel) should be contracted (by contracting the navel) which will move the Kuṇḍalī. There is no fear for him who does so, even if he has entered the mouth of death.

sanskrit: ब्रह्मचर्यरतस्यैव नित्यं हितमिताशिन: । मण्डलाद्दृश्यते सिद्धि:कुण्डल्यभ्यासयोगिन: ॥११७॥
transliteration: brahmacaryaratasyaiva nityaṃ hitamitāśinaḥ | maṇḍalād dr̥śyate siddhiḥ kuṇḍalyabhyāsayoginaḥ || 3.117 ||
translation_danish: [3.117] Kun hos en yogi, der nyder seksuel afholdenhed og altid spiser passende og moderat, ses succes i kuṇḍalinīpraksis efter et stykke tid.
translation_english: [3.117] By moving this, for two muhūrtas, it is drawn up a little by entering the Suṣumnā (spinal column).

sanskrit: कुण्डलीं चालयित्वा तु भस्त्रां कुर्याद्विशेषतः । एवमभ्यसतो नित्यं यमिनो यमभीः कुतः ॥११८॥
transliteration: kuṇḍalīṃ cālayitvā tu bhastrāṃ kuryād viśeṣataḥ | evam abhyasato nityaṃ yamino yamabhīḥ kutaḥ || 3.118 ||
translation_danish: [3.118] Udfør især Bhastrikākumbhaka efter at have aktiveret Kuṇḍalinī. Hvor er frygten for døden for den selvdisciplinerede, der vedvarende praktiserer således?
translation_english: [3.118] By this Kuṇḍalinī leaves the entrance of the Suṣumnā at once, and the Prāṇa enters it of itself.

sanskrit: द्वासप्ततिसहस्राणां नाडीनां मलशोधने । कुतः प्रक्षालनोपायः कुण्डल्यभ्यसनादृते ॥११९॥
transliteration: dvāsaptatisahasrāṇāṃ nāḍīnāṃ malaśodhane | kutaḥ prakṣālanopāyaḥ kuṇḍalyabhyasanād r̥te || 3.119 ||
translation_danish: [3.119] Hvilket middel - andet end Kuṇḍalinī-praksis - findes der til at rense de 72.000 kanaler for urenheder?
translation_english: [3.119] Therefore, this comfortably sleeping Arundhatī should always be moved; for by so doing the Yogī gets rid of diseases.

sanskrit: इयं तु मध्यमा नाडी दृढाभ्यासेन योगिनाम् । आसनप्राणसंयाममुद्राभिः सरला भवेत् ॥१२०॥
transliteration: iyaṃ tu madhyamā nāḍī dr̥ḍhābhyāsena yoginām | āsanaprāṇasaṃyāmamudrābhiḥ saralā bhavet || 3.120 ||
translation_danish: [3.120] Den midterste kanal bliver fremkommelig ved at yogien vedholdende praktiserer kropslige āsanaer, prāṇayāmaer og mudrāer.
translation_english: [3.120] The Yogī, who has been able to move the Śakti deserves success. It is useless to say more, suffice it to say that he conquers death playfully.

sanskrit: अभ्यासे तु विनिद्राणां मनो धृत्वा समाधिना । रुद्राणी वा परा मुद्रा भद्रां सिद्धिं प्रयच्छति ॥१२१॥
transliteration: abhyāse tu vinidrāṇāṃ mano dhr̥tvā samādhinā | rudrāṇī vā parā mudrā bhadrāṃ siddhiṃ prayacchati || 3.121 ||
translation_danish: [3.121] Holdes sindet årvågent i kraft af samādhi når man praktiserer, da skænker rudrāṇī eller andre mudrāer et fortræffeligt resultat.
translation_english: [3.121] The Yogī observing Brahmacharya (continence and always eating sparingly, gets success within 40 days by practice with the Kuṇḍalinī.

sanskrit: राजयोगं विना पृथ्वी राजयोगं विना निशा । राजयोगं विना मुद्रा विचित्रापि न शोभते ।। १२२
transliteration: rājayogaṃ vinā pr̥thvī rājayogaṃ vinā niśā | rājayogaṃ vinā mudrā vicitrāpi na śobhate || 3.122 ||
translation_danish: [3.122] Jorden foruden rājayoga, natten foruden rājayoga og selv de mange mudrāer foruden rājayoga er ugunstige.
translation_english: [3.122] After moving the Kuṇḍalī, plenty of Bhastrā should be performed. By such practice, he has no fear from the god of death.

sanskrit: मारुतस्य विधिं सर्वं मनोयुक्तं समभ्यसेत् । इतरत्र  न कर्तव्या मनोवृत्तिर्मनीषिणा ॥१२३॥
transliteration: mārutasya vidhiṃ sarvaṃ manoyuktaṃ samabhyaset | itaratra na kartavyā manovr̥ttir manīṣiṇā || 3.123 ||
translation_danish: [3.123] Alle åndedrætsteknikker bør udføres med et koncentreret sind. De vise retter ikke sindets opmærksomhed andensteds hen.
translation_english: [3.123] There is no other way, but the practice of the Kuṇḍalī, for washing away the impurities of 72,000 Nādīs.

sanskrit: इति मुद्रा दश प्रोक्ता आदिनाथेन शम्भुना । एकैका तासु यमिनां महासिद्धिप्रदायिनी ॥१२४॥
transliteration: iti mudrā daśa proktā ādināthena śambhunā | ekaikā tāsu yamināṃ mahāsiddhipradāyinī || 3.124 ||
translation_danish: [3.124] Dette var de ti mudrāer, som er beskrevet af den oprindelige herre Śambhu.  Hver eneste af disse giver de selvdisciplinerede store overnaturlige kræfter.
translation_english: [3.124] This middle Nādī becomes straight by steady practice of postures; Prāṇāyāma and Mudrās of Yogīs.

sanskrit: उपदेशं हि मुद्राणां यो दत्ते साम्प्रदायिकम् । स एव श्रीगुरुः स्वामी साक्षादीश्वर एव सः ॥१२५॥
transliteration: upadeśaṃ hi mudrāṇāṃ yo datte sāmpradāyikam | sa eva śrīguruḥ svāmī sākṣād īśvara eva saḥ || 3.125 ||
translation_danish: [3.125] Yogien, som viderebringer traditionens lære om mudrāer, er Śrīguru, han er Svāmī, han er Herren Śiva i menneskelig form.
translation_english: [3.125] Those whose sleep has decreased by practice and mind has become calm by samādhi, get beneficial accomplishments by Sāmbhavī and other Mudrās.

sanskrit: तस्य वाक्यपरो भूत्वा मुद्राभ्यासे समाहितः । अणिमादिगुणैश्वर्य लभते कालवञ्चनम् ॥१२६॥
transliteration: tasya vākyaparo bhūtvā mudrābhyāse samāhitaḥ | aṇimādiguṇaiśvarya  labhate kālavañcanam || 3.126 ||
translation_danish: [3.126] Han, der tilegner sig dette som den højeste lære og derpå hengiver sig til at praktisere mudrāer, han snyder døden og opnår de overnaturlige kræfter at kunne blive helt lille og så videre.
