Således slutter tredie belæring i Haṭhapradīpikā ved navn ‘Instruktion i mudrāer’  udarbejdet af Svātmarāma Yogendra fra Sahajānanda Cintāmani-successionen. Fjerde belæring
translation_english: [3.126] Without Raja Yoga, this earth, the night, and the Mudrās, be they howsoever wonderful, do not appear beautiful. [5]

sanskrit: इति सहमानन्दसंतानचिन्तामणि स्वात्मारामयोगीन्द्र विरचितायां हठप्रदीपिकायां मुद्राविधानं नाम तृतीयोपदेशः॥ चतुर्थोपदेशः नमः शिवाय गुरवे नादबिन्दुकलात्मने । निरञ्जनपदं याति नित्यं यत्र परायणः ॥१॥
transliteration: iti sahamānandasaṃtānacintāmaṇi svātmārāmayogīndra viracitāyāṃ haṭhapradīpikāyāṃ mudrāvidhānaṃ nāma tr̥tīyopadeśaḥ || caturthopadeśaḥ namaḥ śivāya gurave nādabindukalātmane | nirañjanapadaṃ yāti nityaṃ yatra parāyaṇaḥ || 4.1 ||
translation_danish: [4.1] Ærbødig hilsen til guruen Śiva, der har nāda, bindu og kalā som sin natur. Han, der er helt hengiven til Śiva, går til det evigt rene sted.
translation_english: [4.1] Salutation to the Gurū, the dispenser of happiness to all, appearing as Nāda, Vindū and Kalā. One who is devoted to Him, obtains the highest bliss.

sanskrit: अथेदा नीं  प्रवक्ष्यामि समाधिक्रममुत्तमम् । मृत्युघ्नं च सुखोपायं ब्रह्मानन्दकरं परम् ॥२॥
transliteration: athedānīṃ pravakṣyāmi samādhikramam uttamam | mr̥tyughnaṃ ca sukhopāyaṃ brahmānandakaraṃ param || 4.2 ||
translation_danish: [4.2] Nu vil jeg redegøre for det højeste niveau af samādhi, som er ensbetydende med overvindelsen af døden, opnåelsen af lykken og frembringelsen af den højeste fryd i brahman.
translation_english: [4.2] Now I will describe a regular method of attaining to Samādhi, which destroys death, is the means for obtaining happiness, and gives the Brahmānanda.

sanskrit: राजयोगः समाधिश्च उन्मनी च मनोन्मनी । अमरत्वं लयस्तत्त्वं शून्याशून्यं परं पदम् ॥३॥ अमनस्कं तथाद्वैतं निरालम्बं निरञ्जनम् । जीवन्मुक्तिश्च सहजा तुर्या चेत्येकवाचकाः ॥४॥
transliteration: rājayogaḥ samādhiś ca unmanī ca manonmanī | amaratvaṃ layas tattvaṃ śūnyāśūnyaṃ paraṃ padam || 4.3 || amanaskaṃ tathādvaitaṃ nirālambaṃ nirañjanam | jīvanmuktiś ca sahajā turyā cety ekavācakāḥ || 4.4 ||
translation_danish: [4.3-4] Rājayoga, samādhi, unmanī, manonmanī, amaratva, tattva, śūnyā-aśūnya, paraṃ pada, amanaska, advaita, nirālamba, nirañjana, jīvanmukti, sahaja og tūrya er alle synonymer.
translation_english: [4.4] namaḥ śivāya ghurave nāda-bindu-kalātmane | [4.3] amanaskaṃ tathādvaitaṃ nirālambaṃ nirañjanam | [4.4] Raja Yogī, Samādhi, Unmani, Mauonmanī, Amarativa, Laya, Tatwa, Sūnya, Aśūnya, Parama Pada, Amanaska, Adwaitama, Nirãlamba, Nirañjana, Jīwana Mukti, Sahajā, Turyā, are all synonymous.

sanskrit: सलिले सैन्धवं यद्वत्साम्यं भजति योगतः । तथात्ममनसोरैक्यं समाधिरभिधीयते ॥५॥
transliteration: salile saindhavaṃ yadvat sāmyaṃ bhajati yogataḥ | tathātmamanasor aikyaṃ samādhir abhidhīyate || 4.5 ||
translation_danish: [4.5] Ligesom salt opløser sig og fordeler sig ligeligt i vand, således er sindets og selvets enhed. Dette kaldes samādhi.
translation_english: [4.5] As salt being dissolved in water becomes one with it, so when ātmā and mind become one, it is called Samādhi.

sanskrit: यदा संक्षीयते प्राणो मानसं च प्रलीयते । तदा समरसत्वं च समाधिरभिधीयते ॥६॥
transliteration: yadā saṃkṣīyate prāṇo mānasaṃ ca pralīyate | tadā samarasatvaṃ ca samādhir abhidhīyate || 4.6 ||
translation_danish: [4.6] Når prāṇaen svinder og sindet opløses, da opstår enhedsfølelsen, og den kaldes samādhi.
translation_english: [4.6] When the Prāṇa becomes lean (vigourless) and the mind becomes absorbed, then their becoming equal is called Samādhi.

sanskrit: तत्समं च द्वयोरैक्यं जीवात्मपरमात्मनोः । प्रनष्टसर्वसङ्कल्पः समाधिः सोऽभिधीयते ॥७॥
transliteration: tatsamaṃ ca dvayor aikyaṃ jīvātmaparamātmanoḥ | pranaṣṭasarvasaṅkalpaḥ samādhiḥ so'bhidhīyate || 4.7 ||
translation_danish: [4.7] Ligeså kaldes alle intentioners ophør og foreningen af jīva-ātman og parama-ātman for samādhi.
translation_english: [4.7] This equality and oneness of the self and the ultra self, when all Saṃkalpas cease to exist, is called Samādhi.

sanskrit: राजयोगस्य माहात्म्यं को वा जानाति तत्त्वतः । ज्ञानं मुक्तिः स्थितिः सिद्धिर्गुरुवाक्येन लभ्यते ॥८॥
transliteration: rājayogasya māhātmyaṃ ko vā jānāti tattvataḥ | jñānaṃ muktiḥ sthitiḥ siddhir guruvākyena labhyate || 4.8 ||
translation_danish: [4.8] Hvem kender i sandhed rājayogaens  glorværdighed. Ved guruens ord opnås indsigt, udfrielse, et fast ståsted og succes.
translation_english: [4.8] Or, who can know the true greatness of the Raja Yoga. Knowledge, mukti, condition, and Siddhīs can be learnt by instructions from a gurū alone.

sanskrit: दुर्लभो विषयत्यागो दुर्लभं तत्त्वदर्शनम् । दुर्लभा सहजावस्था सद्गुरोः करुणां विना ॥९॥
transliteration: durlabho viṣayatyāgo durlabhaṃ tattvadarśanam | durlabhā sahajāvasthā sadguroḥ karuṇāṃ vinā || 4.9 ||
translation_danish: [4.9] Det er svært at give afkald på sanseaktivitet, det er svært at skue det virkelige og det er svært at opnå ‘den naturlige tilstand’  uden medfølelse fra en sand guru.
translation_english: [4.9] Indifference to worldly enjoyments is very difficult to obtain, and equally difficult is the knowledge of the Realities to obtain. It is very difficult to get the condition of Samādhi, without the favour of a true guru.

sanskrit: विविधैरासनैः कुम्भैर्विचित्रैः करणैरपि । प्रबुद्धायां महाशक्तौ प्राणः शून्ये प्रलीयते ॥१०॥
transliteration: vividhair āsanaiḥ kumbhair vicitraiḥ karaṇair api | prabuddhāyāṃ mahāśaktau prāṇaḥ śūnye pralīyate || 4.10 ||
translation_danish: [4.10] Når den store śakti vækkes med mange āsanaer, adskillige kumbhakaer og karaṇaer, så absorberes prāṇa i tomheden.
translation_english: [4.10] By means of various postures and different Kumbhakas, when the great power (Kuṇḍalī) awakens, then the Prāṇa becomes absorbed in Sūnya (Samādhi).

sanskrit: उत्पन्नशक्तिबोधस्य त्यक्तनिःशेषकर्मणः । योगिनः सहजावस्था स्वयमेव प्रजायते ॥११॥
transliteration: utpannaśaktibodhasya tyaktaniḥśeṣakarmaṇaḥ | yoginaḥ sahajāvasthā svayam eva prajāyate || 4.11 ||
translation_danish: [4.11] Den naturlige tilstand opstår spontant hos en yogi, der har vækket denne opadgående śakti og har givet afkald på alle gerninger.
translation_english: [4.11] The Yogī whose śakti has awakened, and who has renounced all actions, attains to the condition of Samādhi, without any effort.

sanskrit: सुषुम्नावाहिनि प्राणे शून्ये विशति मानसे । तदा सर्वाणि कर्माणि निर्मूलयति योगवित् ॥१२॥
transliteration: suṣumṇāvāhini prāṇe śūnye viśati mānase | tadā sarvāṇi karmāṇi nirmūlayati yogavit || 4.12 ||
translation_danish: [4.12] Når prāṇa strømmer i Suṣumnā og sindet flyder ind i tomheden, så tilintetgør den yogakyndige al karma.
translation_english: [4.12] When the Prāṇa flows in the Suṣumnā, and the mind has entered śūnya, then the Yogī is free from the effects of Karmas.

sanskrit: अमराय नमस्तुभ्यं सोऽपि कालस्त्वया जितः । पतितं वदने यस्य जगदेतच्चराचरम् ॥१३॥
transliteration: amarāya namas tubhyaṃ so'pi kālas tvayā jitaḥ | patitaṃ vadane yasya jagad etac carācaram || 4.13 ||
translation_danish: [4.13] Hyldest til dig, O Udødelige. Selv tiden overvindes af dig, i hvis mund denne verden med bevægeligt og ubevægeligt befinder sig.
translation_english: [4.13] O Immortal one (that is, the yogi who has attained to the condition of Samādhi), I salute thee! Even death itself, into whose mouth the whole of this movable and immovable world has fallen, has been conquered by thee.

sanskrit: चित्ते समत्वमापन्ने वायौ व्रजति मध्यमे । तदामरोली वज्रोली सहजोली प्रजायते ॥१४॥
transliteration: citte samatvam āpanne vāyau vrajati madhyame | tadāmarolī vajrolī sahajolī prajāyate || 4.14 ||
translation_danish: [4.14] Når sindet opnår ligevægt og luften bevæger sig i midten, så opstår amarolī, vajrolī og sahajolī.
translation_english: [4.14] Amarolī, Vajrolī and Sahajolī are accomplished when the mind becomes calm and Prāṇa has entered the middle channel.

sanskrit: ज्ञानं कुतो मनसि सम्भवतीह तावत् प्रणोऽपि जीवति मनो म्रियते न यावत् । प्राणो मनो द्वयमिदं विलयं नयेद्यो मोक्षं स गच्छति नरो न कथञ्चिदन्यः ॥१५॥
transliteration: jñānaṃ kuto manasi sambhavatīha tāvat prāṇo'pi jīvati mano mriyate na yāvat | prāṇo mano dvayam idaṃ vilayaṃ nayed yo mokṣaṃ sa gacchati naro na kathañcid anyaḥ || 4.15 ||
translation_danish: [4.15] Hvordan kan indsigt opstå i sindet her, så længe åndedraget lever og sindet ikke er dødt? Den mand, der leder både åndedrag og sind til opløsning, han udfries - ingen anden.
translation_english: [4.15] How can it he possible to get knowledge, so long as the Prāṇa is living and the mind has not died? No one else can get mokṣa, except one who can make one's Prāṇa and mind latent.

sanskrit: ज्ञात्वा सुषुम्नासम्भेदं कृत्वा वायुं च मध्यगम् । स्थित्वा सदैव सुस्थाने ब्रह्मरन्ध्रे निरोधयेत् ॥१६॥
transliteration: jñātvā suṣumṇāsambhedaṃ kr̥tvā vāyuṃ ca madhyagam | sthitvā sadaiva susthāne brahmarandhre nirodhayet || 4.16 ||
translation_danish: [4.16] Yogien bør erkende åbningen af Suṣumnā og få luften til at bevæge sig i midten. Han bør altid opholde sig det smukke sted og lukke Brahmās sprække.
translation_english: [4.16] Always living in a good locality and having known the secret of the Suṣumnā, which has a middle course, and making the Vāyu move in it., (the Yogī) should restrain the Vāyu in the Brahma randhra.

sanskrit: सूर्याचन्द्रमसौ धत्तः कालं रात्रिन्दिवात्मकम् । भोक्त्री सुषुम्ना कालस्य गुह्यमेतदुदाहृतम् ॥१७॥
transliteration: sūryacandramasau dhattaḥ kālaṃ rātrindivātmakam | bhoktrī suṣumnā kālasya guhyam etad udāhr̥tam || 4.17 ||
translation_danish: [4.17] Sol og måne sætter tiden i form af nat og dag. Suṣumnā fortærer tiden. Dette siges at være et mysterium.
translation_english: [4.17] Time, in the form of night and day, is made by the sun and the moon. That, the Suṣumnā devours this time (death) even, is a great secret.

sanskrit: द्वासप्ततिसहस्राणि नाडीद्वाराणि पञ्जरे । सुषुम्ना शाम्भवी शक्तिः शेषास्त्वेव निरर्थकाः ॥१८॥
transliteration: dvāsaptatisahasrāṇi nāḍīdvārāṇi pañjare | suṣumnā śāmbhavī śaktiḥ śeṣās tv eva nirarthakāḥ || 4.18 ||
translation_danish: [4.18] Der er tooghalvfjerdstusinde åbninger til kanaler i kroppen. Suṣumnā-kanalen er Śivas kraft, mens de øvrige kanaler er uden nytte.
translation_english: [4.18] In this body there are 72,000 openings of Nādis; of these, the Suṣumnā, which has the Śāmhhavī Sakti in it, is the only important one, the rest are useless.

sanskrit: वायुः परिचितो यस्मादग्निना सह कुण्डलीम् । बोधयित्वा सुषुम्नायां प्रविशेदनिरोधतः ॥१९॥
transliteration: vāyuḥ paricito yasmād agninā saha kuṇḍalīm | bodhayitvā suṣumṇāyāṃ praviśed anirodhataḥ || 4.19 ||
translation_danish: [4.19] Idet luften akkumuleres, vækkes Kuṇdalinī sammen med ilden, og luften vil trænge uhindret ind i Suṣumnā.
translation_english: [4.19] The Vāyu should be made to enter the Suṣumnā without restraint by him who has practised the control of breathing and has awakened the Kuṇḍali by the (gastric) fire. `19

sanskrit: सुषुम्नावाहिनि प्राणे सिद्ध्यत्येव मनोन्मनी । अन्यथा त्वितराभ्यासाः प्रयासायैव योगिनाम् ॥२०॥
transliteration: suṣumṇāvāhini prāṇe siddhyaty eva manonmanī | anyathā tv itarābhyāsāḥ prayāsāyaiva yoginām || 4.20 ||
translation_danish: [4.20] Når prāṇaen strømmer i Suṣumnā resulterer det med sikkerhed i Manonmanī-tilstanden. I modsat fald vil al praksis med sikkerhed føre til yogiernes svækkelse.
translation_english: [4.20] The Prāṇa, flowing through the Suṣumnā, brings about the condition of manonmaṇī; other practices are simply futile for the Yogī.

sanskrit: पवनो बध्यते येन मनस्तेनैव बध्यते । मनश्च बध्यते येन पवनस्तेन बध्यते ॥२१॥
transliteration: pavano badhyate yena manas tenaiva badhyate | manaś ca badhyate yena pavanas tena badhyate || 4.21 ||
translation_danish: [4.21] Fastholdes åndedrættet, fastholdes sindet. Fastholdes sindet, fastholdes åndedrættet.
translation_english: [4.21] By whom the breathing has been controlled, by him the activities of the mind also have been controlled; and, conversely, by whom the activities of the mind have been controlled, by him the breathing also has been controlled.

sanskrit: हेतुद्वयं तु चित्तस्य वासना च समीरणः । तयोर्विनष्ट एकस्मिंस्तौ द्वावपि विनश्यतः ॥२२॥
transliteration: hetudvayaṃ tu cittasya vāsanā ca samīraṇaḥ | tayor vinaṣṭa ekasmiṃs tau dvāv api vinaśyataḥ || 4.22 ||
translation_danish: [4.22] Sindets to årsager er mentale indtryk  og åndedrættet. Når den ene af de to forsvinder, forsvinder den anden også.
translation_english: [4.22] There are two causes of the activities of the mind: (1) Vāsanā (desires) and (2) the respiration (the Prāṇa). Of these, the destruction of the one is the destruction of both.

sanskrit: मनो यत्र विलीयेत पवनस्तत्र लीयते । पवनो लीयते यत्र मनस्तत्र विलीयते ॥२३॥
transliteration: mano yatra vilīyeta pavanas tatra līyate | pavano līyate yatra manas tatra vilīyate || 4.23 ||
translation_danish: [4.23] Hvor sindet opløses, der opløses åndedrættet også. Hvor åndedrættet opløses, der opløses sindet også.
translation_english: [4.23] Breathing is lessened when the mind becomes absorbed, and the mind becomes absorbed when the Prāṇa is restrained.

sanskrit: दुग्धाम्बुवत्सम्मिलितावुभौ तौ तुल्यक्रियौ मानसमारुतौ हि । यतो मरुत्तत्र मनःप्रवृत्तिर् यतो मनसतत्र मरुत्प्रवृत्तिः ॥२४॥
transliteration: dugdhāmbuvat sammilitāv ubhau tau tulyakriyau mānasamārutau hi | yato marut tatra manaḥpravr̥ttir yato manas tatra marutpravr̥ttiḥ || 4.24 ||
translation_danish: [4.24] Sindet og åndedrættet opfører sig på samme måde som vand og mælk blandet sammen. Hvor der er åndedræt, der er et aktivt sind. Hvor der er sind, der er et aktivt åndedræt.
translation_english: [4.24] Both the mind and the breath are united together, like milk and water; and both of them are equal in their activities. Mind begins its activities where there is the breath, and the Parana begins its activities where there is the mind.

sanskrit: तत्रैकनाशादपरस्य नाश एकप्रवृत्तेरपरप्रवृत्तिः । अध्वस्तयोश्चेन्द्रियवर्गवृत्तिः प्रध्वस्तयोर्मोक्षपदस्य सिद्धिः ॥२५॥
transliteration: tatraikanāśād aparasya nāśa ekapravr̥tter aparapravr̥ttiḥ | adhvas tayoś cendriyavargavr̥ttiḥ pradhvas tayor mokṣapadasya siddhiḥ || 4.25 ||
translation_danish: [4.25] Hvor den ene udslettes følger den andens udslettelse. Af den enes aktivitet følger den andens aktivitet. Fra deres ikke-destruktion følger aktiviteten af de forskellige sanseorganer. Fra deres destruktion følger opnåelsen af udfrielsestilstanden.
translation_english: [4.25] By the suspension of the one, therefore, comes the suspension of the other, and by the operations of the one are brought about the operations of the other. When they are present, the Indriyas (the senses) remain engaged in their proper functions, and when they become latent then there is moksa.

sanskrit: रसस्य मनसश्चैव चञ्चलत्वं स्वभावतः । रसो बद्धो मनो बद्धं किं न सिद्ध्यति भूतले ॥२६॥
transliteration: rasasya manasaś caiva cañcalatvaṃ svabhāvataḥ | raso baddho mano baddhaṃ kiṃ na siddhyati bhūtale || 4.26 ||
translation_danish: [4.26] Sindet og kroppens nektar er ustabil af natur. Når nektaren er bundet, er sindet bundet, og hvad kan da ikke opnås her på jorden?
translation_english: [4.26] By nature, Mercury and mind are unsteady: there is nothing in the world which cannot be accomplished when these are made steady.

sanskrit: मूर्च्छितो हरते व्याधीन्मृतो जीवयति स्वयम् । बद्धः खेचरतां धत्ते रसो वायुश्च पार्वति ॥२७॥
transliteration: mūrcchito harate vyādhīn mr̥to jīvayati svayam | baddhaḥ khecaratāṃ dhatte raso vāyuś ca pārvati || 4.27 ||
translation_danish: [4.27] Når nektaren er fæstnet, fjerner den sygdomme; død, vækker den selvet til live; bundet, giver den evnen til at flyve; og ligeså med åndedrættet, oh Pārvatī!
translation_english: [4.27] O Pārvati! Mercury and breathing, when made steady, destroy diseases and the dead himself comes to life (by their means). By their (proper) control, moving in the air is attained.

sanskrit: मनःस्थैर्ये स्थिरो वायुस्ततो बिन्दुः स्थिरो भवेत् । बिन्दुस्थैर्यात्सदा सत्त्वं पिण्डस्थैर्यं प्रजायते ॥२८॥
transliteration: manaḥ sthairye sthiro vāyus tato binduḥ sthiro bhavet | bindusthairyāt sadā sattvaṃ piṇḍasthairyaṃ prajāyate || 4.28 ||
translation_danish: [4.28] Når sindet er fast, så er luften fast. Herved bliver bindu  fast. Ved den faste bindu skabes altid en stærk og vital krop.
translation_english: [4.28] The breathing is calmed when the mind becomes steady and calm; and hence the preservation of bindu. The preservation of this latter makes the satwa established in the body.

sanskrit: इन्द्रियाणां मनो नाथो मनोनाथस्तु मारुतः । मारुतस्य लयो नाथः स लयो नादमाश्रितः ॥२९॥
transliteration: indriyāṇāṃ mano nātho manonāthas tu mārutaḥ | mārutasya layo nāthaḥ sa layo nādam āśritaḥ || 4.29 ||
translation_danish: [4.29] Sindet er sansernes herre og åndedrættet er herre over sindet. Laya  er åndedrættets herre og denne laya hviler på lyden, nāda.
translation_english: [4.29] Mind is the master of the senses, and the breath is the master of the mind. The breath in its turn is subordinate to the laya (absorption), and that laya depends on the nāda.

sanskrit: सोऽयमेवास्तु मोक्षाख्यो मास्तु वापि मतान्तरे । मनःप्राणलये कश्चिदानन्दः सम्प्रवर्तते ॥३०॥
transliteration: so'yam evāstu mokṣākhyo māstu vāpi matāntare | manaḥprāṇalaye kaścid ānandaḥ sampravartate || 4.30 ||
translation_danish: [4.30] Den skal benævnes mokṣa; men ifølge andre skoler skal den ikke. I opløsningen af sindet og prāṇa opstår en ubeskrivelig fryd.
translation_english: [4.30] This very laya is what is called mokṣa, or, being a sectarian, you may not call it mokṣa; but when the mind becomes absorbed, a sort of ecstacy is experienced.

sanskrit: प्रनष्टश्वासनिःश्वासः प्रध्वस्तविषयग्रहः । निश्चेष्टो निर्विकारश्च लयो जयति योगिनाम् ॥३१॥
transliteration: pranaṣṭaśvāsaniḥśvāsaḥ pradhvastaviṣayagrahaḥ | niśceṣṭo nirvikāraś ca layo jayati yoginām || 4.31 ||
translation_danish: [4.31] Ophør af indånding og udånding og ophør af tilknytning til sansernes objekter - det vinder den ubevægelige og uforanderlige laya for yogīerne.
translation_english: [4.31] By the suspension of respiration and the annihilation of the enjoyments of the senses, when the mind becomes devoid of all the activities and remains changeless, then the Yogī attains to the Laya Stage.

sanskrit: उच्छिन्नसर्वसङ्कल्पो निःशेषाशेषचेष्टितः । स्वावगम्यो लयः कोऽपि जायते वागगोचरः ॥३२॥
transliteration: ucchinnasarvasaṅkalpo niḥśeṣāśeṣaceṣṭitaḥ | svāvagamyo layaḥ ko 'pi jāyate vāgagocaraḥ || 4.32 ||
translation_danish: [4.32] En særlig laya opstår, som er afskåret fra al intention, fuldstændig ubevægelig og hinsides ord, men forståelig for én selv.
translation_english: [4.32] When all the thoughts and activities are destroyed, then the Laya Stage is produced, to describe which is beyond the power of speech, being known by self-experience alone.

sanskrit: यत्र दृष्टिर्लयस्तत्र भूतेन्द्रियसनातनी । सा शक्तिर्जीवभूतानां द्वे अलक्ष्ये लयं गते ॥३३॥
transliteration: yatra dr̥ṣṭir layas tatra bhūtendriyasanātanī | sā śaktir jīvabhūtānāṃ dve alakṣye layaṃ gate || 4.33 ||
translation_danish: [4.33] Hvor der er indsigt, er der laya. Den evige sansning af elementerne og de levende væseners śakti - disse usynlige to - går til en tilstand af laya.
translation_english: [4.33] They often speak of Laya, Laya; but what is meant by it?

sanskrit: लयो लय इति प्राहुः कीदृशं लयलक्षणम् । अपुनर्वासनोत्थानाल्लयो विषयविस्मृतिः ॥३४॥
transliteration: layo laya iti prāhuḥ kīdr̥śaṃ layalakṣaṇam | apunarvāsanotthānāl layo viṣayavismr̥tiḥ || 4.34 ||
translation_danish: [4.34] “Laya”, “laya”, således siger de. Men hvad er layas kendetegn? Laya er glemsel af sansernes objekter, når mentale indtryk ikke længere opstår.
translation_english: [4.34] Laya is simply then forgetting of the objects of senses when the Vāsanās (desires) do not rise into existence again.

sanskrit: वेदशास्त्रपुराणानि सामान्यगणिका इव । एकैव शाम्भवी मुद्रा गुप्ता कुलवधूरिव ॥३५॥
transliteration: vedaśāstrapurāṇāni sāmānyagaṇikā iva | ekaiva śāmbhavī mudrā guptā kulavadhūr iva || 4.35 ||
translation_danish: [4.35] Vedaerne, śāstraerne og purāṇaerne er som en skøge, der står til rådighed for enhver. Kun Śāmbhavīmudrā  er skjult som en ærbar kvinde. Dette er Śāmbhavīmudrā:
translation_english: [4.35] The Vedas and the Śāstras are like ordinary public women. Śāmhhavī Mudrā is the one, which is secluded like a respectable lady.

sanskrit: अथ शाम्भवी अन्तर्लक्ष्यं बहिर्दृष्टिर्निमेषोन्मेषवर्जिता । एषा सा शाम्भवी मुद्रा वेदशास्त्रेषु गोपिता ॥३६॥
transliteration: atha śāmbhavī antar lakṣyaṃ bahir dr̥ṣṭir nimeṣonmeṣavarjitā | eṣā sā śāmbhavī mudrā vedaśāstreṣu gopitā || 4.36 ||
translation_danish: [4.36] Indadtil findes det observerbare. Udadtil er kun det tomme, stirrende blik. Dette er Śāmbhavīmudrā, som er skjult i vedaerne og śāstraerne.
translation_english: [4.36] Aiming at Brahman inwardly, while keeping the sight directed to the external objects, without blinking the eyes, is called the Sāmbhavī Mudrā, hidden in the Vedas and the Sāstras.

sanskrit: अन्तर्लक्ष्यविलीनचित्तपवनो योगी यदा वर्तते दृष्ट्या निश्चलतारया बहिरधः पश्यन्नपश्यन्नपि । मुद्रेयं खलु शाम्भवी भवति सा लब्धा प्रसादाद्गुरोः शून्याशून्यविलक्षणं स्फुरति तत्तत्त्वं परं शाम्भवम् ॥३७॥
transliteration: antar lakṣyavilīnacittapavano yogī yadā vartate dr̥ṣṭyā niścalatārayā bahir adhaḥ paśyann apaśyann api | mudreyaṃ khalu śāmbhavī bhavati sā labdhā prasādād guroḥ śūnyāśūnyavilakṣaṇaṃ sphurati tat tattvaṃ paraṃ śāmbhavam || 4.37 ||
translation_danish: [4.37] Når en yogī, med åndedrættet og sindet absorberet i det indre observerbare, forbliver seende - men alligevel ikke seende - med pupillerne fikseret fremad og nedad, så er det i sandhed Śāmbhavīmudrā. Den opnås ved guruens gunst. Den ubestemmelige virkelighed, som hverken er tom eller ikke-tom og forbindes med guden Śambhu, manifesterer sig.
translation_english: [4.37] When the Yogī remains inwardly attentive to the Brahman, keeping the mind and the Prāṇa absorbed, and the sight steady, as if seeing everything while in reality seeing nothing outside, below, or above, verily then it is called the Sāmbhavī Mudrā, which is learnt by the favour of a guru. Whatever, wonderful, Sūnya or Asūnya is perceived, is to be regarded as the manifestation of that great Śambhū (Śiva.)

sanskrit: श्री शाम्भव्याश्च खेचर्या अवस्थाधामभेदतः । भवेच्चित्तलयानन्दः शून्ये चित्सुखरूपिणि ॥३८॥
transliteration: śrīśāmbhavyāś ca khecaryā avasthādhāmabhedataḥ | bhavec cittalayānandaḥ śūnye citsukharūpiṇi || 4.38 ||
translation_danish: [4.38] Fryden ved sindets opløsning i tomheden, der forårsages af Śāmbhavīmudrā og Khecarīmudrā, viser sig som bevidsthed og lykke. Den opstår i kraft af adskillelsen mellem position og sted.
translation_english: [4.38] The two states, the Sāmbhavī and the Khecharī, are different because of their seats (being the heart and the space between the eyebrows respectively); but both cause happiness, for the mind becomes absorbed in the Chita-sukha-Rupa-ātmana which is void.

sanskrit: तारे ज्योतिषि संयोज्य किञ्चिदुन्नमयेद्भ्रुवौ । पूर्वयोगं मनो युञ्जन्नुन्मनीकारकः क्षणात् ॥३९॥
transliteration: tāre jyotiṣi saṃyojya kiñcid unnamayed bhruvau | pūrvayogaṃ mano yuñjann unmanīkārakaḥ kṣaṇāt || 4.39 ||
translation_danish: [4.39] Når pupillerne er fikseret på lyset,  bør yogien hæve øjenbrynene en anelse. Sindet engageres i den forudgående yogaøvelse og frembringer øjeblikkeligt Unmanī-tilstanden.
translation_english: [4.39] Fix the gaze on the light (seen on the tip of the nose) and raise the eyebrows a little, with the mind contemplating as before (in the Śambhavī Mudrā, that is, inwardly thinking of Brahma, but apparently looking outside.) This will create the Unmanī avasthā at once.

sanskrit: केचिदागमजालेन केचिन्निगमसञ्कुलैः । केचित्तर्केण मुह्यन्ति नैव जानन्ति तारकम् ॥४०॥
transliteration: kecid āgamajālena kecin nigamasaṅkulaiḥ | kecit tarkeṇa muhyanti naiva jānanti tārakam || 4.40 ||
translation_danish: [4.40] Nogle forvilder sig ind i āgama-teksternes snarer, andre i nigama-hjælpeteksternes selvmodsigelser eller i filosofisk argumentation. De kender ikke redningsfartøjet.
translation_english: [4.40] Some are devoted to the Vedas, some to Nigama, while others are enwrapt in Logic, but none knows the value of this mudrā, which enables one to cross the ocean of existence

sanskrit: अर्धोन्मीलितलोचनः स्थिरमना नासाग्रदत्तेक्षणश् चन्द्रार्कावपि लीनतामुपनयन्निस्पन्दभावेन यः । ज्योतीरूपमशेषबीजमखिलं देदीप्यमानं परम् तत्त्वं तत्पदमेति वस्तु परमं वाच्यं किमत्राधिकम् ॥४१॥
transliteration: ardhonmīlitalocanaḥ sthiramanā nāsāgradattekṣaṇaś candrārkāv api līnatām upanayan nispandabhāvena yaḥ | jyotīrūpam aśeṣabījam akhilaṃ dedīpyamānaṃ paraṃ tattvaṃ tatpadam eti vastu paramaṃ vācyaṃ kim atrādhikam || 4.41 ||
translation_danish: [4.41] Med et roligt sind, øjnene halvt lukkede og blikket rettet mod næsetippen, kontrollerer yogien sågar solen og månen med sin urokkelighed og opnår en tilstand af lys. Lyset er kilden til alting, intenst strålende, den yderste virkelighed. Hvad mere kan der siges i denne sag?
translation_english: [4.41] With steady calm mind and half closed eyes, fixed on the tip of the nose, stopping the Idā and the Pingalā without blinking, he who [4.41] can see the light which is the all, the seed, the entire brilliant, great Tatwama, approaches Him, who is the great object. What is the use of more talk?

sanskrit: दिवा न पूजयेल्लिङ्गं रात्रौ चैव न पूजयेत् । सर्वदा पूजयेल्लिङ्गं दिवारात्रिनिरोधतः ॥४२॥
transliteration: divā na pūjayel liṅgaṃ rātrau caiva na pūjayet | sarvadā pūjayel liṅgaṃ divārātrinirodhataḥ || 4.42 ||
translation_danish: [4.42] Yogien bør ikke tilbede liṅgaen  om dagen, ej heller om natten. Han bør til alle tider tilbede liṅgaen og betvinge dag og nat. Dette er Khecarīmudrā:
translation_english: [4.42] One should not meditate on the Linga (i.e., ātman) in the day (i.e., while Sūrya or Pingalā is working) or at night (when Idā is working), but should always contemplate after restraining both.

sanskrit: सव्यदक्षिणनाडिस्थो मध्ये चरति मारुतः । तिष्ठते खेचरी मुद्रा तस्मिन्स्थाने न संशयः ॥४३॥
transliteration: atha khecarī savyadakṣiṇanāḍīstho madhye carati mārutaḥ | tiṣṭhate khecarī mudrā tasmin sthāne na saṃśayaḥ || 4.43 ||
translation_danish: [4.43] Åndedrættet befinder sig i højre og venstre kanal og bevæger sig til den midterste kanal. På det sted befinder Khecarīmudrā sig uden tvivl.
translation_english: [4.43] When the air has ceased to move in the right and the left nostrils, and has begun to flow in the middle path, then the Khecharī Mudrā, can be accomplished there. There is no doubt of this.

sanskrit: इडापिङ्गलयोर्मध्ये शून्यं चैवानिलं ग्रसेत् । तिष्ठते खेचरी मुद्रा तत्र सत्यं पुनः पुनः ॥४४॥
transliteration: iḍāpiṅgalayor madhye śūnyaṃ caivānilaṃ graset | tiṣṭhate khecarī mudrā tatra satyaṃ punaḥ punaḥ || 4.44 ||
translation_danish: [4.44] Tomheden imellem Iḍā og Piṅgalā vil sluge luften. Der befinder Khecarīmudrā sig. Dette er evigt sandt.
translation_english: [4.44] If the Prāṇa can he drawn into the Sūnya (Suṣumnā), which is between the Idā and the Pingalā, and male motionless there, then the Khecharī Mudrā can truly become steady there.

sanskrit: सूर्याचन्द्रमसोर्मध्ये निरालम्बान्तरे पुनः । संस्थिता व्योमचक्रे या सा मुद्रा नाम खेचरी ॥४५॥
transliteration: sūryācandramasor madhye nirālambāntare punaḥ | saṃsthitā vyomacakre yā sā mudrā nāma khecarī || 4.45 ||
translation_danish: [4.45] Med andre ord: Mellem solen og månen, i det selvberoende Vyomacakra,  dér befinder mudrāen Khecarī sig.
translation_english: [4.45] That Mudrā is called Khecharī which is performed in the supportless space between the Sūrya and the Chandra (the Idā and the Pingalā) and called the Vyoma Chakra.

sanskrit: सोमाद्यत्रोदिता धारा साक्षात्सा शिववल्लभा । पूरयेदतुलां दिव्यां सुषुम्नां पश्चिमे मुखे ॥४६॥
transliteration: somād yatroditā dhārā sākṣāt sā śivavallabhā | pūrayed atulāṃ divyāṃ suṣumṇāṃ paścime mukhe || 4.46 ||
translation_danish: [4.46] Nektaren er Śivas synlige elskede og bør fylde den guddommelige uforlignelige Suṣumnā bagerst i munden, hvor den strømmer fra månen.
translation_english: [4.46] The Khecharī which causes the stream to flow from the Chandra (Śoma) is beloved of Śiva. The incomparable divine Suṣumnā should be closed by the tongue drawn back.

sanskrit: पुरस्ताच्चैव पूर्येत निश्चिता खेचरी भवेत् । अभ्यस्ता खेचरी मुद्राप्युन्मनी सम्प्रजायते ॥४७॥
transliteration: purastāc caiva pūryeta niścitā khecarī bhavet | abhyastā khecarī mudrāpy unmanī samprajāyate || 4.47 ||
translation_danish: [4.47] Nektaren bør også fylde Suṣumnā forneden. Dette er den sande Khecarī. Når Khecarīmudrā praktiseres, opstår Unmanī-tilstanden ligeledes.
translation_english: [4.47] It can be closed from the front also (by stopping the movements of the Prāṇa), and then surely it becomes the Khecharī. By practice, this Khecharī leads to Unmanī.

sanskrit: भ्रुवोर्मध्ये शिवस्थानं मनस्तत्र विलीयते । ज्ञातव्यं तत्पदं तुर्यं तत्र कालो न विद्यते ॥४८॥
transliteration: bhruvor madhye śivasthānaṃ manas tatra vilīyate | jñātavyaṃ tatpadaṃ turyaṃ tatra kālo na vidyate || 4.48 ||
translation_danish: [4.48] Śivas opholdssted er mellem øjenbrynene. Dér opløses sindet. Stedet bør kendes som Turya.  Dér eksisterer tiden ikke.
translation_english: [4.48] The seat of Śiva is between the eyebrows, and the mind becomes absorbed there. This condition (in which the mind is thus absorbed) is known as Tūrya, and death has no access there.

sanskrit: अभ्यसेत्खेचरीं तावद्यावत्स्याद्योगनिद्रितः । सम्प्राप्तयोगनिद्रस्य कालो नास्ति कदाचन ॥४९॥
transliteration: abhyaset khecarīṃ tāvad yāvat syād yoganidritaḥ | samprāptayoganidrasya kālo nāsti kadācana || 4.49 ||
translation_danish: [4.49] Så længe Khecarī praktiseres bør den yogiske søvn finde sted. Tiden eksisterer ikke for den, der befinder sig i den yogiske søvn.
translation_english: [4.49] The Khecharī should be practised till there is Yoga-nidrā (Samādhi). One who has induced Yoga-nidrā, cannot fall a victim to death.

sanskrit: निरालम्बं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् । स बाह्याभ्यन्तरे व्योम्नि घटवत्तिष्ठति ध्रुवम् ॥५०॥
transliteration: nirālambaṃ manaḥ kr̥tvā na kiñcid api cintayet | sa bāhyābhyantare vyomni ghaṭavat tiṣṭhati dhruvam || 4.50 ||
translation_danish: [4.50] Yogien bør gøre sindet selvberoende og ikke tænke på noget som helst; han forbliver ubevægelig som en krukke, med tomrum indeni og udenfor.
translation_english: [4.50] Freeing the mind from all thoughts and thinking of nothing, one should sit firmly like a pot in the space (surrounded and filled with the ether).

sanskrit: बाह्यवायुर्यथा लीनस्तथा  मध्यो न संशयः । स्वस्थाने स्थिरतामेति पवनो मनसा सह ॥५१॥
transliteration: bāhyavāyur yathā līnas tathā madhyo na saṃśayaḥ | svasthāne sthiratām eti pavano manasā saha || 4.51 ||
translation_danish: [4.51] Ligesom det ydre åndedræt er stilnet, ligeså er det indre. Herom er der ingen tvivl. Åndedrættet opnår ro sammen med sindet i sit eget opholdssted.
translation_english: [4.51] As the air, in and out of the body, remains unmoved, so the breath with mind becomes steady in its place (i.e., in Brahma randhra).

sanskrit: एवमभ्यसमानस्य वायुमार्गे दिवानिशम् । अभ्यासाज्जीर्यते वायुर्मनस्तत्रैव लीयते ॥५२॥
transliteration: evam abhyasamānasya  vāyumārge divāniśam | abhyāsāj jīryate vāyur manas tatraiva līyate || 4.52 ||
translation_danish: [4.52] På denne måde opløses åndedrættet i den praktiserendes luftvej ved praksis dag og nat; på samme måde opløses sindet.
translation_english: [4.52] By thus practising, night and day, the breathing is brought under control, and, as the practice increases, the mind becomes calm and steady.

sanskrit: अमृतैः प्लावयेद्देहमापादतलमस्तकम् । सिद्ध्यत्येव महाकायो महाबलपराक्रमः ॥५३॥
transliteration: amr̥taiḥ plāvayed deham āpādatalamastakam | siddhyaty eva mahākāyo mahābalaparākramaḥ || 4.53 ||
translation_danish: [4.53] Yogien bør oversvømme kroppen fra top til tå med amr̥ta.  Herved opnås en stor, stærk og heroisk krop.
translation_english: [4.53] By rubbing the body over with Amrita (exuding from the moon), from head to foot, one gets Mahākāyā, i.e., great strength and energy.

sanskrit: शक्तिमध्ये मनः कृत्वा शक्तिं मानसमध्यगाम् । मनसा मन आलोक्य धारयेत्परमं पदम् ॥५४॥
transliteration: śaktimadhye manaḥ kr̥tvā śaktiṃ mānasamadhyagām | manasā mana ālokya dhārayet paramaṃ padam || 4.54 ||
translation_danish: [4.54] Gør sindet til fokus for śakti og śakti bliver fokus for sindet. Iagttag sindet med sindet og meditér på det højeste stadie.
translation_english: [4.54] Placing the mind into the Kuṇḍalini, and getting the latter into the mind, by looking upon the Buddhi (intellect) with mind (reflexively), the Param Pada (Brahma) should be obtained.

sanskrit: खमध्ये कुरु चात्मानमात्ममध्ये च खं कुरु । सर्वं च खमयं कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ॥५५॥
transliteration: khamadhye kuru cātmānam ātmamadhye ca khaṃ kuru | sarvaṃ ca khamayaṃ kr̥tvā na kiñcid api cintayet || 4.55 ||
translation_danish: [4.55] Gør selvet til tomrummets fokus og tomrummet til selvets fokus. Når alt er omdannet til tomrum, bør man ikke tænke på noget som helst.
translation_english: [4.55] Keep the ātmā inside the Kha (Brahma) and place Brahma inside your ātmā. Having made everything pervaded with Kha (Brahma), think of nothing else.

sanskrit: अन्तः शून्यो बहिः शून्यः शून्यः कुम्भ इवाम्बरे । अन्तः पूर्णो बहिः पूर्णः पूर्णः कुम्भ इवार्णवे ॥५६॥
transliteration: antaḥ śūnyo bahiḥ śūnyaḥ śūnyaḥ kumbha ivāmbare | antaḥ pūrṇo bahiḥ pūrṇaḥ pūrṇaḥ kumbha ivārṇave || 4.56 ||
translation_danish: [4.56] Tom indeni, tom udenfor, ligesom en tom krukke i luften. Fuld indeni, fuld udenfor, ligesom en fuld krukke i havet.
translation_english: [4.56] One should become void in and void out, and voice like a pot in the space. Full in and full outside, like a jar in the ocean.

sanskrit: बाह्यचिन्ता न कर्तव्या तथैवान्तरचिन्तनम् । सर्वचिन्तां परित्यज्य न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत् ॥५७॥
transliteration: bāhyacintā na kartavyā tathaivāntaracintanam | sarvacintāṃ parityajya na kiñcid api cintayet || 4.57 ||
translation_danish: [4.57] Tænk ikke på det ydre, ej heller på det indre. Man bør forsage alle tanker og ikke tænke på noget som helst.
translation_english: [4.57] He should be neither of his inside nor of outside world; and, leaving all thoughts, he should think of nothing.

sanskrit: सञ्कल्पमात्रकलनैव जगत्समग्रम् सञ्कल्पमात्रकलनैव मनोविलासः । सञ्कल्पमात्रमतिमुत्सृज निर्विकल्पम् आश्रित्य निश्चयवाप्नुहि राम शान्तिम् ॥५८॥
transliteration: saṅkalpamātrakalanaiva jagat samagram saṅkalpamātrakalanaiva manovilāsaḥ | saṅkalpamātramatim utsr̥ja nirvikalpam āśritya niścayam avāpnuhi rāma śāntim || 4.58 ||
translation_danish: [4.58] Hele verden er frembragt alene af tanker og intentioner.  Sindets leg er frembragt alene af tanker og intentioner. Afstå uden tøven fra sindets tanker og intentioner, tag tilflugt til det uforanderlige og opnå indre ro, oh Rāma!
translation_english: [4.58] The whole of this world and all the schemes of the mind are but the creations of thought. Discarding these thoughts and taking leave of all conjectures, O Rāma! obtain peace.

sanskrit: कर्पूरमनले यद्वत्सैन्धवं सलिले यथा । तथा सन्धीयमानं च मनस्तत्त्वे विलीयते ॥५९॥
transliteration: karpūram anale yadvat saindhavaṃ salile yathā | tathā sandhīyamānaṃ ca manas tattve vilīyate || 4.59 ||
translation_danish: [4.59] Som kamfer i ild og salt i vand vil sindet opløses i mødet med det virkelige.
translation_english: [4.59] As camphor disappears in fire, and rock salt in water, so the mind united with the ātmā loses its identity.

sanskrit: ज्ञेयं सर्वं प्रतीतं च ज्ञानं च मन उच्यते । ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं समं नष्टं नान्यः पन्था द्वितीयकः ॥६०॥
transliteration: jñeyaṃ sarvaṃ pratītaṃ ca jñānaṃ ca mana ucyate | jñānaṃ jñeyaṃ samaṃ naṣṭaṃ nānyaḥ panthā dvitīyakaḥ || 4.60 ||
translation_danish: [4.60] Både det erkendelsesværdige, det erkendte og erkendelsen selv siges at være sindet. Når erkendelse og det erkendelsesværdige går til grunde, så er der ingen anden vej.
translation_english: [4.60] When the knowable, and the knowledge, are both destroyed equally, then there is no second way (i.e., Duality is destroyed).

sanskrit: मनोदृश्यमिदं सर्वं यत्किञ्चित्सचराचरम् । मनसो ह्युन्मनीभावाद्द्वैतं नैवोपलभ्यते ॥६१॥
transliteration: manodr̥śyam idaṃ sarvaṃ yat kiñcit sacarācaram | manaso hy unmanībhāvād dvaitaṃ naivolabhyate || 4.61 ||
translation_danish: [4.61] Alt i denne verden, hvad enten det er bevægeligt eller ubevægeligt, er sindets projektion. I sindets Unmanī-tilstand erfares dualiteten slet ikke.
translation_english: [4.61] All this movable and immovable world is mind. When the mind has attained to the unmanī avasthā, there is no dwaita (from the absence of the working of the mind.)

sanskrit: ज्ञेयवस्तुपरित्यागाद्विलयं याति मानसम् । मनसो विलये जाते कैवल्यमवशिष्यते ॥६२॥
transliteration: jñeyavastuparityāgād vilayaṃ yāti mānasam | manaso vilaye jāte kaivalyam avaśiṣyate || 4.62 ||
translation_danish: [4.62] Ved at opgive erkendelsesværdige objekter, går sindet i opløsning. Når sindet er opløst, forbliver kun Kaivalya-tilstanden tilbage.
translation_english: [4.62] Mind disappears by removing the knowable, and, on its disappearance, ātmā only remains behind.

sanskrit: एवं नानाविधोपायाः सम्यक्स्वानुभवान्विताः । समाधिमार्गाः कथिताः पूर्वाचार्यैर्महात्मभिः ॥६३॥
transliteration: evaṃ nānāvidhopāyāḥ samyak svānubhavānvitāḥ | samādhimārgāḥ kathitāḥ pūrvācāryair mahātmabhiḥ || 4.63 ||
translation_danish: [4.63] Således er de mange metoder og veje til samādhi udledt af egne personlige erfaringer og forkyndt af tidligere tiders store åndelige lærere.
translation_english: [4.63] The high-souled āchāryas (Teachers) of yore gained experience in the various methods of Samādhi themselves, and then they preached them to others.

sanskrit: सुषुम्नायै कुण्डलिन्यै सुधायै चन्द्रजन्मने । मनोन्मन्यै नमस्तुभ्यं महाशक्त्यै चिदात्मने ॥६४॥
transliteration: suṣumṇāyai kuṇḍalinyai sudhāyai candrajanmane | manonmanyai namas tubhyaṃ mahāśaktyai cidātmane || 4.64 ||
translation_danish: [4.64] Hyldest til dig, Suṣumṇā, Kuṇḍalinī, Den månefødte nektar, Manonmanī, Den store Śakti, hvis natur er bevidsthed. Dette er Nādānusandhāna:
translation_english: [4.64] Salutations to Thee, O Suṣumnā, to Thee O Kuṇḍalinī, to Thee O Sudhā, born of Chandra, to Thee O Manomnanī! to Thee O great power, energy and the intelligent spirit.

sanskrit: अथ नादानुसन्धानम् अशक्यतत्त्वबोधानां मूढानामपि सम्मतम् । प्रोक्तं गोरक्षनाथेन नादोपासनमुच्यते ॥६५॥
transliteration: atha nādānusandhānam aśakyatattvabodhānāṃ mūḍhānām api sammatam | proktaṃ gorakṣanāthena nādopāsanam ucyate || 4.65 ||
translation_danish: [4.65] Nādayoga, som den blev forklaret af Gorakṣanātha, siges at være forståelig selv for de uvidende, som ikke har indsigt i sandheden.
translation_english: [4.65] I will describe now the practice of anāhata nāda, as propounded by Gorakṣa Nātha, for the benefit of those who are unable to understand the principles of knowledge—a method, which is liked by the ignorant also.

sanskrit: श्री आदिनाथेन सपादकोटिलयप्रकाराः कथिता जयन्ति । नादानुसन्धानकमेकमेव मन्यामहे मुख्यतमं लयानाम् ॥६६॥
transliteration: śrī ādināthena sapādakoṭi layaprakārāḥ kathitā jayanti | nādānusandhānakam ekam eva manyāmahe mukhyatamaṃ layānām || 4.66 ||
translation_danish: [4.66] Oh Sejrrige!  Der er toogenhalv million former for layayoga, som er blevet fortalt af den Glorværdige Oprindelige Herre Śiva. Vi anser én, nemlig nādānusandhāna,  som den højeste form for layayoga.
translation_english: [4.66] ādinātha propounded 1¼ crore methods of trance, and they are all extant. Of these, the hearing of the anāhata nāda is the Only one, the chief, in my opinion.

sanskrit: मुक्तासने स्थितो योगी मुद्रां सन्धाय शाम्भवीम् । शृणुयाद्दक्षिणे कर्णे नादमन्तस्थमेकधीः ॥६७॥
transliteration: muktāsane sthito yogī mudrāṃ sandhāya śāmbhavīm | śr̥ṇuyād dakṣiṇe karṇe nādam antastham ekadhīḥ || 4.67 ||
translation_danish: [4.67] En yogī siddende i Muktāsana, som har dannet Śāmbhavīmudrāen, bør lytte med fuld opmærksomhed til den indre lyd (nāda) i det højre øre.
translation_english: [4.67] Sitting with Mukta āsana and with the Sāmbhavī Madill, the Yogī should hear the sound inside his right ear, with collected mind.

sanskrit: श्रवणपुटनयनयुगलघ्राणमुखानां निरोधनं कार्यम् । शुद्धसुषुम्नासरणौ स्फुटममलः श्रूयते नादः ॥६८॥
transliteration: śravaṇapuṭanayanayugalaghrāṇamukhānāṃ nirodhanaṃ kāryam | śuddhasuṣumṇāsaraṇau sphuṭam amalaḥ śrūyate nādaḥ || 4.68 ||
translation_danish: [4.68] Ved at dække indgangen til begge ører, begge øjne, næse og mund, høres en ren lyd (nāda) tydeligt i den rene Suṣumṇa-kanal.
translation_english: [4.68] The ears, the eyes, the nose, and the mouth should be closed and then the clear sound is heard in the passage of the Suṣumnā which has been cleansed of all its impurities.

sanskrit: आरम्भश्च घटश्चैव तथा परिचयोऽपि च । निष्पत्तिः सर्वयोगेषु स्यादवस्थाचतुष्टयम् ॥६९॥
transliteration: ārambhaś ca ghaṭaś caiva tathā paricayo'pi ca | niṣpattiḥ sarvayogeṣu syād avasthācatuṣṭayam || 4.69 ||
translation_danish: [4.69] Der bør være fire stadier  i alle former for yoga: begyndelse (ārambha), krukke (ghaṭa), opfyldning (paricaya) og fuldendelse (niṣpatti). Dette er Begyndelsesstadiet:
translation_english: [4.69] In all the Yogas, there are four states: (1) ārambha or the preliminary, (2) Ghata, or the state of a jar, (3) Parichaya (known), (4) niṣpatti (consumate.)

sanskrit: अथारम्भावस्था ब्रह्मग्रन्थेर्भवेद्भेदादानन्दः शून्यसम्भवः । विचित्रः क्वणको देहेऽनाहतः श्रूयते ध्वनिः ॥७०॥
transliteration: atha ārambhāvasthā brahmagranther bhaved bhedānandaḥ śūnyasambhavaḥ | vicitraḥ kvaṇako dehe'nāhataḥ śrūyate dhvaniḥ || 4.70 ||
translation_danish: [4.70] Idet Brahmās knude  splittes høres en evig lyd i kroppen, der aldrig er slået an. Denne lyd er en frydefuld, farverig klingren som findes i tomrummet.
translation_english: [4.70] When the Brahma granthi (in the heart) is pierced through by Prāṇāyāma, then a sort of happiness is experienced in the vacuum of the heart, and the anāhat sounds, like various tinkling sounds of ornaments, are heard in the body.

sanskrit: दिव्यदेहश्च तेजस्वी दिव्यगन्धस्त्वरोगवान् । सम्पूर्णहृदयः शून्य आरम्भे योगवान्भवेत् ॥७१॥
transliteration: divyadehaś ca tejasvī divyagandhas tvarogavān | sampūrṇahr̥dayaḥ śūnya ārambhe yogavān bhavet || 4.71 ||
translation_danish: [4.71] I begyndelsesstadiet opnår den, der praktiserer yoga, en guddommelig krop, som er kraftfuld og fri for sygdomme, tom, med en guddommelig duft og et fyldt hjerte. Dette er Krukkestadiet:
translation_english: [4.71] In the ārambha, a Yogī's body becomes divine, glowing, healthy, and emits a divine swell. The whole of his heart becomes void.

sanskrit: अथ घटावस्था द्वितीयायां घटीकृत्य वायुर्भवति मध्यगः । दृढासनो भवेद्योगी ज्ञानी देवसमस्तथा ॥७२॥
transliteration: atha ghaṭāvasthā dvitīyāyāṃ ghaṭīkr̥tya vāyur bhavati madhyagaḥ | dr̥ḍhāsano bhaved yogī jñānī devasamas tathā || 4.72 ||
translation_danish: [4.72] I det andet stadie, efter at have udført en kumbhaka,  ledes åndedrættet ind i midterste kanal. En yogi vil da være fast forankret i āsanaerne, klog og lig guderne.
translation_english: [4.72] In the second stage, the airs are united into one and begin moving in the middle channel. The Yogī's posture becomes firm, and he becomes wise like a god.

sanskrit: विष्णुग्रन्थेस्ततो भेदात्परमानन्दसूचकः । अतिशून्ये विमर्दश्च भेरीशब्दस्तदा भवेत् ॥७३॥
transliteration: viṣṇugranthes tato bhedāt paramānandasūcakaḥ | atiśūnye vimardaś ca bherīśabdas tadā bhavet || 4.73 ||
translation_danish: [4.73] I kraft af splittelsen af Viṣṇus knude opstår en dunkende lyd af en pauke i tomrummet, der er et udtryk for den højeste form for fryd. Dette er Opfyldningsstadiet:
translation_english: [4.73] By this means the Viṣṇu knot (in the throat) is pierced which is indicated by highest pleasure experienced, And then the Bherī sound (like the beating of a kettle drain) is evolved in the vacuum in the throat.

sanskrit: अथ परिचयावस्था तृतीयायां तु विज्ञेयो विहायोमर्दलध्वनिः । महाशून्यं तदा याति सर्वसिद्धिसमाश्रयम् ॥७४॥
transliteration: atha paricayāvasthā tr̥tīyāyāṃ tu vijñeyo vihāyo mardaladhvaniḥ | mahāśūnyaṃ tadā yāti sarvasiddhisamāśrayam || 4.74 ||
translation_danish: [4.74] I det tredje stadie bør en voldsom trommelyd erkendes, hvorefter den trænger igennem til det store tomrum, hvor alle siddhier findes.
translation_english: [4.74] In the third stage, the sound of a drum is known to arise in tie Sūnya between the eyebrows, and then the Vāyu goes to the Mahāśūnya, which is the home of all the siddhīs.

sanskrit: चित्तानन्दं तदा जित्वा सहजानन्दसम्भवः । दोषदुःखजराव्याधिक्षुधानिद्राविवर्जितः ॥७५॥
transliteration: cittānandaṃ tadā jitvā sahajānandasambhavaḥ | doṣaduḥkhajarāvyādhikṣudhānidrāvivarjitaḥ || 4.75 ||
translation_danish: [4.75] Efter at have overvundet sindets fryd bliver yogien fyldt med spontan fryd og derved fri for dårligdom, lidelse, alderdom, sygdom, sult og træthed. Dette er Fuldendelsestadiet:
translation_english: [4.75] Conquering, then, the pleasures of the mind, ecstacy is spontaneously produced which is devoid of evils, pains, old age, disease, hunger and sleep.

sanskrit: अथ निष्पत्त्यवस्था रुद्रग्रन्थिं यदा भित्त्वा शर्वपीठगतोऽनिलः । निष्पत्तौ वैणवः शब्दः क्वणद्वीणाक्वणो भवेत् ॥७६॥
transliteration: atha niṣpattyavasthā rudragranthiṃ yadā bhittvā śarvapīṭhagato'nilaḥ | niṣpattau vaiṇavaḥ śabdaḥ kvaṇadvīṇākvaṇo bhavet || 4.76 ||
translation_danish: [4.76] Efter at have ødelagt Rudras knude, bevæger åndedrættet sig til Śivas stol. I Nispatti vil der være en lyd af en fløjte og en lyd af en vīṇā.
translation_english: [4.76] When the Rudra granthi is pierced and the air enters the seat of the Lord (the space between the eyebrows), then the perfect sound like that of a flute is produced.

sanskrit: एकीभूतं तदा चित्तं राजयोगाभिधानकम् । सृष्टिसंहारकर्तासौ योगीश्वरसमो भवेत् ॥७७॥
transliteration: ekībhūtaṃ tadā cittaṃ rājayogābhidhānakam | sr̥ṣṭisaṃhārakartāsau yogīśvarasamo bhavet || 4.77 ||
translation_danish: [4.77] Det tidspunkt, hvor sindet bliver samlet, kaldes Rājayoga. Den yogi, der skaber verden og ødelægger verden, må være lig Herren Śiva.
translation_english: [4.77] The union of the mind and the sound is called the Rāja-Yoga. The (real) Yogī becomes the creator and destroyer of the universe, like God.

sanskrit: अस्तु वा मास्तु वा मुक्तिरत्रैवाखण्डितं सुखम् । लयोद्भवमिदं स्औख्यं राजयोगादवाप्यते ॥७८॥
transliteration: astu vā māstu vā muktir atraivākhaṇḍitaṃ sukham | layodbhavam idaṃ saukhyaṃ rājayogād avāpyate || 4.78 ||
translation_danish: [4.78] Lad der være eller ikke være udfrielse; præcis her er der uforstyrret lykke. Denne lykke, der opstår af layayoga, er opnået gennem rājayoga.
translation_english: [4.78] Perpetual Happiness is achieved by this; I do not care if the mukti be not attained. This happiness, resulting from absorption [in Brahma], is obtained by means of Raja-Yoga.

sanskrit: राजयोगमजानन्तः केवलं हठकर्मिणः । एतानभ्यासिनो मन्ये प्रयासफलवर्जितान् ॥७९॥
transliteration: rājayogam ajānantaḥ kevalaṃ haṭhakarmiṇaḥ | etān abhyāsino manye prayāsaphalavarjitān || 4.79 ||
translation_danish: [4.79] Jeg anser dem, der alene praktiserer Haṭhayoga uden kendskab til Rājayoga, som praktiserende, hvis anstrengelser er frugtesløse.
translation_english: [4.79] Those who are ignorant of the Rāja-Yoga and practise only the Haṭha-Yoga, will, in my opinion, waste their energy fruitlessly.

sanskrit: उन्मन्यवाप्तये शीघ्रं भ्रूध्यानं मम सम्मतम् । राजयोगपदं प्राप्तुं सुखोपायोऽल्पचेतसाम् । सद्यः प्रत्ययसन्धायी जायते नादजो लयः ॥८०॥
transliteration: unmanyavāptaye śīghraṃ bhrūdhyānaṃ mama sammatam | rājayogapadaṃ prāptuṃ sukhopāyo'lpacetasām | sadyaḥ pratyayasandhāyī jāyate nādajo layaḥ || 4.80 ||
translation_danish: [4.80] Efter min opfattelse vil man hurtigt opnå umani ved meditation mellem øjenbrynene. Den er et godt middel for dem med lille intelligens til nemt at opnå stedet for rājayoga-stadiet. (LENAs standardisering: bindestreg i sammensatte ord). Denne layayoga, som er resultatet af nādayoga, afføder straks en yogi, der er i meditations-tilstanden (umani).
translation_english: [4.80] Contemplation on the space between the eyebrows is, in my opinion, best for accomplishing soon the Unmanī state. For people of small intellect, it is a very easy method for obtaining perfection in the Raja-Yoga. The Laya produced by nāda, at once gives experience (of spiritual powers).

sanskrit: नादानुसन्धानसमाधिभाजां योगीश्वराणां हृदि वर्धमानम् । आनन्दमेकं वचसामगम्यं जानाति तं श्रीगुरुनाथ एकः ॥८१॥
transliteration: nādānusandhānasamādhibhājāṃ yogīśvarāṇāṃ hr̥di vardhamānam | ānandam ekaṃ vacasām agamyaṃ jānāti taṃ śrīgurunātha ekaḥ || 4.81 ||
translation_danish: [4.81] En ubeskrivelig fryd vokser i hjertet hos yogiske mestre, der er ét med samādhi gennem undersøgelse af indre lyd (nādānusandhāna). En glorværdig nāth guru véd dette.
translation_english: [4.81] The happiness which increases in the hearts of Yogiśwaras, who have gained success in Samādhi by means of attention to the nāda, is beyond description, and is known to Śri Gurū Nātha alone.

sanskrit: कर्णौ पिधाय हस्ताभ्यां यः शृणोति ध्वनिं मुनिः । तत्र चित्तं स्थिरीकुर्याद्यावत्स्थिरपदं व्रजेत् ॥८२॥
transliteration: karṇau pidhāya hastābhyāṃ yaḥ śr̥ṇoti dhvaniṃ muniḥ | tatra cittaṃ sthirīkuryād yāvat sthirapadaṃ vrajet || 4.82 ||
translation_danish: [4.82] En muni bør fiksere sindet dér, hvor han hører en lyd, når han dækker begge ører med hænderne, indtil sindet bliver roligt.
translation_english: [4.82] The sound which a muni hears by closing his ears with his fingers, should be heard attentively, till the mind becomes steady in it.

sanskrit: अभ्यस्यमानो नादोऽयं बाह्यमावृणुते ध्वनिम् । पक्षाद्विक्षेपमखिलं जित्वा योगी सुखी भवेत् ॥८३॥
transliteration: abhyasyamāno nādo'yaṃ bāhyam āvr̥ṇute dhvanim | pakṣād vikṣepam akhilaṃ jitvā yogī sukhī bhavet || 4.83 ||
translation_danish: [4.83] At praktisere denne nādayoga skjuler den ydre lyd. Efter at have overvundet al distraktion i to uger bør en yogī blive glad.
translation_english: [4.83] By practising with this nāda, all other external sounds are stopped. The Yogī becomes happy by overcoming all distractions within 15 days.

sanskrit: श्रूयते प्रथमाभ्यासे नादो नानाविधो महान् । ततोऽभ्यासे वर्धमाने श्रूयते सूक्ष्मसूक्ष्मकः ॥८४॥
transliteration: śrūyate prathamābhyāse nādo nānāvidho mahān | tato'bhyāse vardhamāne śrūyate sūkṣmasūkṣmakaḥ || 4.84 ||
translation_danish: [4.84] Mangfoldige høje lyde (nādaer) høres i begyndelsen af praksissen. Som praksissen skrider frem, høres finere og finere nādaer.
translation_english: [4.84] In the beginning, the sounds heard are of great variety and very loud; but, as the practice increases, they become more and more subtle.

sanskrit: आदौ जलधिजीमूतभेरीझर्झरसम्भवाः । मध्ये मर्दलशङ्खोत्था घण्टाकाहलजास्तथा ॥८५॥
transliteration: ādau jaladhijīmūtabherījharjharasaṃbhavāḥ | madhye mardalaśaṅkhotthā ghaṇṭākāhalajās tathā || 4.85 ||
translation_danish: [4.85] I begyndelsen opstår lyden af en flod, af torden, af en pauke og af en jharjhara-tromme. I midten opstår lyden af en mardala-tromme og en konkylieskal samt en lyd forårsaget af en klokke.
translation_english: [4.85] In the first stage, the sounds are surging, thundering like the beating of kettle drums and jingling ones. In the intermediate stage, they are like those produced by conch, Mridanga, bells, &c.

sanskrit: अन्ते तु किङ्किणीवंशवीणाभ्रमरनिःस्वनाः । इति नानाविधा नादाः श्रूयन्ते देहमध्यगाः ॥८६॥
transliteration: ante tu kiṅkiṇīvaṃśavīṇābhramaraniḥsvanāḥ | iti nānāvidhā nādāḥ śrūyante dehamadhyagāḥ || 4.86 ||
translation_danish: [4.86] Så til sidst en lille klokke, en fløjte, en vīṇā, en humlebi og så stilhed. Således høres mangeartede nādaer i midten af kroppen.
translation_english: [4.86] In the last stage, the sounds resemble those from tinklets, flute, Vīṇā, bee, &c. These various kinds of sounds are heard as being produced in the body.

sanskrit: महति स्रूयमाणेऽपि मेघभेर्यादिके ध्वनौ । तत्र सूक्ष्मात्सूक्ष्मतरं नादमेव परामृशेत् ॥८७॥
transliteration: mahati śrūyamāṇe'pi meghabheryādike dhvanau | tatra sūkṣmāt sūkṣmataraṃ nādam eva parāmr̥śet || 4.87 ||
translation_danish: [4.87] Selv når høje lyde af torden, en pauke og så videre høres, bør yogīen fokusere på en nāda, (LENA) der bliver finere og finere.
translation_english: [4.87] Though hearing loud sounds like those of thunder, kettle drums, etc., one should practise with the subtle sounds also.

sanskrit: घनमुत्सृज्य वा सूक्ष्मे सूक्ष्ममुत्सृज्य वा घने । रममाणमपि क्षिप्तं मनो नान्यत्र चालयेत् ॥८८॥
transliteration: ghanam utsr̥jya vā sūkṣme sūkṣmam utsr̥jya vā ghane | ramamāṇam api kṣiptaṃ mano nānyatra cālayet || 4.88 ||
translation_danish: [4.88] Man skal ikke bevæge det hvilende sind andre steder hen, hverken når det er fikseret i den fine lyd efter at have forladt den grove lyd, eller når det er fikseret i den grove lyd efter at have forladt den fine lyd.
translation_english: [4.88] Leaving the loudest, taking up the subtle one, and leaving the subtle one, taking up the loudest, thus practising, the distracted mind does not wander elsewhere.

sanskrit: यत्रकुत्रापि वा नादे लगति प्रथमं मनः । तत्रैव सुस्थिरीभूय तेन सार्धं विलीयते ॥८९॥
transliteration: yatra kutrāpi vā nāde lagati prathamaṃ manaḥ | tatraiva susthirībhūya tena sārdhaṃ vilīyate || 4.89 ||
translation_danish: [4.89] Uanset hvilken lyd sindet først fikseres i, finder det ro og går i opløsning med lyden.
translation_english: [4.89] Wherever the mind attaches itself first, it becomes steady there; and then it becomes absorbed in it.

sanskrit: मकरन्दं पिबन्भृङ्गो गन्धं नापेक्षते यथा । नादासक्तं तथा चित्तं विषयान्नहि काङ्क्षते ॥९०॥
transliteration: makarandaṃ piban bhr̥ṅgo gandhaṃ nāpekṣate yathā | nādāsaktaṃ tathā cittaṃ viṣayān nahi kāṅkṣate || 4.90 ||
translation_danish: [4.90] Ligesom humlebien, der drikker honning, ikke bemærker blomstens duft; ligeså er sindet, der er fikseret i indre lyd, ikke optaget af at nyde ydre objekter.
translation_english: [4.90] Just as a bee, drinking sweet juice, does not care for the smell of the flower; so the mind, absorbed in the nāda, does not desire the objects of enjoyment.

sanskrit: मनोमत्तगजेन्द्रस्य विषयोद्यानचारिणः । नियन्त्रणे समर्थोऽयं निनादनिशिताङ्कुशः ॥९१॥
transliteration: manomattagajendrasya viṣayodyānacāriṇaḥ | niyantraṇe samartho 'yaṃ ninādaniśitāṅkuśaḥ || 4.91 ||
translation_danish: [4.91] Nādaens spidse elefantkrog  er egnet til at kontrollere et sind, der rager rundt i de ydre tings have som en beruset elefantkonge.
translation_english: [4.91] The mind, like an elephant habituated to wander in the garden of enjoyments, is capable of being controlled by the sharp goad of anāhata nāda.

sanskrit: बद्धं तु नादबन्धेन मनः संत्यक्तचापलम् । प्रयाति सुतरां स्थैर्यं छिन्नपक्षः खगो यथा ॥९२॥
transliteration: baddhaṃ tu nādabandhena manaḥ saṃtyaktacāpalam | prayāti sutarāṃ sthairyaṃ chinnapakṣaḥ khago yathā || 4.92 ||
translation_danish: [4.92] Sindet, bundet af lydens bånd og løst af sin urolighed, bliver ubevægelig som en fugl med afskårne vinger.
translation_english: [4.92] The mind, captivated in the snare of nāda, gives up all its activity; and, like a bird with clipped wings, becomes calm at once.

sanskrit: सर्वचिन्तां परित्यज्य सावधानेन चेतसा । नाद एवानुसन्धेयो योगसाम्राज्यमिच्छता ॥९३॥
transliteration: sarvacintāṃ parityajya sāvadhānena cetasā | nāda evānusandheyo yogasāmrājyam icchatā || 4.93 ||
translation_danish: [4.93] Den, der ønsker at mestre alle former for yoga, skal undersøge nāda med et koncentreret sind efter at have kastet alle tanker bort.
translation_english: [4.93] Those desirous of the kingdom of Yoga, should take up the practice of hearing the anāhata nāda, with mind collected and free from all cares.

sanskrit: नादोन्तरङ्गसारङ्गबन्धने वागुरायते । अन्तरङ्गकुरङ्गस्य वधे व्याधायतेऽपि च ॥९४॥
transliteration: nādontaraṅgasāraṅgabandhane  vāgurāyate | antaraṅgakuraṅgasya vadhe vyādhāyate'pi ca || 4.94 ||
translation_danish: [4.94] Nādayoga spreder et net ud for at fange sindets antelope. Derpå bliver den jægeren, der dræber sindets antelope.
translation_english: [4.94] Nada is the snare for catching the mind; and, when it is caught like a deer, it can be killed also like it.

sanskrit: अन्तरङ्गस्य यमिनो वाजिनः परिधायते । नादोपास्तिरतो नित्यमवधार्या हि योगिना ॥९५॥
transliteration: antaraṅgasya yamino vājinaḥ paridhāyate | nādopāstir ato nityam avadhāryā hi yoginā || 4.95 ||
translation_danish: [4.95] Tilbedelsen af lyd tøjler sindets hingst. Derfor bør lyd vedvarende kontempleres af yogien.
translation_english: [4.95] Nāda is the bolt of the stable door for the horse (the minds of the Yogīs). A Yogī should determine to practise constantly in the hearing of the nāda sounds.

sanskrit: बद्धं विमुक्तचाञ्चल्यं नादगन्धकजारणात् । मनः पारदमाप्नोति निरालम्बाख्यखेऽटनम् ॥९६॥
transliteration: baddhaṃ vimuktacāñcalyaṃ nādagandhakajāraṇāt | manaḥ pāradam āpnoti nirālambākhyakhe'ṭanam || 4.96 ||
translation_danish: [4.96] Sindet opnår tilstanden af kviksølv - bundet og udfriet af ustabiliteten - i kraft af mødet med nādaens svovl, bevægende sig frit i det selvopretholdende brahman.
translation_english: [4.96] Mind gets the properties of calcined mercury. When deprived of its unsteadiness it is calcined, combined with the sulphur of nāda, and then it roams like it in tine supportless ākāśa or Brahma.

sanskrit: नादश्रवणतः क्षिप्रमन्तरङ्गभुजङ्गमः । विस्मृत्य सर्वमेकाग्रः कुत्रचिन्नहि धावति ॥९७॥
transliteration: nādaśravaṇataḥ kṣipram antaraṅgabhujaṅgamaḥ | vismr̥tya sarvam ekāgraḥ kutracin nahi dhāvati || 4.97 ||
translation_danish: [4.97] Når sindets dæmoniske slange hører den indre lyd, glemmer den hurtigt alt. Den bliver koncentreret om én ting og kryber ikke andetsteds hen.
translation_english: [4.97] The mind is like a serpent, forgetting all its unsteadiness by hearing the nāda, it does not run away anywhere.

sanskrit: काष्ठे प्रवर्तितो वह्निः काष्ठेन सह शाम्यति । नादे प्रवर्तितं चित्तं नादेन सह लीयते ॥९८॥
transliteration: kāṣṭhe pravartito vahniḥ kāṣṭhena saha śāmyati | nāde pravartitaṃ cittaṃ nādena saha līyate || 4.98 ||
translation_danish: [4.98] En ild antændt i brændet ophører sammen med brændet. Et opildnet sind opløses i lyden sammen med lyden.
translation_english: [4.98] The fire, catching firewood, is extinguished along with it (after burning it up); and so the mind also, working with the nāda, becomes latent along with it.

sanskrit: घण्टादिनादसक्तस्तब्धान्तःकरणहरिणस्य । प्रहरणमपि सुकरं शरसन्धानप्रवीणश्चेत् ॥९९॥
transliteration: ghaṇṭādinādasaktastabdhāntaḥkaraṇahariṇasya | praharaṇam api sukaraṃ śarasandhānapravīṇaś cet || 4.99 || anāhatasya śabdasya dhvanir ya upalabhyate | dhvaner antargataṃ jñeyaṃ jñeyasyāntargataṃ manaḥ |
translation_danish: [4.99] Når sindets antelope er hypnotiseret af lyden af en klokke eller lignende, er den let at ramme for den, der er øvet i at sigte med pil.
translation_english: [4.99] The antahkaraṇa (mind), like a deer, becomes absorbed and motionless on hearing the sound of hells, etc.; and then it is very easy for an expert archer to kill it.
